original: rgyu des na 'dir ni bdag la byed pa med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu des na 'dir ni bdag la byed pa med pa nyid yin la /
translated: For that reason, here there is no activity of self.

original: rtsod pa ni rnam par rtsod pa yin la gang don de khas blangs la ni don med cing 'bras bu med pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsod pa ni rnam par rtsod pa yin la gang don de khas blangs la ni don med cing 'bras bu med pa yin te /
translated: A dispute is a quarrel. One who accepts that meaning is meaningless and fruitless.

original: de la de nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not needed there.

original: ma yin nam zhes pa ni gzhan la bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin nam zhes pa ni gzhan la bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Is it not?‚Äù is a word of inquiry to another.

original: gal te bdag med na 'o na ji ltar byas pa chud zos pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na 'o na ji ltar byas pa chud zos pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur /
translated: If there is no self, then how could the fault of the loss of what was done and so on not occur?

original: de lta bas na rtsod pa don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsod pa don med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the dispute is not meaningless.

original: 'di la rgyu ldan zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ldan zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is endowed with a cause.‚Äù

original: gang rgyu dang ldan pa ni las dang ldan pa yin la de nyid 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang ldan pa ni las dang ldan pa yin la de nyid 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: That which is endowed with a cause is endowed with karma. That itself is endowed with a result because it possesses a result.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mthong ba de ni srid pa ma yin la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mthong ba de ni srid pa ma yin la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not possible and is not observed, because

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: 'jig rten 'chi ba gzhan nyid la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'chi ba gzhan nyid la //
translated: In the world, death is not the same as

original: skye ba yang ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: And birth is also different.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no //üîΩ'o na 'di nyid kyis ni byas pa'i las //üîΩgzhan gyis ji ltar myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma yin no // 'o na 'di nyid kyis ni byas pa'i las // gzhan gyis ji ltar myong bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, that which possesses a cause is not endowed with an effect.üîΩBut how should one understand this statement:

original: zhes brjod pa de ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow can another experience the action of one who has done it?‚Äù

original: 'di la rgyud gcig la ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'di la rgyud gcig la ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúHere, it is said that . . .‚Äù

original: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan skad cig ma du ma brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos pos 'jug pa 'ba' zhig la brten nas du ma rnams la 'jig rten pa'i zhen pas gcig nyid du sgro btags pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis byed pa po dang zaüîΩba po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang gzhan skad cig ma du ma brgyud pa'i mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos pos 'jug pa 'ba' zhig la brten nas du ma rnams la 'jig rten pa'i zhen pas gcig nyid du sgro btags pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis byed pa po dang za ba po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is only in dependence upon the mere engagement in the state of cause and effect, which is characterized by the many different continua and the many different moments, that the world, through its attachment to multiplicity, superimposes oneness. For this reason, the Blessed One taught the self to be the doer and the experiencer.

original: las byed pa po gang yin pa de nyid longs spyod pa po yang yin no zhes bstan pa 'di gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: las byed pa po gang yin pa de nyid longs spyod pa po yang yin no zhes bstan pa 'di gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin la /
translated: The Blessed One taught that the one who does the action is the very same one who experiences the result. He taught this in accordance with the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: gzhan du na skye bos las dang 'bras bu rgyun chad par sems la re zhig sems can 'jig rten gnyi ga'i rjes su 'jug par bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na skye bos las dang 'bras bu rgyun chad par sems la re zhig sems can 'jig rten gnyi ga'i rjes su 'jug par bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, people would think that karma and its effects are cut off. It is not explained that the two worlds of sentient beings and the physical world are momentary.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid du zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di nyid smin par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid du zin pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'di nyid smin par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the matured aggregates, elements, and sense bases of this very life are matured.

original: de bzhin du sems pa'i las kyis bsams pas bsams pa'i las yin no zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems pa'i las kyis bsams pas bsams pa'i las yin no zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Similarly, it is said that karma is intended by the karma of intention, and the karma of intention is mental karma.

original: de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: las rgyas 'jig rten sna tshogs skye //
analyzed: las rgyas 'jig rten sna tshogs skye //
translated: The world's various things arise from karma.

original: las ni sems pa dang des byas//
analyzed: las ni sems pa dang des byas//
translated: Karma is intention and what is produced by it.

original: @234a * // sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
analyzed: @234a * // sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
translated: Intention is mental karma,

original: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
analyzed: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
translated: and what it produces is physical and verbal karma.

original: zhes so // gzhan yang sems can 'jig rten snod kyi 'jig rten ni //
analyzed: zhes so // gzhan yang sems can 'jig rten snod kyi 'jig rten ni //
translated: Moreover, the world of sentient beings and the physical world

original: sna tshogs sems nyid kyis ni sprul pa yin //
analyzed: sna tshogs sems nyid kyis ni sprul pa yin //
translated: are emanated by the mind itself, which is various.

original: las ni sems las ma gtogs yod min dang // 'gro ba ma lus sems las skye bar gsungs //
analyzed: las ni sems las ma gtogs yod min dang // 'gro ba ma lus sems las skye bar gsungs //
translated: Karma does not exist apart from the mind, and all worlds are said to arise from the mind.

original: zhes so // de lta bas na sems las ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin la /üîΩde yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems skyes nas 'gag pa na rang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig la /
analyzed: zhes so // de lta bas na sems las ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin la / de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems skyes nas 'gag pa na rang gi nye bar len pa las byung ba'i sems kyi skad cig la /
translated: Thus, karma that is other than mind does not exist.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa'i bag chags 'jog go //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa'i bag chags 'jog go //
translated: And when a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind arises and ceases, the latent karmic imprint of virtuous or nonvirtuous formations is deposited in the mind that arises from its own appropriation.üîΩAnd that mind that is generated by the latent karmic imprints deposited by that mind continues to operate through a series of other moments that are generated by other and other latent imprints.

original: de yang des gzhag pa'i bag chags gzhan dang gzhan des mngon par 'du byas pa'i skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan rgyun mchad pas 'jug pa na yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de yang des gzhag pa'i bag chags gzhan dang gzhan des mngon par 'du byas pa'i skad cig ma gzhan dang gzhan rgyun mchad pas 'jug pa na yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par nye bar skye'o //
translated: A special transformation arises in that mind.

original: las kyi khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa de lta bu'i rnam pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu 'jig rten pha rol du skyed par byed do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: las kyi khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa de lta bu'i rnam pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu 'jig rten pha rol du skyed par byed do zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that this special transformation, which is consistent with the special karma, generates a result that is a mind with the nature of pleasure, etc., in a subsequent world.

original: dper na de ni sa dang sa bon la sogs pa phan tshun tshogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las thob pa'i khyad par du gyur pas skad cig ma dang po las bskyed pa'i rang gi nye bar len pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa skad cig ma gnyis par gyur
analyzed: dper na de ni sa dang sa bon la sogs pa phan tshun tshogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par las thob pa'i khyad par du gyur pas skad cig ma dang po las bskyed pa'i rang gi nye bar len pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa skad cig ma gnyis par gyur
translated: The final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.

original: pa'i tshogs pa la 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i byad par skyed par gyur nas phyi ma phyi ma khyad par du 'byung ba'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las mtha'i skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid phul du byung ba skyed pa thob po //
analyzed: pa'i tshogs pa la 'bras bu bskyed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i byad par skyed par gyur nas phyi ma phyi ma khyad par du 'byung ba'i rgyud yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par las mtha'i skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid phul du byung ba skyed pa thob po //
translated: The final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.

original: sa bon dang rjes su mthun pa'i s'a lu dang / kota ba'i myu gu skyed par byed de /
analyzed: sa bon dang rjes su mthun pa'i s'a lu dang / kota ba'i myu gu skyed par byed de /
translated: The final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it is generated from the first moment of the sprout.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the seed, because it is generated from the seed.üîΩThe final moment of the sprout is the result of the first moment of the sprout, because it

original: ji ltar yang rgya skyegs kyi khu bas yongs su bsgos pa ma tu lung gal sogs pa'i sa bon btab pas de mngon par 'du byas pa rgyud pas 'jug pa me tog la sogs pa rnams dmar por 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rgya skyegs kyi khu bas yongs su bsgos pa ma tu lung gal sogs pa'i sa bon btab pas de mngon par 'du byas pa rgyud pas 'jug pa me tog la sogs pa rnams dmar por 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, when seeds such as the madhucƒ´ are planted in soil that is completely soaked with lac juice, the flowers and fruits that develop from the seeds are red, because the seeds are impregnated by the juice.

original: de la cung zad kyang snga ma dang phyi mi'i dus su gcig 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la cung zad kyang snga ma dang phyi mi'i dus su gcig 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But in neither case is there any real continuity of the red color from the past to the future.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mtshungs pa la yang rnam par rtog pas gzhag pa'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mtshungs pa la yang rnam par rtog pas gzhag pa'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: And since virtue and nonvirtue are posited by way of conceptualization, it is illogical to posit them as real.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gi rgyud ni 'di nyid la //
analyzed: gang gi rgyud ni 'di nyid la //
translated: In this very continuum,

original: las kyi bag chags gzhag pa las //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags gzhag pa las //
translated: from the placement of the karmic imprints,

original: 'bras bu de nyid la 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'bras bu de nyid la 'gyur te //
translated: the fruit will come to be,

original: ras ba la dmang  po bzhin no //
analyzed: ras ba la dmang  po bzhin no //
translated: like a flower from a madhucƒ´ tree.

original: de lta bas na sa @234b bon la sogs pa rnams la bdag med na yang 'bras bu so sor nges pa yin te nges skye ba yang rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa @234b bon la sogs pa rnams la bdag med na yang 'bras bu so sor nges pa yin te nges skye ba yang rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though there is no self in seeds and so on, the results are individually ascertained, and the arising of the effects occurs in sequence.

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba gcig pu gcig med na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i nges pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba gcig pu gcig med na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i nges pa nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: Likewise, in the present case, even though there is no single, permanent transmigrator who goes to a next world, the result is certain because the nature of cause and effect is certain.

original: las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa'i rgyud ma chad par 'jug pas 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bar brjod do //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa'i rgyud ma chad par 'jug pas 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu thob par 'gyur bar brjod do //
translated: We say that the result is obtained in the next world because the continuum that is conditioned by karma and afflictions is uninterrupted.

original: de'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad par byas pa chud zos pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma byas pa dang phrad par byas pa chud zos pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of encountering what was not done or wasting what was done.

original: de'i phyir bdag med kyang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med kyang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no self, it is not untenable that there is a relationship between karma and effects.

original: ji ltar yang bdag yod par mi 'thad pa de ltar spros na shin tu rgyas par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ji ltar yang bdag yod par mi 'thad pa de ltar spros na shin tu rgyas par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since it would be very extensive to elaborate further on how it is untenable that the self exists,

original: 'dir rgyas par ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par ma brjod do //
translated: I will not elaborate further here.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: bdag med phung po tsam nyid la //
analyzed: bdag med phung po tsam nyid la //
translated: The self is the mere aggregates,

original: nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
analyzed: nyon mongs las kyis mngon du byas //
translated: manifested by karma and afflictions.

original: srid pa bar ma'i rgyud kyis ni //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i rgyud kyis ni //
translated: By the continuum of the intermediate existence,

original: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces gsungs so //
translated: like a lamp, he enters the womb.

original: gang zag tu smra ba de rnams kyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan du 'gegs pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis dngos po dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba de rnams kyis kyang de nyid dang gzhan du 'gegs pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis dngos po dgag pa yin te /
translated: Even those who believe in the person, because they accept the position that refutes identity and difference, have in fact refuted the person.

original: dngos po ni 'di nyid dang gzhan gyi khyad par las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'di nyid dang gzhan gyi khyad par las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the person does not transcend the distinction of being identical to or different from the aggregates.

original: phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pa gcig dgag pa ni gzhan spangs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa dang ldan pa gcig dgag pa ni gzhan spangs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation of one thing that is the contradictory of another is not possible without the negation of the other.

original: khur khyer ba la sogs pa'i mdo sde yang don 'di la gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: khur khyer ba la sogs pa'i mdo sde yang don 'di la gsal ba yin no //
translated: The sutra on the Burden Bearer also clarifies this point.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes pa rnams kyis 'di yongs su brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa mi shes pa rnams kyis 'di yongs su brtags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is a mere conceptual imputation by those who do not understand the intention of the Buddha.

original: dngos por yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos por yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist as a thing.

original: dngos pos blangs pa na yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bdag bkag pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos pos blangs pa na yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bdag bkag pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: When it is taken as a thing, it is not different, and thus it is refuted by the refutation of the self.

original: de lta bas na 'dir khyad par du bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir khyad par du bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not being refuted here.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag las yod na 'bras bu yod kyi byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag las yod na 'bras bu yod kyi byed pa po ni ma dmigs so //
translated: Thus, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúMonks, if there is action, there is the result. But the agent is not apprehended.

original: phung po 'di bor nas phung po gzhan nye bar len pa chos kyi brdar byas pa las gzhan ni med do ;
analyzed: phung po 'di bor nas phung po gzhan nye bar len pa chos kyi brdar byas pa las gzhan ni med do ;
translated: When this body is cast off, another is taken up, which is designated by the conventional term ‚Äòself.‚Äô

original: /'dir yang 'di chos kyi brda yin te /
analyzed: /'dir yang 'di chos kyi brda yin te /
translated: Here, this is the conventional term:

original: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'di yod pas na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄòWhen this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pas na 'di skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas na 'di skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: from the arising of this, that arises.‚Äô

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rkyen 'di btsam gyi mtshan nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis rkyen 'di btsam gyi mtshan nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yang bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the Lord himself has taught that the mere condition is the characteristic of the relation between cause and effect.
Here,

original: yang rgyun cig ces pas tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du ma brtags pa'i ngo bor bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang rgyun cig ces pas tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du ma brtags pa'i ngo bor bstan pa nyid de /
translated: he has taught that the mere continuum is the conventional term, without analyzing the nature of the conventional term.

original: rgyud kyi tshig gis ni rkyen 'di btsam khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi tshig gis ni rkyen 'di btsam khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words of the treatise accept just this condition.

original: gzhan du rgyud nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rgyud nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no continuum.

original: des na dngos po la grub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la yod pa'i skyon gyis gos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po la grub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la yod pa'i skyon gyis gos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the error of the existence of the relation of cause and effect in an existent thing is not incurred.

original: 'di nyid slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This very point is stated by the Master:

original: thams cad nus pa med ce na //üîΩsa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
analyzed: thams cad nus pa med ce na // sa bon sogs ni myug sogs la //
translated: If you say that everything is powerless,üîΩthe power of seeds, etc.

original: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob //üîΩ'dod na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: nus mthong gal te de kun rdzob // 'dod na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur //
translated: with regard to sprouts, etc. is seen.üîΩIf you say that is conventional,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: why do you not accept that in the same way?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa nyid kyis dran pa med pa yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po so sor nges pa nyid kyis dran pa med pa yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: The denial of non-memory is also made by the very restriction of the relation of cause and effect.

original: gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa po 'ga' zhig kyang 'dir yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa po 'ga' zhig kyang 'dir yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no self that is the substratum of the unity, there is no experiencer here at all.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i dbang gis dran pa 'ba' zhig tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i dbang gis dran pa 'ba' zhig tsam yin no //
translated: However, there is just memory, which is a mere superimposition.

original: dngos po'i yul dran par bya ba yang 'dir dran pa bo med na yang nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul dran par bya ba yang 'dir dran pa bo med na yang nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: And the object, the entity, is remembered even though the one who remembers does not exist.

original: nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la dran pa'i sa bon gzhag pa las dus phyis te yongs su smin pa'i rgyu las dran zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i dngos po la rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la dran pa'i sa bon gzhag pa las dus phyis te yongs su smin pa'i rgyu las dran zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The stream of consciousness, having been impressed with the seed of memory by the experience of the entity, later, from the cause of its maturation, the effect called memory arises.

original: de bzhin du ngo shes pa la sogs pa yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngo shes pa la sogs pa yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, recognition, etc., should be considered.

original: de ltar na shin tu mangs pas 'jigs pas so sor 'dir brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu mangs pas 'jigs pas so sor 'dir brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since this would be too much, I will not go into it here.

original: de bsgrubs pa ni gzhan du rgyas par bshad pas der go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bsgrubs pa ni gzhan du rgyas par bshad pas der go bar bya'o //
translated: Its establishment is explained in detail elsewhere, and so it should be understood there.

original: 'di thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las brtsams te bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa las brtsams te bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: All of this is established on the basis of conventional truth.

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir dang ; rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun chad pa'i phyir cung zad kyang skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir dang ; rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun chad pa'i phyir cung zad kyang skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because ultimately all phenomena are essenceless, and because all conceptual thought is cut off, there is not the slightest bit of arising or ceasing, cause or effect, self or selflessness.

original: rnam par dpyad pa na las dang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa na las dang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When analyzed, karma and its effects do not exist.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te rtog pas sprul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te rtog pas sprul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Neither this world nor the next world exist in the slightest, because they are imagined.

original: de lta bas na 'di thams cad gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di thams cad gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all of this is like a reflection.

original: rang bzhin med pa skye zhing 'gag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa skye zhing 'gag pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod do //
translated: It is said that the essenceless arises and ceases, and that it has cause and effect, self and selflessness, permanence and impermanence.

original: rmi lam bzhin du las dang / @235b byed pa po dang / de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po dang / 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du las dang / @235b byed pa po dang / de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po dang / 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba yang yin te /
translated: and like a dream, there is karma, the agent, the experiencer of the effects of karma, this world, the next world, good destinies, bad destinies, and transmigration.

original: rtog pa rnams ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa rnams ma spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conceptualization is not abandoned.

original: de ltar na thams cad legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, everything is well established.

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba /üîΩde ltar 'gag pa yod min zhing //
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba / de ltar 'gag pa yod min zhing //
translated: As will be explained,

original: dngos po yang yod min de'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos po yang yod min de'i phyir //
translated: It is not that it exists and then later becomes nonexistent.üîΩNor is it that it exists and then later becomes nonexistent.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad ni //
translated: Therefore, all of these transmigrating beings

original: rtag tu ma skyes ma 'gags nyid //
analyzed: rtag tu ma skyes ma 'gags nyid //
translated: Are always unborn and unceasing.

original: 'gro ba rmi lam lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba rmi lam lta bu ste //
translated: Transmigrating beings are like a dream.

original: chu shing bzhin du snying po med //
analyzed: chu shing bzhin du snying po med //
translated: Like a plantain tree, they have no core.üîΩAnd so on.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yang yin te /
translated: You have said that conventionally

original: byed pa rang dbang las kyang ni //
analyzed: byed pa rang dbang las kyang ni //
translated: Things arise from other.

original: tha snyad du ni khyed kyis gsungs //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni khyed kyis gsungs //
translated: You accept that they are established

original: phan tshun ltos nas grub pa ni //üîΩgnyis po de dag bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas grub pa ni //üîΩgnyis po de dag bzhed pa yin //
translated: In mutual dependence.

original: byed po med cing za ba med //
analyzed: byed po med cing za ba med //
translated: There is no agent and no experiencer.

original: bsod nams yod min rkyen 'byung ba //
analyzed: bsod nams yod min rkyen 'byung ba //
translated: There is no merit, and conditions arise.

original: brten nas 'byung ba ma skyes shes //
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba ma skyes shes //
translated: One should know that dependent arising is unarisen.

original: tshig gi dbang po khyed kyis gsungs //
analyzed: tshig gi dbang po khyed kyis gsungs //
translated: You, the Lord of Speech, have taught this.

original: zhes so // ji ltar na chos thams cad bdag med pa la las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa mi 'gal ba yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes so // ji ltar na chos thams cad bdag med pa la las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa mi 'gal ba yang yin la /
translated: How is it that the connection between actions and effects is not contradictory in the absence of self in all phenomena?

original: rang bzhin med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang yin te /
translated: And how is it that there is no essence?

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i chos mi 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i chos mi 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: And how is it that the view of the absence of self is not contradictory with what is commonly perceived?

original: de ltar yang yab dang sras mjal ba las gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang yab dang sras mjal ba las gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Meeting of Father and Son S≈´tra explains this.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du byis ba so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa yang mig gis gzugs mthong na btang snyoms su 'gyur ba rnams la yang mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du byis ba so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa yang mig gis gzugs mthong na btang snyoms su 'gyur ba rnams la yang mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, in the same way, childish ordinary beings who are not learned, when their eyes see forms, become attached to those that are pleasant.

original: mngon par zhen nas shin tu rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen nas shin tu rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are attached, they become confused.

original: shin tu rmongs nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become completely defiled by extreme delusion.

original: kun nas nyon mongs nas gti mug las byung ba'i las lus kyis ni rnam pa gsum /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs nas gti mug las byung ba'i las lus kyis ni rnam pa gsum /
translated: Having become defiled, they create karma born of delusion, with the body in three ways,

original: ngag gis rnam pa bzhi /
analyzed: ngag gis rnam pa bzhi /
translated: with speech in four ways,

original: yid kyis rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: yid kyis rnam pa gsum mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: and with the mind in three ways.

original: las mngon par 'du byas na de yang thog ma nyid nas zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las mngon par 'du byas na de yang thog ma nyid nas zad cing 'gags la bral zhing rnam par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When they have created karma, that karma also ceases and ends from the very beginning, and it is separated from and transformed into something else.

original: shar phyogs su brten te gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shar phyogs su brten te gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not remain supported in the east,

original: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su brten te gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su brten te gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor does it remain supported in the south, west, north, below, above, or in the intermediate directions.

original: 'di na ma yin /üîΩpha gi na ma yin /
analyzed: 'di na ma yin / pha gi na ma yin /
translated: It is not here,üîΩnor is it over there,

original: bar don ma yin te /
analyzed: bar don ma yin te /
translated: nor is it in between.

original: dus gzhan na 'chi ba'i dus dang / tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe spog gi dbang po 'gags nye /
analyzed: dus gzhan na 'chi ba'i dus dang / tshod nye bar gnas pa'i tshe spog gi dbang po 'gags nye /
translated: When the time of death arrives, and the end of life is near, the faculties cease to function.

original: tshe yongs @236a * //
analyzed: tshe yongs @236a * //
translated: Life

original: su zad cing de dang skal pa 'dra ba'i las rnams kyang zad nas /
analyzed: su zad cing de dang skal pa 'dra ba'i las rnams kyang zad nas /
translated: is completely used up, and the karma that is of a kind with it is also exhausted.

original: rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gags pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gags pa'i tshe /
translated: When the final consciousness ceases,

original: 'di lta ste dper na nyal nyal ba las sad pas yul gyi bzang mo yid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nyal nyal ba las sad pas yul gyi bzang mo yid kyis dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is like a person who has fallen asleep and in a dream sees a beautiful woman.

original: rgyal po chen po de la rnam par shes pa tha ma'i dbang dang / las dmigs pa de dang rkyen gnyis kyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po de 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la rnam par shes pa tha ma'i dbang dang / las dmigs pa de dang rkyen gnyis kyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang po de 'byung ba ste /
translated: Great King, the first moment of consciousness at rebirth occurs due to the power of the final moment of consciousness and the object that is focused on.

original: dmyal ba'am / dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
analyzed: dmyal ba'am / dud 'gro'i skye gnas sam /
translated: It may be in the hells, or in the animal realm,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten nam /
translated: or in the world of Yama,

original: lha ma yin gyi tshogs sam /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi tshogs sam /
translated: or in the assembly of demigods,

original: mi rnams sam /
analyzed: mi rnams sam /
translated: or among humans,

original: lha rnams su dang po'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams su dang po'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: or among the gods.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i char gtogs pa de 'gags ma thag tu bar ma chad par gang la rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba mngon pa'i sems kyi rgyud skal pa dang 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po skye ba'i char gtogs pa de 'gags ma thag tu bar ma chad par gang la rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba mngon pa'i sems kyi rgyud skal pa dang 'dra bar 'byung ngo //
translated: When the first moment of consciousness arises, immediately after the first moment of consciousness ceases, without interruption, a mental continuum that experiences the ripening of karma arises in a way that is consistent with the conditions.

original: de la gang rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gags pa de ni 'chi 'pho zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gyur /
analyzed: de la gang rnam par shes pa tha ma 'gags pa de ni 'chi 'pho zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gyur /
translated: The last moment of consciousness ceases and is called death.

original: gang rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ba de ni skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa dang po 'byung ba de ni skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The first moment of consciousness arises and is called birth.

original: rgyal po chen po de ltar na chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba yang med la /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ltar na chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba yang med la /
translated: Great King, in this way, no phenomenon whatsoever transmigrates from this existence to the next.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye bar mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye bar mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: Yet, death and rebirth are evident.

original: rgyal po chen po rnam par shes pa tha ma de skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mo 'ong /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam par shes pa tha ma de skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mo 'ong /
translated: Great King, when the last moment of consciousness arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: las de yang skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: las de yang skye ba'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: When karma arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po de yang skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po de yang skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: When the first moment of consciousness arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tha ma ni rnam par shes pa thams stong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tha ma ni rnam par shes pa thams stong /
translated: The final consciousness is empty of all consciousness.

original: las ni las kyis stong /
analyzed: las ni las kyis stong /
translated: Karma is empty of karma.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa dang pos stong /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po ni rnam par shes pa dang pos stong /
translated: The first consciousness is empty of the first consciousness.

original: 'chi 'pho ni 'chi 'phos stong /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ni 'chi 'phos stong /
translated: Death and transmigration are empty of death and transmigration.

original: skye ba ni skye bas stong la /
analyzed: skye ba ni skye bas stong la /
translated: Birth is empty of birth.

original: las rnams 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur bar yang mngon zhing rnam par smin pa myong bar mngon pa yang yod de /
analyzed: las rnams 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur bar yang mngon zhing rnam par smin pa myong bar mngon pa yang yod de /
translated: But karma does not become fruitless and it is evident that the experience of karmic maturation exists.

original: de la ming gi brda tsam gtogs par byed pa po'am /
analyzed: de la ming gi brda tsam gtogs par byed pa po'am /
translated: There is no agent there apart from the mere designation of a name.

original: zab po gang yang med do zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: zab po gang yang med do zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: There is no experiencer there apart from the mere designation of a name.üîΩAnd so on at length.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi las rnams kyis 'dus byas pa ji ltar rig par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi las rnams kyis 'dus byas pa ji ltar rig par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the karma of hatred and delusion.üîΩThe Rice Seedling S≈´tra also says,

original: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang @236b gzhan yang de kho na mi rtogs shing log par shes te mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang @236b gzhan yang de kho na mi rtogs shing log par shes te mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, not understanding reality, having mistaken knowledge, and being ignorant is ignorance.

original: de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnam gsum mngon pa la 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa yod na 'du byed rnam gsum mngon pa la 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, if ignorance exists, the three kinds of formative forces are established in the manifest.

original: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba dang / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: They are those that lead to merit, those that lead to demerit, and those that lead to the imperturbable.

original: de la bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: From the formative forces that lead to merit, the consciousness that leads to merit comes to be.

original: 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe formative forces with ignorance as their condition.‚Äù

original: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: From the formative forces that lead to demerit, the consciousness that leads to demerit comes to be.

original: 'di ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúconsciousness with the formative forces as its condition.‚Äù

original: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed rnams las mi g-yo bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: From the formative forces that lead to the imperturbable, the consciousness that leads to the imperturbable comes to be.

original: 'di nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúname and form‚Äù conditioned by consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel bas skye mched drug gi sgo nas bya ba byed pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs rnam par 'phel bas skye mched drug gi sgo nas bya ba byed pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: With the growth of name and form, the six sense bases come into existence.

original: de ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúthe six sense bases‚Äù conditioned by name and form.

original: skye mched drug po dag las reg pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug po dag las reg pa'i tshogs drug 'byung ste /
translated: From the six sense bases, the six classes of contact come into existence.

original: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúcontact‚Äù conditioned by the six sense bases.

original: ji lta bur reg pa 'byung ba de lta bur tshor ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji lta bur reg pa 'byung ba de lta bur tshor ba 'byung ste /
translated: Whatever kind of contact comes into existence, that kind of feeling comes into existence.

original: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù conditioned by contact.

original: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bye brag de dag myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen nas 'dug pa de ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The experience of those various feelings, the delight in them, the craving for them, the attachment to them, and the desire to grasp them is called ‚Äúcraving‚Äù conditioned by feeling.

original: myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhin nas 'dug pa las bdag sdug pa'i ngo bo dang / bde ba'i ngo bo dang 'bral bar ma gyur cig snyam du yongs su mi gtong bar phyir zhing smon pa 'di ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: myong ba dang / mngon par dga' ba dang / lhag par zhin nas 'dug pa las bdag sdug pa'i ngo bo dang / bde ba'i ngo bo dang 'bral bar ma gyur cig snyam du yongs su mi gtong bar phyir zhing smon pa 'di ni sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition of becoming is the karma that is accumulated by the craving that is the desire to be united with the pleasant, the desire not to be separated from the pleasant, the desire to be separated from the unpleasant, and the desire that what is neither pleasant nor unpleasant should remain just as it is.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.

original: de ltar smon cing yang srid pa skye ba'i las lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar smon cing yang srid pa skye ba'i las lus dang ngag dang yid kyis kun nas slong ba de ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.

original: las de las skyes pa'i phung po lnga gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las de las skyes pa'i phung po lnga gang yin pa de ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.üîΩThe condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from birth.üîΩThe condition of birth is the arising of the five aggregates that are produced by that karma.

original: skye ma nas mngon du grub pa'i phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //üîΩgzhan la'ang @237a * //
analyzed: skye ma nas mngon du grub pa'i phung po rnams kyi 'phel ba yongs su smin pa dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya'o //üîΩgzhan la'ang @237a * //
translated: The condition of old age and death is the growth, maturation, and destruction of the aggregates that have arisen from

original: 'dre'o // de la rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
analyzed: 'dre'o // de la rnam par shes pa ni sa bon gyi rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
translated: Consciousness is the cause in the sense of being the seed.

original: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
analyzed: las ni zhing gi rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
translated: Karma is the cause in the sense of being the field.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gyis rgyu byed do //
translated: Ignorance and craving are the causes in the sense of being the afflictions.

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sa bon rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sa bon rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
translated: Here, karma and the afflictions produce the seed, consciousness.

original: de la las ni sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de la las ni sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba byed do //
translated: Here, karma is the field for the seed, consciousness.

original: sred pa ni sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par byed do //
analyzed: sred pa ni sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par byed do //
translated: Craving moistens the seed, consciousness.

original: ma rig pa ni sa bon rnam par shes pa 'debs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni sa bon rnam par shes pa 'debs te /
translated: Ignorance plants the seed, consciousness.

original: rkyen 'di dag med na sa bon rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen 'di dag med na sa bon rnam par shes pa mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If these conditions are absent, the seed, consciousness, will not manifest.

original: de la las kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de la las kyang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa'i zhing gi bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Here, karma does not think, ‚ÄúI will perform the action of being the field for the seed, consciousness.‚Äù

original: sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: sred pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa brlan par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Craving does not think, ‚ÄúI moisten the seed of consciousness.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab bo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang 'di snyam du bdag gis sa bon rnam par shes pa gdab bo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Ignorance does not think, ‚ÄúI plant the seed of consciousness.‚Äù

original: sa bon rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: sa bon rnam par shes pa yang 'di snyam du bdag ni rkyen 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du mi sems te /
translated: The seed of consciousness does not think, ‚ÄúI am generated by these conditions.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes pa las kyi zhing la brten pa sred pa'i rlan gyis brlan pa ma rig pa'i lud kyis bran pa skye ba na skye ba'i gnas nying mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon rnam par shes pa las kyi zhing la brten pa sred pa'i rlan gyis brlan pa ma rig pa'i lud kyis bran pa skye ba na skye ba'i gnas nying mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub
translated: Nevertheless, from the seed of consciousness, in dependence on the field of karma, moistened by the moisture of craving, fertilized by the manure of ignorance, the sprout of name and form arises in that and that rebirth, in the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: ste / ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas /
analyzed: ste / ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas /
translated: That sprout of name and form is not made by itself,

original: gzhan gyis ma byas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas /
translated: not made by another,

original: gnyi gas ma byas /
analyzed: gnyi gas ma byas /
translated: not made by both,

original: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis ma byas /
translated: not created by ƒ™≈õvara,

original: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
analyzed: dus kyis ma bsgyur /
translated: not transformed by time,

original: rang bzhin las ma byung /
analyzed: rang bzhin las ma byung /
translated: not derived from prak·πõti,üîΩand not born without any cause.

original: byed pa la rag las pa ma yin /
analyzed: byed pa la rag las pa ma yin /
translated: It is not dependent on a creator.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te /üîΩ'on kyang pha dang ma phrad pa dang / dus dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gzhan yang tshogs na bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te / 'on kyang pha dang ma phrad pa dang / dus dang ldan pa dang / rkyen gzhan yang tshogs na bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: It is not born from a non-cause.

original: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der myong ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par bsgrub bo
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag la rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nyid mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de dang der myong ba dang ldan pa'i sa bon rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par bsgrub bo
translated: However, when the father and mother come together, when the time is right, and when other conditions are present, then the seed of consciousness, which is endowed with experience, establishes the sprout of name-and-form in that and that birthplace, which is connected to the womb of the mother, in the absence of a self, in the absence of a being, in the absence of a life, in the absence of a creature, in the absence of a person, in the absence of an individual soul, in the absence of a man, in the absence of an owner, in the absence of a self, in the absence of an ‚ÄúI,‚Äù in the absence of a ‚Äúmine,‚Äù in the absence of grasping, and which is similar to space,üîΩand which has the nature of the characteristics of illusion, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete.

original: // gzhan la yang bsgre'o //
analyzed: // gzhan la yang bsgre'o //
translated: This should be applied to other [cases] as well.

original: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'pho mod kyi /
analyzed: de la chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'pho mod kyi /
translated: In this way, no phenomenon whatsoever passes from this world to the next world.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu mngon pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu mngon pa yang yod do //
translated: However, because the causes and conditions are not incomplete, the result of karma is also evident.

original: gzhan @237b la yang bsgre'o //
analyzed: gzhan @237b la yang bsgre'o //
translated: This should be applied to other [cases] as well.

original: 'di lta ste dper na me ni rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na me ni rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang na mi 'bar gyi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las 'bar ro //
translated: For example, fire does not burn when its causes and conditions are incomplete, but when they are complete, it burns.

original: de bzhin du bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag pa rgyu dang rkyen du mas ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nying mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag po med pa'i chos bdag gi med pa 'dzin pa med pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dag pa rgyu dang rkyen du mas ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba'i gnas nying mtshams sbyor ba ma'i mngal de
translated: In the same way, in the absence of a self, a sentient being, a life-force, or a person, the unborn, unceasing, and originally quiescent nature of phenomena, which is devoid of self and entities connected to the self, and which is like space, arises from the coming together of many causes and conditions.

original: dang der sa bon rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: dang der sa bon rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi myu gu mngon par bsgrubs te /
translated: In this way, the seed of consciousness, which is produced by karma and mental afflictions, establishes the sprout of name and form in this and that place of birth, in this and that womb.

original: de ltar nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rkyen dang 'brel par blta'o //
translated: In this way, one should see internal dependent arising in terms of its relation to conditions.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa lngar blta ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa lngar blta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this regard, internal dependent arising should be seen in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rtag par ma yin pa dang / chad par ma yin pa dang / 'pho bar ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba dang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o //üîΩji ltar rtag par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtag par ma yin pa dang / chad par ma yin pa dang / 'pho bar ma yin pa dang / rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba dang de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud du'o // ji ltar rtag par ma yin zhe na /
translated: It is not annihilated because the aggregates at death cease and the aggregates at birth arise.

original: gang gi tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: gang gi tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang gzhan la skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams kyang gzhan te /
translated: It is not transferred because the aggregates at death are one thing and the aggregates at birth are another.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams yin gyi /
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po gang yin pa de nyid skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnams yin gyi /
translated: The aggregates at death are not the aggregates at birth.

original: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gag pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha ma 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gag pa skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'byung bas de'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates at death cease and the aggregates at birth arise. Therefore, it is not eternal.

original: ji ltar chad par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chad par ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not annihilated?

original: tha ma'i 'chi ba'i phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: tha ma'i 'chi ba'i phung po rnams sngon 'gags pa las skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams 'byung ba ma yin /
translated: The aggregates at birth do not arise from the prior cessation of the aggregates at death.

original: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi tha ma'i 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa las kyang ma yin gyi tha ma'i 'chi ba'i phung po rnams kyang 'gags la de nyid kyi tshe skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po rnams srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it arise from something that has not ceased, but rather, the aggregates that are the end of death cease and at the same time, the aggregates that are the beginning of birth arise, like the rising and falling of a scale‚Äôs beam.

original: de'i phyir chad par ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chad par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no annihilation.

original: ji ltar 'pho bar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'pho bar ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is there no transmigration?

original: sems can gyi rigs mi 'dra bas na de skal pa mnyam pa'i skye ba skye bar grub pas de'i phyir 'pho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs mi 'dra bas na de skal pa mnyam pa'i skye ba skye bar grub pas de'i phyir 'pho ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the birth of a being of a different class is not established, therefore there is no transmigration.

original: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po 'byung zhe na /
translated: How is it that a great result arises from a small cause?

original: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po rnam par smin pa myong ste /
analyzed: las chung ngu byas pa las 'bras bu chen po rnam par smin pa myong ste /
translated: A great result is experienced from a small action.

original: de'i phyir rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen po mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, a great result is produced from a small cause.

original: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dang 'dra ba'i rgyud yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the continuum is similar?

original: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de lta bur myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong bas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i @238a * //
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa de lta bur myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa myong bas de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i @238a * //
translated: The maturation of karma is experienced in accordance with the karma that was created. Therefore, the continuum is similar to that.

original: rgyud do // de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa lnga yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud do // de ltar na nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam pa lnga yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, internal dependent origination has five aspects.

original: de lta bas na bdag la sogs pa med kyang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ma nyams par mdo las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag la sogs pa med kyang las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ma nyams par mdo las bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, although there is no self, etc., the connection between karma and its effects is not undermined, as the BhagavƒÅn himself has said in the s≈´tras.

original: de ltar na gcig pu zhig gnyi gang 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa yang cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig pu zhig gnyi gang 'gro ba yod pa ma yin pa yang cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, although there is no single entity that is both the goer and the going, there is no contradiction whatsoever.

original: gal te ji ltar yang bdag med na 'o na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yang bdag med na 'o na /
translated: If the self does not exist in any way,üîΩthen how should we understand the following statement?

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin gyi //
translated: You are your own protector

original: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur //üîΩbdag nyid legs par dul ba yis//
analyzed: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du 'gyur // bdag nyid legs par dul ba yis//
translated: Who else can be your protector?üîΩThe wise who are well trained

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: Attain the higher realms.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is this stated in the verse?

original: sems nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag gi sbrar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag gi sbrar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because mind-itself is the basis of the conception of a self, it is called ‚ÄúI‚Äù in this verse.

original: mdo sde gzhan du /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan du /
translated: In another sutra,

original: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste //
analyzed: sems 'dul ba ni legs pa ste //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIt is good to tame the mind.

original: sems 'dul bas ni bde ba 'thog /
analyzed: sems 'dul bas ni bde ba 'thog /
translated: By taming the mind, one attains happiness.‚Äù

original: ces sems 'dul ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces sems 'dul ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the mind is to be tamed,üîΩand because of the statement in the Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ Sutra,üîΩ‚ÄúThe mind is the creator; the mind is the world.üîΩThe mind itself is the one who goes to the happy realms and the one who goes to the lower realms.üîΩThe mind itself is the one who creates all the various appearances of the world and beings.‚Äù

original: de yang bdag tu lta ba'i mngon par zhen par gyur pa la gzhan du bdag 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i don du dang ba'i don gyis kun rdzob tu sems la bdag ces bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang bdag tu lta ba'i mngon par zhen par gyur pa la gzhan du bdag 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i don du dang ba'i don gyis kun rdzob tu sems la bdag ces bstan pa yin te /
translated: The mind is taught to be the self in a conventional sense, in order to abandon the conception of a self elsewhere, for those who are attached to the view of a self.

original: don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ma yin no //
translated: It is not in an ultimate sense.

original: 'dis ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
translated: This also proves the statement in the Descent into La·πÖkƒÅ Sutra:üîΩThe continuum of the person, the aggregates,

original: gang zag rgyud dang phung po dang // rkyen dang rgyu dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: gang zag rgyud dang phung po dang // rkyen dang rgyu dang de bzhin du //
translated: conditions, causes, and likewise

original: gtso bo dbang phyug byed pa po //
analyzed: gtso bo dbang phyug byed pa po //
translated: primordial matter, ƒ™≈õvara, and the creator

original: sems tsam nyid du nga smra'o //üîΩzhes pas de yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam nyid du nga smra'o //üîΩzhes pas de yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: I declare all of these to be mind only.

original: gang gi phyir des kyang gzhan du gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i ched du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir des kyang gzhan du gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i ched du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Because it was also taught in order to stop the conception of a person as something else.

original: sems don dam par yod pa kho nar gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems don dam par yod pa kho nar gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the mind is taught to exist ultimately.

original: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rnams la bdag bstan pa yang drang ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa rnams la bdag bstan pa yang drang ba'i don yin no //
translated: In the same way, the teaching of a self in the aggregates and so on is also of provisional meaning.

original: de'i phyir dngos po la sems kyang nga'o snyam nas shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po la sems kyang nga'o snyam nas shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am a thing.‚Äù

original: sems don dam par yod pa yin pa de lta na yang dngos po la de ngar 'dzin pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems don dam par yod pa yin pa de lta na yang dngos po la de ngar 'dzin pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the mind exists ultimately, it is not the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù in order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'das dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The past and futureüîΩare not the object of the thought ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung nas sems ni rnam pa gsum du srid de /üîΩ'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung nas sems ni rnam pa gsum du srid de / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: The mind is possible in three modes, in terms of the past, future, and present.

original: de la @238b 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la @238b 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni zhig pa dang / ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: The past and future are destroyed and not yet arisen, respectively.üîΩThe present is the mind that is presently occurring.

original: de'i sems ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: de'i sems ni bdag yin te /
translated: The mind is the self.

original: bdag tu mthong ba'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu mthong ba'i yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of the view of self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems de ni de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems de ni de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The past and future minds do not exist in that way.

original: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are destroyed and not yet arisen.

original: gang 'das pa de ni zad cing 'gags la bral zhing yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'das pa de ni zad cing 'gags la bral zhing yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: That which is past is exhausted, ceased, separated, and transformed.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa de ni ma thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa de ni ma thob pa yin no //
translated: That which is future is not yet obtained.

original: de ltar na da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag tu 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: de ltar na da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag tu 'gyur zhes /
translated: Thus, the present mind would be the self.üîΩBut if it is said, ‚ÄúThe arisen mind is the self,‚Äù

original: 'on te skyes zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te skyes zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then that is also not tenable, because

original: ji ltar skyes pa'i da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag yin pa de ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir de ni zhig na rang bdag med de /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa'i da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag yin pa de ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir de ni zhig na rang bdag med de /
translated: when it has arisen, the present mind does not exist as a self.

original: yang 'di la da ltar byung ba'i sems zhig ste /
analyzed: yang 'di la da ltar byung ba'i sems zhig ste /
translated: Moreover, the present mind is destroyed.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'das na yang bdag yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'das na yang bdag yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When it is past in the second moment, the self does not exist.

original: yang phyi nas sngar 'dzin pa'i sems kyang zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang phyi nas sngar 'dzin pa'i sems kyang zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, later on, the mind that apprehends the past will also cease.

original: da ltar byung ba gnas par dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba gnas par dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The present is not observed to endure.

original: de lta bas na gang gis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i sems ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gis dmigs par 'gyur ba'i sems ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how could the mind that is observed exist?

original: de lta bas na sems dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems dmigs pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not observed as existent.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid du ngar 'dzin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid du ngar 'dzin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù arises in the absence of observation.

original: de bzhin du bdag med de bdag yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med de bdag yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, the self does not exist, because the self does not exist.

original: dus gsum du 'byung ba'i sems nyid de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du 'byung ba'i sems nyid de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the self is the mind that occurs in the three times.

original: sems bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: sems bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established that the mind is not the object of the apprehension of the self,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to summarize his point,

original: dper na chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na chu shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFor example, it is like the trunk of a plantain tree.‚Äù

original: dper na chu shing gi sdong po ste /
analyzed: dper na chu shing gi sdong po ste /
translated: For example, it is like the trunk of a plantain tree.

original: chu shing sdong bu'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: chu shing sdong bu'i dum bu'o //
translated: The trunk of a plantain tree is a section of a plantain trunk.

original: phye zhing so sor cha shas su phye ste rnam par gzhig pa byas na dngos po cung zad yod pa yang mi rnyed de /
analyzed: phye zhing so sor cha shas su phye ste rnam par gzhig pa byas na dngos po cung zad yod pa yang mi rnyed de /
translated: If one analyzes and divides it into parts, and then destroys it, one does not find even the slightest thing.

original: de bzhin du bdag yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, the self does not exist.

original: chu shing bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu shing bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a plantain tree.

original: bdag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pa yod par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pa yod par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the object of the cognition that apprehends the self, and it does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the son of a barren woman, who does not exist.

original: 'di la khyad par cung zad yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par cung zad yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is that there is not the slightest difference between them.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: btsal zhing brtags te nges par dpyad pa na'o //
analyzed: btsal zhing brtags te nges par dpyad pa na'o //
translated: When one searches for it, examines it, and analyzes it.

original: gzhan yang bdag la gnod par byed pa dgag pa'i ched du thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag la gnod par byed pa dgag pa'i ched du thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa /
translated: Moreover, in order to refute the self that is the object of harm, he states the consequence:

original: gal te sems zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs @239a * //
analyzed: gal te sems zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs @239a * //
translated: If the mind does not exist,

original: te ; gal te rnam pa thams cad du sems can dang bdag dang gang zag rnam par dpyad pa na yod min te /
analyzed: te ; gal te rnam pa thams cad du sems can dang bdag dang gang zag rnam par dpyad pa na yod min te /
translated: if the mind does not exist in any way, when sentient beings, the self, and persons are analyzed,

original: med na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis snying rje zhing brtse ba bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: med na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis snying rje zhing brtse ba bsgom par bya ste /
translated: If not, then at that time the bodhisattvas should cultivate compassion and loving kindness.

original: sems can med par gang la dmigs nas 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can med par gang la dmigs nas 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: For, if there are no sentient beings, with respect to what would one engage by taking it as an object?

original: snying rje yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa yin te /
