translated: Compassion is the cause of the attainment of perfect enlightenment,

original: de sngon du song ba'i tshogs rgyur gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon du song ba'i tshogs rgyur gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, when it precedes, one engages in generosity and so on, which are the causes of the collections.

original: de lta bas na snying rje sngon du song ba'i sangs rgyas dang chos thams cad rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na snying rje sngon du song ba'i sangs rgyas dang chos thams cad rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, compassion precedes all the buddhas and all the teachings.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is also stated in the noble Dharma-sa·πÉgiti:

original: des na yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: des na yang byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva noble Avalokite≈õvara said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos mang po rnams la bslab par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos mang po rnams la bslab par mi bgyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLord, bodhisattvas should not train in many dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos shin tu mang po la bslab par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos shin tu mang po la bslab par mi bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas should not train in too many dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos gcig rab tu gzung zhing rab tu rtogs par bgyis na bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de'i lag mthil du mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpas chos gcig rab tu gzung zhing rab tu rtogs par bgyis na bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad de'i lag mthil du mchis pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattvas hold to and understand one single dharma, then all the buddhadharmas will be in the palms of their hands, Blessed One.

original: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that one single dharma?

original: 'di lta ste snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is great compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das snying rje chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil du mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snying rje chen pos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil du mchis pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, all the buddhadharmas are in the palms of bodhisattvas‚Äô hands through great compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che gang du mchis pa der dpung gi tshogs thams cad mchi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'khor lo rin po che gang du mchis pa der dpung gi tshogs thams cad mchi'o //
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: wherever the precious wheel of a wheel-turning king goes, there his entire army goes.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po gang du mchis pa der yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mchi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po gang du mchis pa der yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mchi'o //
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, wherever there is a bodhisattva‚Äôs great compassion, there are all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na srog gi dbang po mchis na dbang po gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na srog gi dbang po mchis na dbang po gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, for example, when there is the faculty of life, the other faculties occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du snying rje chen po mchis na byang chub par byed pa'i chos gzhan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du snying rje chen po mchis na byang chub par byed pa'i chos gzhan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, when there is great compassion, the other qualities that create enlightenment occur.

original: 'phags pa ga ya mgo ri las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa ga ya mgo ri las kyang /
translated: And in the ƒÄrya-gayƒÅ≈õƒ´r·π£a:

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sprod pa gang la brtsam par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sprod pa gang la brtsam par bya zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, what should bodhisattvas undertake to do?

original: gang la @239b brten par bya /
analyzed: gang la @239b brten par bya /
translated: What should they rely on?‚Äù

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ replied,

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni snying rje chen po la brtsams te /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni snying rje chen po la brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúDivine prince, bodhisattvas should undertake great compassion.

original: sems can la brten pa'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can la brten pa'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: They should rely on sentient beings.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na nges par dang por sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na nges par dang por sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one must definitely accept compassion that has sentient beings as its object at the outset,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can la brten nas de 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sems can la brten nas de 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it arises in dependence on sentient beings who are suffering.

original: sems can med na der mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes pa ni gal te de ltar sems na'o //
analyzed: sems can med na der mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes pa ni gal te de ltar sems na'o //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf there were no sentient beings, it would not be that way,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: then at that time, one should not say this.

original: 'bras bu don du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu don du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of the result‚Äù and so on.

original: dgos pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya ste /
analyzed: dgos pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya ste /
translated: The purpose is the desired goal.

original: skyes bu'i don zhes brjod do //üîΩde'i don du khas blangs pas ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don zhes brjod do // de'i don du khas blangs pas ste /
translated: It is called the ‚Äúaim of a person.‚Äù

original: des na khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of that, one must accept it.

original: rmongs pas kun rdzob tu btags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pas kun rdzob tu btags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is imputed conventionally out of delusion,

original: sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: that is, superimposition,

original: sems can de la'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can de la'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: is in regard to that sentient being.

original: 'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: Thus, free from all conceptualization,

original: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba skyes bu mchog gi don yin pas sangs rgyas nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba skyes bu mchog gi don yin pas sangs rgyas nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Since the purpose of the supreme person is complete liberation from all obscurations, one should accomplish buddhahood here.

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa dang bral nas thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa dang bral nas thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that is not attained without being free from the non-observation of all phenomena.

original: de yang shes rab phul du phyin pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang shes rab phul du phyin pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that is accomplished by the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang gus shing bar mchod pa yun ring por goms par byas pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gus shing bar mchod pa yun ring por goms par byas pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that arises from long-term familiarization with respect and veneration.

original: de rtsom pa yang snying rje'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rtsom pa yang snying rje'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that undertaking arises through the power of compassion.

original: de yang dang por sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la 'jug pa na tshogs kyi rgyu rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dang por sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams la 'jug pa na tshogs kyi rgyu rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when that first engages suffering sentient beings, the cause of the collection is undertaken.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu'i don du rmongs pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu'i don du rmongs pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, for the sake of the result, one accepts the essence of conventional truth, which is ignorance.

original: de'i phyir dang por sems can la dmigs pa nyid kyi snying rje yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por sems can la dmigs pa nyid kyi snying rje yin la /
translated: Therefore, first there is compassion that focuses on sentient beings.

original: de nas gzhan don la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas gzhan don la dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Then, it is focused on the benefit of others, and it is not focused.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te rnam pa thams cad du sems can yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te rnam pa thams cad du sems can yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The idea is this: Sentient beings do not exist in any way.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams la kun rdzob tu bdag gi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams la kun rdzob tu bdag gi sgras brjod do //
translated: The aggregates and so on are conventionally called the self.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said:üîΩAny renunciant or brahmin who sees the self as real sees only these five aggregates.

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag bdag ces yang dag par mthong bas phung po lnga po 'di rnams nyid mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir gal te yang shes rab kyis dpyad na don dam par sems mi dmigs pa yin te /üîΩde @240a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag bdag ces yang dag par mthong bas phung po lnga po 'di rnams nyid mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir gal te yang shes rab kyis dpyad na don dam par sems mi dmigs pa yin te / de @240a * //
translated: Therefore, if one analyzes with wisdom, ultimately the mind is not observed.

original: ltar na yang kun rdzob tu 'gegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ltar na yang kun rdzob tu 'gegs pa ma yin no //
translated: But even so, it is not refuted conventionally.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang gis shes rab don dam dang ni kun rdzob thugs rje bsten par bzhed //
analyzed: gang gis shes rab don dam dang ni kun rdzob thugs rje bsten par bzhed //
translated: You assert that wisdom is based on the ultimate and compassion on the conventional.

original: khyed ni 'gro ba rang bzhin med par ji ltar don la 'jal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyed ni 'gro ba rang bzhin med par ji ltar don la 'jal bar 'gyur //
translated: How do you, who are without nature, evaluate the meaning for beings?

original: gang gi tshe na stobs bcu skyed par mdzad ma thugs rje dang ldan pa //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na stobs bcu skyed par mdzad ma thugs rje dang ldan pa //
translated: When you generate the ten powers, O Compassionate One,

original: de tshe khyod ni bu sdug bsngal la pha bzhin 'gro la brtse bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de tshe khyod ni bu sdug bsngal la pha bzhin 'gro la brtse bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: then you will be loving toward beings, as a father toward his suffering son.

original: bstod pa bzhi pa las kyang /üîΩmgon khyod sems can 'du shes la //
analyzed: bstod pa bzhi pa las kyang / mgon khyod sems can 'du shes la //
translated: And the Fourth Praise says:üîΩO Protector, you do not engage

original: rnam pa kun tu 'jug ma yin //üîΩsems can sdug bsngal gyis nyen la //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu 'jug ma yin // sems can sdug bsngal gyis nyen la //
translated: in any way with the idea of sentient beings.üîΩYou are the very essence of compassion

original: khyod ni shin tu thugs rje'i bdag /üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: khyod ni shin tu thugs rje'i bdag / ces gsungs so //
translated: for sentient beings afflicted by suffering.

original: de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams la 'di ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgras brjod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa rnams la 'di ltar kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgras brjod de /
translated: Therefore, form and so on are expressed as conventional truth.

original: de bas na snying rje ni yul med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje ni yul med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, compassion is not without an object.

original: ci ste don dam par sems can med na gang gi 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par sems can med na gang gi 'bras bu yin /
translated: But if ultimately there are no sentient beings, then what is the effect of compassion?

original: des na de bsgrub pa'i don du 'ga' zhig 'jug par 'gyur zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: des na de bsgrub pa'i don du 'ga' zhig 'jug par 'gyur zhes bsams nas /
translated: Therefore, thinking that someone might object that ‚Äúif that is so, then compassion would be without an object,‚ÄùüîΩin response to that, it is said:

original: sems can med 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can med 'bras zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there are no sentient beings, then what is the effect of compassion?‚Äù

original: sems can med na zhes pa ni gang gi tshe sems can med na'o //
analyzed: sems can med na zhes pa ni gang gi tshe sems can med na'o //
translated: If there are no sentient beings, when there are no sentient beings.

original: de'i tshe gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams skyes nas zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu su'i yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pas gzugs la sogs pa rnams skyes nas zhig pa'i phyir 'bras bu su'i yin /
translated: Then, since there is no one to continue, what is the effect of form, etc. , since it perishes as soon as it arises?

original: su'i yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: su'i yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning that it is no one‚Äôs.

original: bden zhes khas len pa yin te /
analyzed: bden zhes khas len pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú It is true‚Äù is the admission.

original: 'di de ltar yin no //
analyzed: 'di de ltar yin no //
translated: ‚Äú It is so‚Äù is the way it is.

original: 'dod ces pa ni 'di ltar kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dod ces pa ni 'di ltar kho bo cag 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: ‚Äú We accept‚Äù is the way we accept it.

original: cung zad cig kyang don dam par 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig kyang don dam par 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nothing at all exists as an effect ultimately,

original: chos thams cad bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things are without self.

original: gal te de ltar na de bsgrub pa'i don du dang por ci'i phyir 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de bsgrub pa'i don du dang por ci'i phyir 'jug ce na /
translated: If it is so, then why does one first engage in it for the sake of its accomplishment?

original: 'dir ni zhes te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa ni 'bras bu de don du gnyer bas rmongs pas bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes te 'di lta bu'i spyod pa ni 'bras bu de don du gnyer bas rmongs pas bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Here, this conduct is the activity of one who is confused by the desire for that effect.

original: bdag gi 'di kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes gcig tu zhen pas sems can med na yang kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: bdag gi 'di kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes gcig tu zhen pas sems can med na yang kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: Even though there are no sentient beings, it is conventionally, with the thought, ‚ÄúThis alone will be my effect.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyis chos thams cad la dngos po la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin nyid kyis chos thams cad la dngos po la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, apart from dependent origination, there is no entity in all phenomena, which are illusory by nature, that can be asserted.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod pa med pa stong pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa stong pa nyid //
translated: Non-assertion is emptiness.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du rkyen las 'byung //üîΩmgon po khyod kyis chos rnams ni //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du rkyen las 'byung // mgon po khyod kyis chos rnams ni //
translated: Like an illusion, it arises from conditions.üîΩLord, you have taught

original: rang bzhin med par rab tu bstan //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab tu bstan //
translated: that phenomena are essenceless.

original: zhes gsungs so// @240b de lta bas na kun rdzob nyid du 'bras bu'i don du bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so// @240b de lta bas na kun rdzob nyid du 'bras bu'i don du bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only conventionally that one can speak of an effect in terms of an object of action.

original: ci ste yang gti mug ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam pa thams cad du blang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang gti mug ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam pa thams cad du blang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin te /
translated: But if ignorance, which is by nature delusion, is not to be accepted in any way,

original: ji ltar na slar yang de nyid khas len par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na slar yang de nyid khas len par byed ce na /
translated: how can one accept it again?

original: sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says that it is the cause of suffering, etc.

original: rmongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Delusion is of two kinds:

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / de nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / de nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of entering sa·πÉsƒÅra and the cause of pacifying it.

original: de la gang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la gang 'khor ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: That which is the cause of cyclic existence is to be abandoned.

original: gang gzhan ni sdug bsngal brgyud pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du yin te /
analyzed: gang gzhan ni sdug bsngal brgyud pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du yin te /
translated: The other is for the purpose of pacifying the continuum of suffering.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skye ba la sogs pa gdung ba ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skye ba la sogs pa gdung ba ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: It is the reason for stopping the torment of birth, etc. of all sentient beings.

original: 'bras bu rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rmongs pa ste /
translated: The result is delusion.

original: 'bras bu don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i ched du yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu don dam pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i ched du yin la /
translated: It is for the purpose of realizing the result, which is the characteristic of ultimate truth.

original: rmongs pa de yang bzlog par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa de yang bzlog par mi bya ste /
translated: And that delusion is not to be stopped.

original: dgag par mi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dgag par mi bya ba yin la /
translated: It is not to be negated.

original: blang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is to be taken up.

original: don dam pa la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa la mkho ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is necessary for the ultimate.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te ;
translated: This is the idea.

original: dgos pa de yang chen po rnams kyis bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pas legs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dgos pa de yang chen po rnams kyis bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pas legs pa ma yin la /
translated: And that purpose is not for the sake of the great ones who desire happiness for themselves.

original: 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad bcad pa'i don du yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can thams cad kyi mthar thug pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad bcad pa'i don du yin te /
translated: But it is for the sake of cutting off all the ultimate suffering of all sentient beings.

original: de yang thabs su gyur pa don dam par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang thabs su gyur pa don dam par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the ultimate is the means for realizing the method.

original: de'i yang thabs su gyur pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i yang thabs su gyur pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
translated: The conventional truth is the means for that,

original: kun rdzob med par don dam pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob med par don dam pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without the conventional, the ultimate is not realized.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i don ni rmongs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i don ni rmongs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the pacification of suffering is the result of delusion.

original: 'bras bu 'di ni dgos pa'i don du ma dpyad par zhes pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di ni dgos pa'i don du ma dpyad par zhes pa'i skabs su sngar bstan pa nyid yin te /
translated: This result is the purpose, as was previously explained in the context of ‚Äúwithout analysis.‚Äù

original: slar yang 'di spros nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: slar yang 'di spros nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is again elaborated and stated.

original: gal te de ltar na yang /üîΩji ltar sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rmongs pa'i ma rig pa'i rang bzhin khas len pa de bzhin du bdag tu rmongs pa yang gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang / ji ltar sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu rmongs pa'i ma rig pa'i rang bzhin khas len pa de bzhin du bdag tu rmongs pa yang gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Even if this is so,

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: just as the result is accepted to be the nature of the ignorance of delusion because it is the cause of the pacification of suffering, in the same way, the delusion of self should also be posited because it is the cause of that.

original: de ji ltar bdag 'gegs par 'bad pa'i sgo nas byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag 'gegs par 'bad pa'i sgo nas byed /
translated: How could it be that it is done by the exertion of refuting the self?

original: de yod na bdag bsgoms pas ngar 'dzin pa zad pa'i phyir 'khor ba bzlog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yod na bdag bsgoms pas ngar 'dzin pa zad pa'i phyir 'khor ba bzlog par 'gyur la /
translated: If there were such a self, then by meditating on it, the self-habit would be exhausted and cyclic existence would be reversed.

original: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgoms pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgoms pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: So what is the point of meditating on selflessness?

original: sdug bsngal rgyu yi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu yi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe cause of suffering‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu rmongs pa sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu @241a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu rmongs pa sdug bsngal zhi ba'i rgyu @241a * //
translated: Just as the effect, the pacification of the suffering of delusion, is the cause of the elimination of the suffering of delusion,

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa bdag tu rmongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa bdag tu rmongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, the second, the delusion of self, is not.

original: de yod pas na ngar 'dzin pa zad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pas na ngar 'dzin pa zad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of its existence, the self-habit will not be exhausted.

original: slar yang bdag tu rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang bdag tu rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, there will be delusion of self,

original: bdag med pa la phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa la phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of seeing selflessness in a distorted way.

original: slar nga rgyal 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar nga rgyal 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, pride will increase,

original: 'phel ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phel ba nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because the increase of pride will arise.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste sdug bsngal ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gsum gyi 'khor ba'i rgyu ste byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ste sdug bsngal ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gsum gyi 'khor ba'i rgyu ste byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: It is the cause of suffering, the cause of the suffering of cyclic existence, the cause of the three sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: ngar 'dzin pa zad pa las kyang sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod do //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa zad pa las kyang sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod do //
translated: And from the exhaustion of the view of the transitory composite, suffering is extinguished.

original: bdag tu lta ba yod na ji ltar 'di ldog par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yod na ji ltar 'di ldog par 'gyur te ;
translated: If the view of the transitory composite exists, how can this be averted?

original: rgyu'i nus pa ma tshang ba med pa la 'bras bu ldog pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa ma tshang ba med pa la 'bras bu ldog pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not logical for an effect to be averted when the power of the cause is complete.

original: des na sdug bsngal kyang mi ldog go //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal kyang mi ldog go //
translated: Therefore, suffering is not averted.

original: 'di ltar yang bdag mthong bas 'dus byas kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la bdag go zhes zhen pa'i dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag mthong bas 'dus byas kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la bdag go zhes zhen pa'i dran pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through seeing the self, the conception of ‚Äúmine‚Äù arises with regard to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are produced.

original: des na sdug bsngal phyir bcos par 'dod cing /
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal phyir bcos par 'dod cing /
translated: Therefore, one desires the alleviation of suffering.

original: bde ba 'dod pa'i nyes rnams bsgribs nas de don du gnyer bas yon tan du sgro btags pas de bsgrub pa rnams la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa'i nyes rnams bsgribs nas de don du gnyer bas yon tan du sgro btags pas de bsgrub pa rnams la 'jug ste /
translated: Desiring pleasure, one conceals the faults and pursues it, exaggerating its good qualities.

original: kho bo la phan pa byed pa'o zhes blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo la phan pa byed pa'o zhes blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One engages in the practice of that, thinking, ‚ÄúThis benefits me.‚Äù

original: nga dang bdag ces mthong ba'i phyir gags  byed pa'i zhe sdang du 'gyur la /
analyzed: nga dang bdag ces mthong ba'i phyir gags  byed pa'i zhe sdang du 'gyur la /
translated: Because of seeing ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù there is the obstruction of aversion.

original: des na sdug bsngal mtha' dag gi rgyu nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyid thob cing rgyas par 'jug go //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal mtha' dag gi rgyu nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad nyid thob cing rgyas par 'jug go //
translated: Thus, all the afflictions and subsidiary afflictions, which are the causes of all suffering, are obtained and increase.

original: de ltar na bdag tu rmongs pa rab tu 'jug pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ngar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu rmongs pa rab tu 'jug pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ngar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, since the delusion of self is engaged, the cause of suffering is the apprehension of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: The master said:

original: gang zhig bzhes bdag mthong ba //
analyzed: gang zhig bzhes bdag mthong ba //
translated: Those who see the self as real

original: de la rtag pa nyid du chags //üîΩchags pas bde la sbed 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de la rtag pa nyid du chags // chags pas bde la sbed 'gyur zhing //
translated: Are attached to it as permanent.üîΩThrough attachment, they hide the truth.

original: sred pas skyon rnams sbed par byed //
analyzed: sred pas skyon rnams sbed par byed //
translated: Through craving, they hide the faults.

original: yon tan mthong ba yongs su sred //
analyzed: yon tan mthong ba yongs su sred //
translated: They are completely attached to the view of good qualities.

original: nga yi zhes de'i sgrub byed len //
analyzed: nga yi zhes de'i sgrub byed len //
translated: They take up the self‚Äôs means of accomplishment.

original: des na ji srid bdag sngon chags //
analyzed: des na ji srid bdag sngon chags //
translated: Thus, for as long as they are attached to the self,

original: de srid de ni 'khor ba yin //
analyzed: de srid de ni 'khor ba yin //
translated: For that long, they are in cyclic existence.

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du'ang shes //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du'ang shes //
translated: If there is a self, one knows the other.üîΩAttachment to self and aversion to others

original: bdag gzhan la chags 'dzin dang sdang // 'di dag dang ni kun 'brel las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la chags 'dzin dang sdang // 'di dag dang ni kun 'brel las //
translated: Are connected with all of these,

original: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: And all faults arise from them.

original: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa'i ngar 'dzin pa bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la chags pa'i ngar 'dzin pa bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù due to attachment to self cannot be averted.

original: de las kyang bzlog @241b med ce na zhes pa las /
analyzed: de las kyang bzlog @241b med ce na zhes pa las /
translated: And if it cannot be averted,

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag mthong ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag mthong ba las kyang ngo //
translated: then ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù means from the view of self.

original: bzlog med pa ni bzlog par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog med pa ni bzlog par mi nus pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Cannot be averted‚Äù means cannot be stopped.

original: gal te bdag tu 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If it is grasping at self,

original: de'i tshe bdag med du bsgoms pas mchog yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag med du bsgoms pas mchog yin no //
translated: then it is supreme to meditate on selflessness.

original: bdag med pa ni gang zag la sogs pa dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa ni gang zag la sogs pa dang bral ba yin la /
translated: Selflessness is freedom from the person and so on.

original: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: Meditation is familiarity.

original: mchog ni gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: mchog ni gtso bo yin te /
translated: Supreme is primary.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mi 'jug pa na ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mi 'jug pa na ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the view of self does not engage, it is the cause for averting grasping at ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: 'di yang re zhig bzhag nas phyi nas spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang re zhig bzhag nas phyi nas spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is also set aside for the time being and later will be refuted,

original: dngos por dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an observation of things.

original: 'di ltar yang bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa las /
translated: Thus, from the culmination of the highest meditation,

original: mngon sum du bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir de dang 'gal ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir de dang 'gal ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of directly seeing selflessness, the view of the transitory collection that is incompatible with it is eliminated.

original: de log na yang gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir phyi ma dang snga ma ngo bos stong pa'i skad cig tsam mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de log na yang gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir phyi ma dang snga ma ngo bos stong pa'i skad cig tsam mthong ba yin no //
translated: And when that is eliminated, one sees only the momentary, empty of inherent existence of past and future, because one does not see anything that is unitary and permanent.

original: de lta bas na snga ma dang phyi mar sgro 'dogs pa dang bral bas bdag la ma 'ongs pa'i bde bsgrub par byed pa gzhan cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na snga ma dang phyi mar sgro 'dogs pa dang bral bas bdag la ma 'ongs pa'i bde bsgrub par byed pa gzhan cung zad kyang mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one is free from the superimposition of past and future, and one does not see anything else that is the self that is the appropriator of future happiness.

original: de lta bas na de yul 'ga' la yang chags pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yul 'ga' la yang chags pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one does not generate attachment to any object.

original: de dang 'gal ba la zhe sdang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba la zhe sdang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And one does not generate aversion to that which is incompatible with it,

original: zhen pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: zhen pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: because one is free from attachment.

original: gnod pa byed pa la len du gnod pa byed pa'i gnas su mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la len du gnod pa byed pa'i gnas su mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And one does not see that which harms as a basis for retaliation,üîΩbecause one is free from aversion.

original: gang gis gang la gnod pa byed pa gnyis po de dag la yang skad cig ma gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis gang la gnod pa byed pa gnyis po de dag la yang skad cig ma gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because neither the one who is harmed nor the one who harms exists in the second moment.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pas dgra gzhan 'joms par byed pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la rtogs pa dang ldan pas dgra gzhan 'joms par byed pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for the wise to destroy other enemies who harm them.

original: gang la des byas pa de la yang ngo /
analyzed: gang la des byas pa de la yang ngo /
translated: It is the same for the one who is harmed by them.

original: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa log pa dang / gzhan de las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa log pa dang / gzhan de las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when desire and so on are reversed, other afflictions and secondary afflictions that arise from them do not arise.

original: dngos po la ni gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la ni gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no harm or harm-doer in things.

original: yang na 'di la brten nas 'di skye'o zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las dmigs pas so //
analyzed: yang na 'di la brten nas 'di skye'o zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las dmigs pas so //
translated: Or, ‚Äúthis arises in dependence on that,‚Äù because of observing dependent origination.

original: 'di ltar yang gang zag gis stong pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i log pa la nyon mongs pa spyod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gang zag gis stong pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i log pa la nyon mongs pa spyod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the person is empty, afflictions do not operate in the reversal of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the root is cut.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble TathƒÅgataguhya S≈´tra says,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros @242a * //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros @242a * //
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅntimati,

original: 'di 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: shing gi rtsa ba bcad pa'i yal ga dang lo ma dang 'dab ma thams cad skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing gi rtsa ba bcad pa'i yal ga dang lo ma dang 'dab ma thams cad skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: when the root of a tree is cut, all the branches, leaves, and petals dry up.

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba nye bar zhi bas nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba nye bar zhi bas nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: ≈öƒÅntimati, in the same way, when the view of the transitory collection is pacified, all afflictions are pacified.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgom pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med pa bsgom pa mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meditation on selflessness is supreme.

original: zhar la byung ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is complete.

original: // / de ni yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul spyod pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: // / de ni yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul spyod pa la 'jug go //
translated: Now, the object of the conception of self is to be examined.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: That may be so,

original: gal te de ltar na yang bdag dpyad pas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang bdag dpyad pas /
translated: but if it is examined,

original: bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar bdag 'dzin pa'i yul med pa de lta na yang yan lag can gyi lus de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar bdag 'dzin pa'i yul med pa de lta na yang yan lag can gyi lus de'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the object of the conception of self is like the horn of a donkey, and does not exist. In that case, the object of the conception of self is the body, which is the possessor of the parts.

original: 'di la lus ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la lus ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe body is not the parts,‚Äù and so on.

original: lus kyang rnam par dpyad pas gcig pa nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed de /
analyzed: lus kyang rnam par dpyad pas gcig pa nyid cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed de /
translated: The body is also not even slightly a unity, as shown by the analysis.

original: 'di ltar yang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i cha nyid 'ba' zhig mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i cha nyid 'ba' zhig mthong ste /
translated: In this way, only the parts of the body, such as the hands and feet, are seen.

original: lus gcig ces pa'i mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lus gcig ces pa'i mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The body is not seen as a unity.

original: de rnams las gzhan pa'i lus po yang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las gzhan pa'i lus po yang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the body known to be other than those.

original: gang gi phyir lus ni rkang pa min te /üîΩrkang pa dag ma yin no //üîΩbyin pa yang lus su mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus ni rkang pa min te / rkang pa dag ma yin no // byin pa yang lus su mi 'gyur la /
translated: The body is not the feet,

original: brla yang min te /
analyzed: brla yang min te /
translated: nor is it the calves.

original: byin pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par ni lus ma yin no //üîΩrked pa yang ma yin no //üîΩrked pa yang lus ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: byin pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par ni lus ma yin no // rked pa yang ma yin no // rked pa yang lus ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The thighs are not the body,üîΩnor is the body the buttocks.

original: lto ba yang ma yin te /üîΩgsus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lto ba yang ma yin te / gsus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The sides are not the body,

original: rgyab 'di yang lus ma yin te /üîΩlus 'di ni rgyab ma yin pa nyid do //üîΩbrang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyab 'di yang lus ma yin te / lus 'di ni rgyab ma yin pa nyid do // brang yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is the body the back.üîΩThe belly is not the body,

original: brang gi dkyil 'khor yang lus ma yin no //
analyzed: brang gi dkyil 'khor yang lus ma yin no //
translated: nor is the body the chest.üîΩThe body is not the arms,üîΩnor is the body the hands.

original: dpung pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpung pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the shoulders,

original: dpung pa de yang lus su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpung pa de yang lus su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for the shoulders are not the body.

original: lag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the arms,

original: lag pa dag lus ma yin no //üîΩrtsib logs 'di yang lus ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa dag lus ma yin no // rtsib logs 'di yang lus ma yin te /
translated: for the arms are not the body.üîΩIt is not the ribs,

original: 'di'i rtsib logs dag kyang lus ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rtsib logs dag kyang lus ma yin no //
translated: for the ribs are not the body.

original: mtshan khung yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan khung yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the armpits,

original: lag pa'i rtsa yang lus ma yin no //
analyzed: lag pa'i rtsa yang lus ma yin no //
translated: for the armpits are not the body.

original: 'phrag  pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phrag  pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the characteristics of the shoulders,

original: phung po'i rang bzhin lus ma yin no //üîΩmgrin pa yang lus ma yin te /üîΩske ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin lus ma yin no // mgrin pa yang lus ma yin te / ske ma yin no //
translated: for the body is not the nature of the aggregates.üîΩIt is not the neck,üîΩfor the neck is not the body.

original: mgo bo yang lus ma yin te /
analyzed: mgo bo yang lus ma yin te /
translated: It is not the head,

original: mgo bo'i lus su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo bo'i lus su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: for the head is not the body.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i brtags @242b bas rdul phra rab kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa yang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i brtags @242b bas rdul phra rab kyang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The feet, etc., are not the body, because they are not established as subtle atoms, as will be explained.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa gzhan zhig bcad na lus po zhig pas shi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir lus 'di rnams so sor bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa gzhan zhig bcad na lus po zhig pas shi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir lus 'di rnams so sor bdag ma yin no //
translated: If another part, such as the hand or foot, were cut off, the body would be destroyed and would die, because it is not accepted that the body is the parts.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe lus 'di rnams so so'i rang bzhin ma yin pas 'di dag bsdus pa tsam lus yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe lus 'di rnams so so'i rang bzhin ma yin pas 'di dag bsdus pa tsam lus yin no //
translated: In the same way, when the body is not the nature of the parts, the body is merely the collection of the parts.

original: 'di la lus ni gang zhig yin zhes te /
analyzed: 'di la lus ni gang zhig yin zhes te /
translated: What is the body here?

original: yang 'di la ste rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'di rnams mdun gnas shing lus su rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di rnams la gang zhig lus su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'di la ste rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'di rnams mdun gnas shing lus su rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'di rnams la gang zhig lus su 'gyur te /
translated: What is the body among these parts, the foot, etc., which are present in front of us and are the reason for the notion of body?

original: cung zad kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin la /
translated: Nothing at all.

original: gcig kyang nges par dpyad pa na lus kyi bdag nyid gang yang mi dmigs so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig kyang nges par dpyad pa na lus kyi bdag nyid gang yang mi dmigs so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that when one searches for the body in the parts, one does not find the nature of the body anywhere.

original: 'on te de lta na yang 'di ltar rkang pa la sogs pa rnams so sor lus su brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na yang 'di ltar rkang pa la sogs pa rnams so sor lus su brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But even if that is so, the foot, etc., are not to be described as the body individually.

original: 'on kyang yan lag thams cad la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag can dang / yan lag thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: 'on kyang yan lag thams cad la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag can dang / yan lag thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: But because it pervades all the parts, it is the possessor of parts, and it engages all the parts.

original: 'di la gal te 'di zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'di zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúBut if it engages all the parts . . .‚ÄùüîΩIf the body engages all the parts, does it engage them by means of a part of itself?

original: yan lag thams cad la 'di 'jug pa na phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la 'di 'jug pa na phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
translated: Or does it engage them by means of its entire self?

original: dus gcig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug / de la gal te lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yan lag thams cad la lus 'di ste yan lag can gyi lus 'di'o //
analyzed: dus gcig tu bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug / de la gal te lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yan lag thams cad la lus 'di ste yan lag can gyi lus 'di'o //
translated: In the first case, if the body, which is the possessor of parts, engages all the parts, such as the hands and feet,

original: phyogs de yis ni gnas gyur na //
analyzed: phyogs de yis ni gnas gyur na //
translated: then it would be located in a part.

original: zhes te / cha 'ga' zhig gis cha shas 'ga' zhig la khyab par 'gyur na bdag nyid thams cad kyis thams cad la ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes te / cha 'ga' zhig gis cha shas 'ga' zhig la khyab par 'gyur na bdag nyid thams cad kyis thams cad la ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is, if it pervades some parts by means of a portion of itself, then it does not do so by means of its entire self.

original: de'i tshe 'di skad brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di skad brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: In that case, it cannot be said that

original: gang gi phyir gang gi phyogs gcig nyid kyis cha shas rnams la 'jug pa na de rnams la yang phyogs re re la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gi phyogs gcig nyid kyis cha shas rnams la 'jug pa na de rnams la yang phyogs re re la /
translated: Because when one part of it engages with the parts, then in those, too, one should not stop the conception that another part engages with each individual part.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs gcig gis 'jug gam /
translated: Does it engage with them by means of another part?

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug ces rnam par rtog pa mi ldog go //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug ces rnam par rtog pa mi ldog go //
translated: Or does it engage with them by means of its entire self?

original: de la yang slar phyogs gcig gis 'jug pa'i rnam par brtag pa thug pa med par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang slar phyogs gcig gis 'jug pa'i rnam par brtag pa thug pa med par ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, too, the conception that it engages by means of a part would be endless and would not stop.

original: gzhan yang de la go skabs med pa nyid kyi phyir cha shas rnams la 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la go skabs med pa nyid kyi phyir cha shas rnams la 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that it engages with the parts because it has no opportunity to do so.

original: cha shas rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: cha shas rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to that, he says ‚ÄúThe parts,‚Äù and so on.

original: cha shas rnams te dum bu rnams cha @243a * //
analyzed: cha shas rnams te dum bu rnams cha @243a * //
translated: The parts, the pieces,

original: shas rang rang gi gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shas rang rang gi gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: remain in their own locations.

original: rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: They are situated.

original: dngos po rnams rang rang gi gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang rang gi gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things remain in their own locations.

original: de rang nyid gang na gnas zhes pa ni de yan lag can rang nyid gang na gnas zhes pa mi rig go //
analyzed: de rang nyid gang na gnas zhes pa ni de yan lag can rang nyid gang na gnas zhes pa mi rig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere is it located?‚Äù means ‚ÄúWhere is the possessor of parts located?‚Äù

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa yin na /
translated: But if it is the second conception,

original: de la bdag nyid kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the verse beginning ‚ÄúIf the self is entirely . . .‚Äù was taught.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyang 'jug pa srid pa na cha shas rnams la skabs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyang 'jug pa srid pa na cha shas rnams la skabs med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is impossible for the self to engage in all activities, it would be impossible for the parts to exist.

original: de yang gang du rang nyid gnas zhes thal bar 'gyur ba gegs med par 'jug go //
analyzed: de yang gang du rang nyid gnas zhes thal bar 'gyur ba gegs med par 'jug go //
translated: And it would follow that the self would engage in all activities without obstruction, wherever it is located.

original: de ltar na yang slar yang gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang slar yang gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Even so, we will again say this:

original: bdag nyid kun gyis te dngos po thams cad kyis yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kun gyis te dngos po thams cad kyis yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the self is entirely . . .‚Äù means if the self exists in all things.

original: phyogs gcig gis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not by a part.

original: thams cad du lag pa la sogs pa yan lag thams cad la'o //
analyzed: thams cad du lag pa la sogs pa yan lag thams cad la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEverywhere‚Äù means in all the parts, such as the hands.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rkang pa la sogs pa'i rnams la yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rkang pa la sogs pa'i rnams la yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù means in the feet and so on.

original: gnas shing yan lag can gyi lus gal te 'brel pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas shing yan lag can gyi lus gal te 'brel pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the self is related to the body, the possessor of parts,

original: de'i tshe slar yang nyes pa gzhan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe slar yang nyes pa gzhan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: lag sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lag sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The body and so on would be as many as the parts.

original: lus zhes pa ni yan lag can gyi lus yin la /üîΩde rnyed pa de nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus zhes pa ni yan lag can gyi lus yin la / de rnyed pa de nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The body is the possessor of parts.üîΩIt would be as many as the parts.

original: de'i grangs yongs su bcad pa de nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i grangs yongs su bcad pa de nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The number of the body would be obtained as many as the number of its parts.

original: ji tsam du zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam du zhe na /
translated: How many?

original: ji snyed pa ste /üîΩlag pa la sogs pa de rnams ni /üîΩlag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yan lag ji snyed pa de rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji snyed pa ste / lag pa la sogs pa de rnams ni / lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yan lag ji snyed pa de rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: As many as the parts.üîΩThose hands and so on would be as many as the parts, such as the hands and feet.

original: de'i grangs yongs su bcad pa rnams dang de 'brel pa'i yan lag can rnams kyang de snyed pa rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i grangs yongs su bcad pa rnams dang de 'brel pa'i yan lag can rnams kyang de snyed pa rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: The number of the body would be obtained as many as the number of its parts.

original: de cha shas med pa nyid thams cad kyis de rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cha shas med pa nyid thams cad kyis de rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is partless, it is completely present in all of them.

original: de du ma dang 'brel las du ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan du gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de du ma dang 'brel las du ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan du gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is related to many, it is not one, since it is many.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba 'di du ma yul gcig tu 'jug pa'i phyogs la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba 'di du ma yul gcig tu 'jug pa'i phyogs la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This reductio should also be applied to the position that many [perceivers] engage one object.

original: de bzhin du kha bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba la yang ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should state [the reductio] as appropriate with respect to the dyed and the undyed, the covered and the uncovered, the moving and the unmoving.

original: de ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba'i lus yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas rtogs par bya ba'i lus yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the body that is to be understood by means of such valid cognitions as perception does not exist.

original: gnod par byed pa'i @243b brjod ma thag pa yod pas zhes bsgrub pa'i don du mjug bsdu ba /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i @243b brjod ma thag pa yod pas zhes bsgrub pa'i don du mjug bsdu ba /
translated: The conclusion is stated in order to prove that [the body] is undermined by the previously mentioned [arguments]:

original: phyi dang nang na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The internal and the external and so forth.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni spar bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu ni spar bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The internal agent is refuted by the previous [arguments].

original: sha dang khrag la sogs pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sha dang khrag la sogs pa rnams rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because flesh, blood, and so forth are analyzed,

original: de ni nang gi lus ma yin no zhes te /
analyzed: de ni nang gi lus ma yin no zhes te /
translated: it is said that that is not the internal body.

original: da ni yang yan lag can dgag pa'i phyir phyi rol te mngon sum la sogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyi rol du sa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ni yang yan lag can dgag pa'i phyir phyi rol te mngon sum la sogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyi rol du sa ma yin no //
translated: Now, in order to refute the possessor of parts, it says, ‚ÄúIt is not external.‚Äù

original: de ltar na ji ltar na lus lag pa la sogs pa rnams la rnam par gzhag par byed /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar na lus lag pa la sogs pa rnams la rnam par gzhag par byed /
translated: Thus, how could the body be posited in the arms and so on?

original: 'on te lag pa la sogs pa las tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lag pa la sogs pa las tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is different from the arms and so on,

original: lag sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lag sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe arms and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams las gzhan tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams las gzhan tha dad pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that something different from the parts, the arms and so on, exists as the characteristic of the observed object,

original: dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not observed.

original: lag pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Only the arms and so on are observed.

original: de ltar na gang yan lag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang yan lag la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Thus, it is not that the body has the nature of the parts and so on.

original: de la brten pa'i 'brel pa yang med do //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i 'brel pa yang med do //
translated: Nor does it have a connection with them.

original: nang yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nang yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist internally.

original: de la tha dad yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la tha dad yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it exist separately from them.

original: de zhes te lus so //
analyzed: de zhes te lus so //
translated: ‚Äú It‚Äù refers to the body.

original: ji ltar nyid du yod min zhes te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyid du yod min zhes te /
translated: ‚Äú How could it exist?‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar yang lus ma dmigs pa na de yod pa ma srid pa nyid kyis 'dri bar byed do ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar yang lus ma dmigs pa na de yod pa ma srid pa nyid kyis 'dri bar byed do ;
translated: How? In what way?

original: / ji ltar rnam pa gang gis zhes so //
analyzed: / ji ltar rnam pa gang gis zhes so //
translated: How is it that, when the body is not observed, it is impossible for it to exist?

original: kye zhes rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: kye zhes rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: Oh! is an exclamation.

original: yod ces te /
analyzed: yod ces te /
translated: It exists!

original: de yod pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: That is the presentation of its existence.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar rnam par dpyad pas lus rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar rnam par dpyad pas lus rnam par gzhag par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
translated: When, in this way, the body cannot be presented through analysis,

original: med pa nyid du de la tha snyad bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa nyid du de la tha snyad bya'o zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: then it should be conventionally said to be nonexistent.

original: des na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to conclude that, he says, Therefore, etc.

original: des na lus med ces pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa brjod pas ma dmigs pa de'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i ma dmigs pa las lus yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus med ces pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par dpyad pa brjod pas ma dmigs pa de'i phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i ma dmigs pa las lus yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body does not exist. Since it is not observed through the expression of analysis, therefore, due to the non-observation that has the characteristic of observation, the body does not exist.

original: gal te med na 'o na ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa rnams la lus kyi blor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med na 'o na ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa rnams la lus kyi blor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist, then how is it that there is the cognition of the body in the arms, etc.?

original: rmongs las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rmongs las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response, he says, Due to delusion, etc.

original: rmongs las ni ma rig pa'i dbang las so //
analyzed: rmongs las ni ma rig pa'i dbang las so //
translated: From delusion means from the power of nescience.

original: kyang zhes pa lag pa la sogs pa rdzas gcig dang bral ba rnams la lus kyi blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyang zhes pa lag pa la sogs pa rdzas gcig dang bral ba rnams la lus kyi blor 'gyur te /
translated: Also means that the cognition of the body occurs in relation to hands, etc. , which are separate from the one substance of the body.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //üîΩyang na kyang gi sgra @244a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no // yang na kyang gi sgra @244a * //
translated: But not ultimately.

original: ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: Or else, the word also is for the purpose of including the following.üîΩThus, by the power of the accumulation of false habit-energy that has been active since beginningless samsara, even though one has realized the reality of things as they are,

original: 'di ltar yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas 'jug pa skye ba brgyud par log par goms pa bsags pa'i dbang gis dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu rtogs kyang de las phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog paüîΩskye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas 'jug pa skye ba brgyud par log par goms pa bsags pa'i dbang gis dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i de kho na nyid rab tu rtogs kyang de las phyin ci log tu sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a conceptual thought that superimposes the opposite of that arises.

original: de dang nye bar 'brel pas 'jig rten na lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dang nye bar 'brel pas 'jig rten na lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di 'jug ste /
translated: And by the connection with that, the conventions of body, etc. , are used in the world,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: ji ltar gzhan du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that it does not become otherwise?

original: 'di la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dbyibs su bkod pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs su bkod pa ste /
translated: In the arrangement of shape.

original: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su dgod pa la'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su dgod pa la'o //
translated: In the arrangement of the shape of hands, feet, etc.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan la tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan la tha dad pa'o //
translated: The difference between that and the other is that it is different.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu zhes lag pa la sogs pa nyid la yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu zhes lag pa la sogs pa nyid la yin gyi /
translated: The cause of error is in the hand, etc.,

original: thams cad la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in everything,üîΩbecause the object is determined individually.

original: yul so sor nges pa nyid 'khrul pa'i 'dod pas ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa nyid 'khrul pa'i 'dod pas ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: mtho yor la ni mi blo bzhin no zhes te /üîΩji ltar mtho yor la mi'i rang bzhin med kyang skyes pa dang mtshungs pa'i gyen du 'greng ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtho yor la ni mi blo bzhin no zhes te / ji ltar mtho yor la mi'i rang bzhin med kyang skyes pa dang mtshungs pa'i gyen du 'greng ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Like the idea of a man in a post.üîΩJust as in a post, which does not have the nature of a man, there is the idea of a man, because of the perception of a particular shape, such as uprightness, etc.,

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par dmigs pa dang ldan pa na ring po nas khyad par khong du ma chud pa gzhan gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gi 'khrul pas skyes bu'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par dmigs pa dang ldan pa na ring po nas khyad par khong du ma chud pa gzhan gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig gi 'khrul pas skyes bu'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: which is similar to a man, so also in the case in question.

original: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like that.

original: de ltar na yang ji ltar yang 'di nyid la brten te rmongs pa nyid kyis lus kyi blo yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ji ltar yang 'di nyid la brten te rmongs pa nyid kyis lus kyi blo yin la /
translated: But even so, how is it that the idea of a body is due to delusion about this very thing,

original: dngos po ma yin zhes pas ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin zhes pas ji ltar zhe na /
translated: and not about a real thing?

original: 'di la ji srid rkyen zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la ji srid rkyen zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúas long as the conditions‚Äù and so on are stated.

original: de ji srid du /üîΩgang dus kyi mtshams su bcad pa'i rkyen rnams te /
analyzed: de ji srid du / gang dus kyi mtshams su bcad pa'i rkyen rnams te /
translated: As long as the conditions

original: rgyu rnams yin la /
analyzed: rgyu rnams yin la /
translated: are the causes that are determined by the limits of time,üîΩthe body is like a person,

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / reg pa la sogs pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid las la rag las pa'i tshogs kyi bsgrub pa dus de srid kyi mtshams su lus ni skyes bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams drug dang / reg pa la sogs pa'i skye mched drug dang / yid kyi nye bar rgyu ba bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid las la rag las pa'i tshogs kyi bsgrub pa dus de srid kyi mtshams su lus ni skyes bu lta bu ste /
translated: in the sense that the body is established by the collection of karma that depends on the six elements such as earth, the six sense bases such as contact, and the eighteen movements of mind.

original: dper na skyes bu'i rang bzhin gyis don dam par stong pa yang yongs su brtags pa'i ngo bo skyes bu'i rang bzhin du rab tu snang ba dang tha snyad kyang byed do //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu'i rang bzhin gyis don dam par stong pa yang yongs su brtags pa'i ngo bo skyes bu'i rang bzhin du rab tu snang ba dang tha snyad kyang byed do //
translated: For example, although the nature of a person is ultimately empty, the nature that is imagined appears as the nature of a person and is also designated.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: bud med bzhin du zhes pa lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bud med bzhin du zhes pa lta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as ‚Äúlike a woman.‚Äù

original: sngar gyi nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ma yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ma yin la /
translated: It is not in the previous states of kalala and so on,

original: byi nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: byi nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it after birth.

original: @244b rnam par 'thor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @244b rnam par 'thor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is scattered.

original: thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it in the state of ashes, etc.,

original: gnyug ma'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no intrinsic nature.

original: 'dir 'di dang yang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dang yang mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to teach this in a way that is similar,

original: de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúJust as, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na rkyen tshogs par yod pa'i lus skyes bu bzhin du snang la /
analyzed: dper na rkyen tshogs par yod pa'i lus skyes bu bzhin du snang la /
translated: For example, the body, which exists in the collection of conditions, appears as a person.

original: de med pa na mi snang la /
analyzed: de med pa na mi snang la /
translated: When it does not exist, it does not appear.

original: de bzhin du ste ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa ji srid du rkyen tshogs pa de srid du lus ni lag pa la sogs par snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ste ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa ji srid du rkyen tshogs pa de srid du lus ni lag pa la sogs par snang ste /
translated: In the same way, that is, just as the body appears as hands, etc., for as long as the collection of conditions lasts,

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang la /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis rab tu snang la /
translated: it appears through the power of thought,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: de lta bas na lus kyi blo ni tshogs pa tshang ba la 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kyi blo ni tshogs pa tshang ba la 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the body occurs when the collection is complete,

original: de ma tshang na ma yin no //
analyzed: de ma tshang na ma yin no //
translated: but not when it is incomplete.

original: de lta bas na rmongs pa nyid las lag pa la sogs pa la lus kyi blo yin no zhes nges so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rmongs pa nyid las lag pa la sogs pa la lus kyi blo yin no zhes nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the cognition of the body is in the hands, etc., only through delusion.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'di dang 'di yod pa na dngos po de dang de med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshogs pa 'di dang 'di yod pa na dngos po de dang de med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When this and that collection of conditions exists, this and that thing does not exist.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba po ni 'khrul ba'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba po ni 'khrul ba'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who sees reality generates this thought through the power of error.

original: de'i dbang gis dbyibs kyi khyad par rnams la bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis dbyibs kyi khyad par rnams la bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the power of that, the conventions of the body of a woman or man are applied to the particular shape.

original: de lta bas na thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na tshogs pa ma tshang bas ldog par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta bas na thal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na tshogs pa ma tshang bas ldog par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, in the state of ashes, the collection is incomplete and so it ceases.

original: / de lta bas na lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta bas na lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the conventions of the body and so on are not real things.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩgang zhig gnas skabs spang ba yi //
analyzed: de skad du yang / gang zhig gnas skabs spang ba yi //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe one who speaks of the nature of the body

original: lus kyi rang bzhin smra bar bya //üîΩmer mer po dang thal ba las //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin smra bar bya // mer mer po dang thal ba las //
translated: In terms of the abandonment of its states

original: de mid phra mo dngos po yis //
analyzed: de mid phra mo dngos po yis //
translated: Through the subtle thing of the embryo and ashes

original: de rags spangs pas gnas she na //
analyzed: de rags spangs pas gnas she na //
translated: If it is thought that it abides because of the abandonment of the gross,

original: rang nyid bstan du med par 'thob //
analyzed: rang nyid bstan du med par 'thob //
translated: then it is obtained as not manifest in itself.

original: lus su brjod par ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: lus su brjod par ji ltar 'gyur // zhes brjod do //
translated: How can it be called a body?üîΩThus it is said.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: And it is said:

original: gang gi rgyu ni srid 'gyur ba //üîΩrkyen ni med na gnas min te //
analyzed: gang gi rgyu ni srid 'gyur ba // rkyen ni med na gnas min te //
translated: If it is a cause, it is not a condition.üîΩIf it is a condition, it is not a cause.

original: rkyen dang bral bas bral 'gyur la //
analyzed: rkyen dang bral bas bral 'gyur la //
translated: If it is not a cause, it is not a condition.

original: de yod ces ni ji ltar rtog / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de yod ces ni ji ltar rtog / ces gsungs so //
translated: How can it be conceived as existent?

original: gzhung kha cig las /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las /
translated: In some texts it is said:

original: ji srid rkyen tshogs de srid du //
analyzed: ji srid rkyen tshogs de srid du //
translated: As long as the conditions are assembled,

original: shing ni skyes pa ltar snang ba //
analyzed: shing ni skyes pa ltar snang ba //
translated: the tree appears to be born.

original: zhes so // de la bshad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes so // de la bshad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows.

original: ji srid du phyin ci log gi shes pa tshogs pa de srid du sdong du ma la skyes bu bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du phyin ci log gi shes pa tshogs pa de srid du sdong du ma la skyes bu bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
translated: As long as the assembly of erroneous cognitions exists, the tree is cognized as a person,

original: sdong dum gyi rang bzhin @245a * //üîΩla skyes pa ltar te skyes bu bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdong dum gyi rang bzhin @245a * // la skyes pa ltar te skyes bu bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: as if it were the nature of a stump.

original: de med na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de med na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so if it does not exist.

original: de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: It is the same with the arms and so on.

original: ji srid du rkyen tshogs pa de srid du lag pa la sogs pa 'di la lus su snang ste /
analyzed: ji srid du rkyen tshogs pa de srid du lag pa la sogs pa 'di la lus su snang ste /
translated: As long as the assembly of conditions exists, the body appears in the hand, etc.

original: rab tu gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba yin la /
translated: It is very clear.

original: phyi nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not later.

original: de'i phyir gti mug nyid las lus kyi blo yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gti mug nyid las lus kyi blo yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the idea of body arises from delusion alone.

original: gal te lus med na yang lag pa dang rkang pa rnams kyi yan lag rnams mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: gal te lus med na yang lag pa dang rkang pa rnams kyi yan lag rnams mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i phyir dgag par mi nus so zhes dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking that even if the body does not exist, the limbs such as the hand and foot are seen by direct perception, and so cannot be refuted,

original: lag pa la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa rnams la gzhan gyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
