translated: in order to demonstrate that the nature imagined by others in the hand, etc.üîΩis not tenable, he says:

original: de bzhin sor mo'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Likewise, the fingers, etc.

original: ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa na lus med pa de bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa na lus med pa de bzhin du lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the body does not exist when analyzed, so also the hand, foot, etc. do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir sor mo rnams kyi tshogs te bsdus pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sor mo rnams kyi tshogs te bsdus pa rnams yin la /
translated: Because they are the collection, the assembly of fingers.

original: sor mo rnams zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: sor mo rnams zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The fingers are a synecdoche.

original: rting pa la yang blta bar bya'o //üîΩde'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rting pa la yang blta bar bya'o // de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The heel should also be examined.üîΩIts nature is just that.

original: de lta bas na de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i rang bzhin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúits nature‚Äù is that.

original: rkang pa yang gang zhig yin 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkang pa yang gang zhig yin 'gyur te /
translated: And what is the foot?

original: de dag bsdus pa ma gtogs par rnam par dpyad pa na cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa ma gtogs par rnam par dpyad pa na cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Except for the collection of those, there is nothing at all when analyzed.

original: sor mo'i tshogs kyang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: sor mo'i tshogs kyang rang bzhin gcig pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The collection of fingers also does not have a single nature.üîΩHe says:

original: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That also is not a thing when analyzed.

original: de yang ni sor mo'i tshogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni sor mo'i tshogs kyang ngo //
translated: That also is the collection of fingers.

original: rnam par dpyad pa na dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa na dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a thing when analyzed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshigs kyi tshogs rnams bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs kyi tshogs rnams bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the collection of the collection of bones.

original: gang zhig yin zhes pa'i rang bzhin dang 'brel te /
analyzed: gang zhig yin zhes pa'i rang bzhin dang 'brel te /
translated: What is that? It is connected to ‚Äúnature.‚ÄùüîΩThe bones also are not things individually. He says:

original: tshigs kyang so sor dngos po ma yin no zhes gsungs pa tshigs kyang zhes te dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: tshigs kyang so sor dngos po ma yin no zhes gsungs pa tshigs kyang zhes te dngos po ma yin no //
translated: The bones also are not things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: che phye bas so //
analyzed: che phye bas so //
translated: Because they are divided into parts.

original: rang gis te bdag nyid kyis cha shas rnams phye bas te rnam par phye bas so //
analyzed: rang gis te bdag nyid kyis cha shas rnams phye bas te rnam par phye bas so //
translated: By itself, that is, by the self-division of the parts.

original: cha yang de kho na nyid du med do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: cha yang de kho na nyid du med do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: He says that the part also does not exist in reality:

original: cha yang ste rdul phra rab phye bas so //
analyzed: cha yang ste rdul phra rab phye bas so //
translated: The part also, that is, by the division of the subtle atom.

original: cha ni tshogs kyi chu'o //
analyzed: cha ni tshogs kyi chu'o //
translated: The part is the collection of the atoms.

original: yang ni rdul phra rab phye bas te /
analyzed: yang ni rdul phra rab phye bas te /
translated: Again, by the division of the subtle atom,

original: rdul phra rab kyi cha'i rnam par phye bas phyir btags pa nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyang so sor don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi cha'i rnam par phye bas phyir btags pa nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyang so sor don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: that is, by the division of the part of the subtle atom, the subtle atoms themselves are also not individually ultimately existent, since they are imputed by the intellect.üîΩHe says:

original: rdul @245b de la yang cha'i dbye ba yis zhes te /
analyzed: rdul @245b de la yang cha'i dbye ba yis zhes te /
translated: The part of that atom also, by the division of the part.

original: phyogs ni shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang steng dang 'og gi phyogs rang bzhin rnams te dbye ba'i sa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs ni shar dang nub dang lho dang byang dang steng dang 'og gi phyogs rang bzhin rnams te dbye ba'i sa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The directions are the east, west, south, north, above, and below, which are the natures of the divisions, since they are the various places.

original: de ni rnam par dbye bas phye ba nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par dbye bas phye ba nyid kyi rdul phra rab rnams cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is divided by the division of those, the subtle atoms themselves become six parts.

original: phyogs dbye ste phyogs re re so so na gnas pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi cha rdul phra rab rnams de las phye bas de'i rang bzhin gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dbye ste phyogs re re so so na gnas pa sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyi cha rdul phra rab rnams de las phye bas de'i rang bzhin gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The various parts of a form, which are located in different directions, are not the nature of the atoms that are distinguished from them.

original: phyogs kyi cha dbye ba gang la yod kyang de la gcig tu mi rigs so zhes pas so //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha dbye ba gang la yod kyang de la gcig tu mi rigs so zhes pas so //
translated: It is not logical for something that has directional parts to be one.

original: 'di ltar yang shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la mngon par phyogs pa gang yin pa'i rdul phra rab dbus na gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab de gcig nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang shar dang nub la sogs pa'i phyogs gnas pa'i rdul phra rab la mngon par phyogs pa gang yin pa'i rdul phra rab dbus na gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab de gcig nyid yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is the atom in the middle, which faces the atoms located in the east, west, and so on, the same as those atoms?

original: gzhan dang gzhan yin /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yin /
translated: Or is it different from them?

original: gal te gcig yin no zhes pa'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe bskor bar gnas pa'i rdul phra rab thams cad gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig yin no zhes pa'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe bskor bar gnas pa'i rdul phra rab thams cad gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the same, then it follows that all the atoms that surround it are one.

original: gang gi phyir shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi yul de med par nub phyogs la sogs pa na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i mngon par phyogs pa'i ngo bo'i mngon par phyogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi yul de med par nub phyogs la sogs pa na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i mngon par phyogs pa'i ngo bo'i mngon par phyogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the eastern particle does not exist without the object of the eastern particle, the western particle, etc., would not face the eastern particle, since they would not have the nature of facing the eastern object.

original: gzhan du na rang bzhin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur bas yul gcig na gnas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na rang bzhin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur bas yul gcig na gnas pa yang yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that they would have different natures, and they would not exist in the same place.

original: de khongs su 'dus pa med pa na shar phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de khongs su 'dus pa med pa na shar phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: If they were not included in it, they would not exist in the east.

original: rdul phra rab gzhan dang gzhan dag dang / rdul phra rab bdag nyid thams cad dang 'brel bas de'i rang bzhin du 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gzhan dang gzhan dag dang / rdul phra rab bdag nyid thams cad dang 'brel bas de'i rang bzhin du 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the other particles are connected with all the aspects of the particle, they would be the substance of the particle itself.

original: de ltar yin na yang bsags pa'i ngo bo'i ngo bo la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang bsags pa'i ngo bo'i ngo bo la sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if that were so, they would not have the nature of an accumulation, etc.

original: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa rnams kyi tshogs 'dod pa rnams kyi phyogs gnyis pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa la sogs pa rnams kyi tshogs 'dod pa rnams kyi phyogs gnyis pa nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who assert the collection of earth, etc. must accept the second position.

original: de'i tshe yang gzhan dang gzhan drug po rnams dang dus gcig tu 'brel bas dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang gzhan dang gzhan drug po rnams dang dus gcig tu 'brel bas dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab cha drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Even then, because the other six are simultaneously related, the subtle particle located in the middle would have six parts.

original: de dang de na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gzhan dang gzhan dag 'brel bas rdul phra rab de'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyang gcig tu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dang de na gnas pa'i rdul phra rab gzhan dang gzhan dag 'brel bas rdul phra rab de'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir 'di ltar rdul phra rab kyang gcig tu mi 'thad do //
translated: Because the subtle particles located there and there are related to other subtle particles, the nature of that subtle particle would be different. Thus, even a subtle particle is not tenable as one.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas //
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas //
translated: In this way, the Master has said:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: Since six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab @246a * //
analyzed: phra rab @246a * //
translated: the subtle particle

original: rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: would have six parts.

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
translated: If the six are in one place,

original: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the aggregate would be just the size of one particle.

original: de rnams kyang cha phra ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang cha phra ba rnams yin no //
translated: And those are the subtle parts.

original: de bzhin du dpyad pa na bdag med pa nyid kyi nam mkha'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpyad pa na bdag med pa nyid kyi nam mkha'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed pas /
translated: Likewise, when analyzed, it is realized to be the nature of space, which is the absence of self.

original: phyogs dbye yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs dbye yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe divisions of space are also like that.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi dbye ba yang phyogs kyi dbye ba rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi cha yang sngar bzhin du cha drug tu phye ba na ci zhig yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi dbye ba yang phyogs kyi dbye ba rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdul phra rab kyi cha yang sngar bzhin du cha drug tu phye ba na ci zhig yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The divisions of space are the parts of the subtle particles of space. When they are divided into six parts, as before, what remains?

original: dngos po cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nothing at all!

original: snga ma thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to all the previous cases.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: cha shas dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: cha shas dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are free from parts.

original: cha med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are partless.

original: de'i phyir mngon par phye ba dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nam mkha' stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par phye ba dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nam mkha' stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, space is empty, because it is devoid of divisions and intrinsic nature.

original: de rgyu des na rdul yang med do //
analyzed: de rgyu des na rdul yang med do //
translated: For that reason, there are no particles.

original: rdul phra rab med pa'i phyir 'di ltar lag pa la sogs pa yang rnam par dpyad pas rang bzhin med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab med pa'i phyir 'di ltar lag pa la sogs pa yang rnam par dpyad pas rang bzhin med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because there are no subtle particles, in the same way, hands and so on should be seen to be essenceless when analyzed.

original: des na lus kyang don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na lus kyang don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body also does not exist in the least in the ultimate,

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught to be free from one and many.

original: de ltar na yang sgra la sogs pa rnams bdag kyang ma yin la sems kyang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na yang sgra la sogs pa rnams bdag kyang ma yin la sems kyang ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, sounds, etc. are neither the self nor the mind,

original: lus dngos po la ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: lus dngos po la ngar 'dzin pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: and the body is not the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na ma rig pas kun nas bslang ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin yang bdag ces 'jug par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pas kun nas bslang ba'i bdag nyid kyis bdag la sogs pa la yod pa ma yin yang bdag ces 'jug par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, the self, etc. do not exist by way of their own nature, which is produced by ignorance, but they are engaged as ‚Äúself,‚Äù

original: shes pa ni yul med pa nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni yul med pa nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and consciousness is produced without an object.

original: des ni ji skad du /
analyzed: des ni ji skad du /
translated: This is established by the following statement:

original: bdag nyid gang yang yod min pas //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang yang yod min pas //
translated: Since there is no self at all,

original: 'jigs par 'gyur ba su zhig yin //üîΩzhes bas bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs par 'gyur ba su zhig yin // zhes bas bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: who is there to be frightened?

original: 'di dag thams cad kyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyis lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of this teaches the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: gang gsungs pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
translated: It is said in the Dharmasangiti:

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid 'di ltar lus 'di ni rkang pa dang / rkang sor dang / byin pa dang / brla dang / bcu drug mdo dang / lto ba dang / lte ba dang / sgal tshigs dang / snying dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid 'di ltar lus 'di ni rkang pa dang / rkang sor dang / byin pa dang / brla dang / bcu drug mdo dang / lto ba dang / lte ba dang / sgal tshigs dang / snying dang /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, son of noble family, this body is nothing but a collection of feet, toes, calves, thighs, hips, belly, navel, spine, heart,

original: rtsir logs dang / rtsib ma dang / lag pa dang / lag ngar dang / dpung pa dang / thal gong dang / mjing pa dang / 'gram pa dang / dpral ba dang / mgo bo dang / mgo bo'i thod pa 'dus @246b pa tsam ste las 'byung ba'i byed pas bsags pa /
analyzed: rtsir logs dang / rtsib ma dang / lag pa dang / lag ngar dang / dpung pa dang / thal gong dang / mjing pa dang / 'gram pa dang / dpral ba dang / mgo bo dang / mgo bo'i thod pa 'dus @246b pa tsam ste las 'byung ba'i byed pas bsags pa /
translated: ribs, ribs, hands, forearms, shoulders, upper arms, neck, cheeks, forehead, head, and skull. It is a collection of elements that arose from karma,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa brgya stong gi gnas su gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa brgya stong gi gnas su gyur ba'o //
translated: the abode of hundreds of thousands of different afflictions, secondary afflictions, thoughts, and concepts.

original: 'dir rdzas mang po 'dus pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir rdzas mang po 'dus pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, this collection of many substances is as follows:

original: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / sha'i phyi dang / rgyus pa dang / tshil dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / mcher pa dang / gcin dang /
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / rus pa dang / pags pa dang / sha dang / sha'i phyi dang / rgyus pa dang / tshil dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / mcher pa dang / gcin dang /
translated: hair, body hair, nails, teeth, bone, skin, flesh, the outer skin, veins, fat, grease, synovial fluid, spleen, urine,üîΩ

original: phyi sa dang / pho ba dang / long ka dang / khrag dang / snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / rnag dang / mchil ma dang / glang pa dang / glang rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: phyi sa dang / pho ba dang / long ka dang / khrag dang / snabs dang / mkhris pa dang / rnag dang / mchil ma dang / glang pa dang / glang rgyas rnams te /
translated: hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, mucus, fluid in the cavities, urine, and the head with the brain.üîΩ‚ÄúThis body is a collection of many impure things, filled with intestines, stomach, liver, heart, spleen, lungs, kidneys, bladder, feces, blood, veins, bones, marrow, head, brain, and so on.

original: de ltar na rdzas mang po 'dus pa yin na 'di la lus zhes ji skad du bya snyam du lus dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas mang po 'dus pa yin na 'di la lus zhes ji skad du bya snyam du lus dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
translated: When it is a collection of many substances, what is this that is called ‚Äòbody‚Äô?

original: de so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de so sor rtog pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he examines it, he thinks,

original: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so snyam nas de lus la nam mkha' ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
analyzed: lus 'di ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so snyam nas de lus la nam mkha' ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go //
translated: ‚ÄòThis body is like space.‚Äô He places mindfulness in the body as like space.

original: de thams cad nam mkha' ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de thams cad nam mkha' ltar mthong ngo //
translated: He sees everything as like space.

original: de lus yongs su shes pa'i phyir yang gang du yang dran pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de lus yongs su shes pa'i phyir yang gang du yang dran pa mi 'jug go //
translated: Because he understands the body, his mindfulness does not engage anywhere.

original: rnam par mi 'jug go //üîΩrnam par mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'jug go // rnam par mi 'jug go //
translated: It does not engage.üîΩIt does not engage.

original: rnam par mi 'phro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'phro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It does not proliferate.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: lus 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: lus 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: This body does not come from the past

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi 'pho /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi 'pho /
translated: and does not go to the future.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las kyang mi gnas te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las kyang mi gnas te /
translated: It does not abide between the past and future.

original: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log las byung ba byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log las byung ba byed pa po dang / tshor ba po med pa /
translated: Other than that, it arises from unreal error, is without an agent and a feeler,

original: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pa /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pa /
translated: is without a beginning, end, or middle,

original: rtsa ba gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba gnas pa med pa /
translated: is without a root or basis,

original: bdag po med pa /
analyzed: bdag po med pa /
translated: is without a master,

original: nga yi ba med pa /
analyzed: nga yi ba med pa /
translated: is without an ‚ÄúI,‚Äù

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: and is without grasping.

original: tshigs zhes bya ba dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / longs spyod ces bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / ro zhes bya ba dang / skye mched ces ya ba ni glo bur gyi tha snyad rnams kyi tha snyad btags pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs zhes bya ba dang / lus zhes bya ba dang / longs spyod ces bya ba dang / gnas zhes bya ba dang / ro zhes bya ba dang / skye mched ces ya ba ni glo bur gyi tha snyad rnams kyi tha snyad btags pa'o //
translated: The terms ‚Äúlimbs,‚Äù ‚Äúbody,‚Äù ‚Äúenjoyments,‚Äù ‚Äúabode,‚Äù ‚Äútaste,‚Äù and ‚Äúsense bases‚Äù are designations of conventional terms that are adventitious.

original: lus 'di ni snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: lus 'di ni snying po med pa ste /
translated: This body is without essence.

original: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag las byung ba'i mi gtsang ba rul pa /
analyzed: pha ma'i khu ba dang / khrag las byung ba'i mi gtsang ba rul pa /
translated: It is a filthy, putrid substance derived from the semen and blood of one‚Äôs parents.

original: rang bzhin gyis dri mi zhim pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dri mi zhim pa /
translated: It is naturally malodorous.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las 'jigs pa dang / sgyid lug pa'i rkun pos dkrugs pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las 'jigs pa dang / sgyid lug pa'i rkun pos dkrugs pa /
translated: It is disturbed by the thieves of fear and laziness arising from attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: rtag tu 'jigs pas 'brul ba bral ba /
analyzed: rtag tu 'jigs pas 'brul ba bral ba /
translated: It is always fleeing due to fear.

original: rnam par 'joms pa'i chos can /üîΩnang tha dad @247a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa'i chos can / nang tha dad @247a * //
translated: It is a thing that is destroyed.

original: pa brgya stong gi tshang ngo snyam du lus dran pa nye bar 'jog go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa brgya stong gi tshang ngo snyam du lus dran pa nye bar 'jog go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is a nest of hundreds of thousands of different internal parasites.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam pa thams cad du lus yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe rnam par dpyad pa na stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' dang 'dra bar rnam pa thams cad du lus yin na /
translated: Thus, when one analyzes the body in this way, if it is like space in that its nature is emptiness,

original: de'i tshe log pa nyid kyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid du sgro btags nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe log pa nyid kyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid du sgro btags nas /
translated: then at that time, due to superimposing the reality of a false thing,üîΩattachment and so on arise and the wheel of life is increased.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa bskyed pas byis pa rnams 'khor nye bar 'phel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa bskyed pas byis pa rnams 'khor nye bar 'phel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes pa ste brjod pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ste brjod pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Thus, in the order of expression.

original: rmi lam lta bu ni rmi lam la dmigs pa nyid kyi dngos po la yid mi bde ba'i gnas la su zhig chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu ni rmi lam la dmigs pa nyid kyi dngos po la yid mi bde ba'i gnas la su zhig chags par 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of things that are like a dream, who would be attached to a place of mental dissatisfaction, just by observing a dream?

original: gang zhig zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig zhen par 'gyur /
translated: Who would be attached?

original: 'di yang mtshon pa tsam yin pa'i phyir su zhig zhe sdang bar 'gyur zhing su zhig rmongs par 'gyur zhes kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang mtshon pa tsam yin pa'i phyir su zhig zhe sdang bar 'gyur zhing su zhig rmongs par 'gyur zhes kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: This is just an illustration, so it should be understood that who would be angry, and who would be deluded?

original: de bzhin du yid bde ba'i gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs sna tshogs mthong nas chags pa skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩyid mi bde ba'i gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs rnams su mthong nas zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid bde ba'i gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs sna tshogs mthong nas chags pa skye bar 'gyur ro // yid mi bde ba'i gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs rnams su mthong nas zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the eyes see various forms in places of mental satisfaction, attachment arises.üîΩWhen the eyes see forms in places of mental dissatisfaction, aversion arises.

original: btang snyoms kyi gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gti mug skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi gnas rnams la mig dag gis gzugs rnams mthong nas gti mug skye bar 'gyur //
translated: When the eyes see forms in places of equanimity, delusion arises.

original: gang de dag yid dang rjes su mi mthun pa med pa'i gzugs dang rjes su mthun par spyod de /
analyzed: gang de dag yid dang rjes su mi mthun pa med pa'i gzugs dang rjes su mthun par spyod de /
translated: He acts in accordance with forms that are agreeable to the mind.

original: des 'di la chags pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'di la chags pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, attachment arises in him.

original: yid dang rjes su mi mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la ni mi mthun par spyod de /
analyzed: yid dang rjes su mi mthun pa'i gzugs rnams la ni mi mthun par spyod de /
translated: He acts in opposition to forms that are disagreeable to the mind.

original: des 'di la zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrjes su mthun par yang ma yin /
analyzed: des 'di la zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ro // rjes su mthun par yang ma yin /
translated: From that, aversion arises in him.

original: rjes su mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la rmongs pas spyod de /
analyzed: rjes su mi mthun pa yang ma yin pa rnams la rmongs pas spyod de /
translated: He acts in a confused way toward those that are neither agreeable nor disagreeable.

original: des 'di la gti mug skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des 'di la gti mug skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, delusion arises in him.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la rnam pa gsum du dmigs shing nyams su myong ba sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa rnams la rnam pa gsum du dmigs shing nyams su myong ba sngar bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, he observes and experiences sounds, etc., in three ways, as before.

original: de la gang dpyod ldan su zhig ces te /
analyzed: de la gang dpyod ldan su zhig ces te /
translated: Here, who is the one who investigates?

original: shin tu yang mig gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: shin tu yang mig gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: The eye sense-sphere is also completely empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye sense-sphere.

original: des sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: des sngon gyi mtha' yang mi dmigs la /
translated: He does not observe an earlier limit.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang mi dmigs shing /
translated: He does not observe a later limit.

original: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dbus kyang mi dmigs te /
translated: He does not observe a middle.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs @247b pa gzhan la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs @247b pa gzhan la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other faculties such as the ear.

original: de bzhin du shin tu yang gzugs kyi skye mched gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu yang gzugs kyi skye mched gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes sngar bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the form base is also empty of the intrinsic reality of form, as before.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for sound, etc.

original: de ltar na dbang po rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
translated: Thus, the faculties are like illusions,

original: yul rnams ni rmi lam lta bu gang gi yin pa de la ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul rnams ni rmi lam lta bu gang gi yin pa de la ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the objects are like dreams. For whom will attachment, etc., arise?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dpyod ldan zhes te /üîΩdpyod pa po mkhas pa de bzhin du 'di yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba su zhig chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpyod ldan zhes te / dpyod pa po mkhas pa de bzhin du 'di yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba su zhig chags par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise one‚Äù

original: sdang ba'am rmongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdang ba'am rmongs par 'gyur /
translated: . For whom does attachment, aversion, or delusion arise?

original: 'di yang rmi lam na mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe gsungs pa nye bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rmi lam na mthong ba'i yul gyi bzang mo la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe gsungs pa nye bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: This should be taught by demonstrating the example of the beautiful woman, etc. that the BhagavƒÅn taught in the dream.

original: lus med na yang bud med la sogs pa rtogs pas kyang chags par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus med na yang bud med la sogs pa rtogs pas kyang chags par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, when there is no body, it is not reasonable to be attached even by the conception of a woman, etc.

original: lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To teach this, he says, ‚ÄúEven if there is no body,‚Äù and so on.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs sdud pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù includes the reason.

original: gang gi phyir bud med la sogs pa brtags pas chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bud med la sogs pa brtags pas chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one would not be attached by the conception of a woman, etc.

original: gang gi tshe lus 'di ltar brjod pa'i rigs pas med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus 'di ltar brjod pa'i rigs pas med de /
translated: When this body does not exist in the way that it is conceived,

original: rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe lus med pa'i phyir bud med gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa de'i tshe lus med pa'i phyir bud med gang zhig yin te /
translated: then, since it does not exist, what woman is there?

original: chags byed ma gang zhig chags par bya ba nyid kyi skyes bu la ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: chags byed ma gang zhig chags par bya ba nyid kyi skyes bu la ji ltar chags par 'gyur /
translated: What woman, who is the object of attachment, would a man, who is the subject of attachment, be attached to?

original: skyes bu yang gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu yang gang zhig yin te /
translated: What man is there?

original: chags pa po gang zhig dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi bud med la chags par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa po gang zhig dga' bar bya ba nyid kyi bud med la chags par 'gyur //
translated: What man, who is the subject of attachment, would be attached to a woman, who is the object of attachment?

original: bud med kyang bdag nyid la bud med ces brtags nas pha rol gyi skyes bu la skyes bu zhes chags pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bud med kyang bdag nyid la bud med ces brtags nas pha rol gyi skyes bu la skyes bu zhes chags pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Women, having imagined themselves to be women, generate desire for a man, imagining him to be a man.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu yang bdag nyid la skyes bu zhes brtags nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu yang bdag nyid la skyes bu zhes brtags nas /
translated: In the same way, men, having imagined themselves to be men,

original: bud med la bud med ces brtags nas chags pa skyed do //
analyzed: bud med la bud med ces brtags nas chags pa skyed do //
translated: having imagined a woman to be a woman, generate desire.

original: lus med na yang bud med la bud med ces yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus med na yang bud med la bud med ces yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if there is no body, there is no woman in the woman,

original: skyes pa la skyes ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa la skyes ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and no man in the man.

original: gang yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And if they do not exist by intrinsic nature,

original: bud med yod pa ma yin zhing skyes ba yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde lta bas na lus po med pa la bud med la sogs par brtags pas byas pa'i chags par rigs pa @248a * //
analyzed: bud med yod pa ma yin zhing skyes ba yod pa ma yin no // de lta bas na lus po med pa la bud med la sogs par brtags pas byas pa'i chags par rigs pa @248a * //
translated: there is no woman and no man.üîΩTherefore, it is not reasonable to generate desire for a woman, etc.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: that is fabricated by the imagination of a body that does not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: All things are free from signs.

original: ji ltar 'di gtsor bstan pa de bzhin du phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gtsor bstan pa de bzhin du phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the garland, sandalwood, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yul yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gi yul yang ngo //
translated: The same for the object of hatred and the object of delusion.

original: de skad du yab dang sras mjal ba las bstan te /
analyzed: de skad du yab dang sras mjal ba las bstan te /
translated: The Pitaputrasamagama-sutra teaches this.

original: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat king, this person is made up of six elements,

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug pa /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug pa /
translated: has six sense spheres,

original: yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad pa ste /
translated: and is made up of eighteen parts.

original: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa gang smras ba de cil brten te smras she na /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa gang smras ba de cil brten te smras she na /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat king, when one says that this person is made up of six elements, what is the meaning of this?

original: rgyal po chen po khams drug ni 'di dag go //üîΩdrug gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khams drug ni 'di dag go // drug gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat king, the six elements are

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.

original: rgyal po chen po de dag ni khams drug ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de dag ni khams drug ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat king, these are the six elements.

original: skyes bu 'di khams drug po zhes gdangs smras pa de ni de la brten te smras so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di khams drug po zhes gdangs smras pa de ni de la brten te smras so //
translated: The person is said to be the six elements.

original: skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'o zhes gang smras bde ci la brten te smras zhe na /üîΩrgyal po chen po'i ga pa'i skye mched drug ni 'di dag ste drug gang zhe na /üîΩgzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir mig gi reg pa'i skye mched dang / sgra rnams la nyan pa'i phyir rna ba'i reg pa'i skye mched dang / dri rnams la snom pa'i phyir sna'i reg pa'i skye mched dang / ro rnams la myang ba'i phyir lce'i reg pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: skyes bu 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'o zhes gang smras bde ci la brten te smras zhe na / rgyal po chen po'i ga pa'i skye mched drug ni 'di dag ste drug gang zhe na / gzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir mig gi reg pa'i skye mched dang / sgra rnams la nyan pa'i phyir rna ba'i reg pa'i skye mched dang / dri rnams la snom pa'i phyir sna'i reg pa'i skye mched dang / ro rnams la myang ba'i phyir lce'i reg pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: The person is said to be the six sense bases.üîΩThe six sense bases are the eye sense base, the ear sense base, the nose sense base, the tongue sense base, the body sense base, and the thinking-mind sense base.

original: reg bya rnams la reg pa'i phyir lus reg pa'i skye mched dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa'i phyir yid reg pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: reg bya rnams la reg pa'i phyir lus reg pa'i skye mched dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa'i phyir yid reg pa'i skye mched do //
translated: The six sense bases are the eye sense base for seeing forms, the ear sense base for hearing sounds, the nose sense base for smelling smells, the tongue sense base for tasting tastes, the body sense base for feeling touchables, and the thinking-mind sense base for knowing things.

original: rgyal po chen po de dag ni reg pa'i skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de dag ni reg pa'i skye mched drug ste /
translated: Your Majesty, these are the six sense bases.

original: skyes pa 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'o zhes gang smras pa de ni de la brten te smras so //
analyzed: skyes pa 'di ni reg pa'i skye mched drug pa'o zhes gang smras pa de ni de la brten te smras so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis person is the six bases of contact‚Äù is made in dependence upon them.

original: rgyal po chen po skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad po zhes gang smras pa de ci la ste smras she na /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po skyes bu 'di ni yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad po zhes gang smras pa de ci la ste smras she na /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, the statement ‚ÄòThis person has eighteen courses of thought‚Äô is made in dependence upon what?‚Äù

original: rgyal po chen po yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad ni 'di dag ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po yid kyi nye bar 'khor ba bco brgyad ni 'di dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, the eighteen courses of thought are as follows:

original: bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eighteen?

original: 'di la mig gis gzugs mthong ba na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms su 'gyur bar gzugs la nye bar spyod do //
analyzed: 'di la mig gis gzugs mthong ba na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms su 'gyur bar gzugs la nye bar spyod do //
translated: Here, when the eye sees forms, it experiences forms that are a basis for joy, a basis for sorrow, and a basis for equanimity.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the ear and so on.

original: rgyal po chen po bco brgyad po de la @248b gang dag yid bde ba nye bar spyod pa drug dang / gang dag yid mi bde bar nye bar spyod pa drug dang / gang dag btang snyoms su gyur pa nye bar spyod pa drug po de dag gcig tu bsdus nas yid kyi nye bar spyod pa bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bco brgyad po de la @248b gang dag yid bde ba nye bar spyod pa drug dang / gang dag yid mi bde bar nye bar spyod pa drug dang / gang dag btang snyoms su gyur pa nye bar spyod pa drug po de dag gcig tu bsdus nas yid kyi nye bar spyod pa bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eighteen great kings are the six that are the experience of mental pleasure, the six that are the experience of mental displeasure, and the six that are the experience of equanimity.

original: rgyal po chen po bco brgyad po de dag ni yid kyi nye bar spyod pa ste /üîΩde bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bco brgyad po de dag ni yid kyi nye bar spyod pa ste / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These eighteen great kings are the experience of the mind.

original: rgyal po chen po gang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na /üîΩgang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang gi sa'i khams gang zhe na / gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Great King, what is the earth element?üîΩWhatever is hard, solid, and clung to,

original: lus 'di la nang gi khang na sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa dang / nye bar 'gyur ba dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'di la nang gi khang na sra ba dang / mkhrang ba'i rnam pa dang / nye bar 'gyur ba dang / zin pa'o //
translated: and is internal, belonging to oneself.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: hair of the head, hair of the body, nails, and so on.

original: / rgyal po chen po phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: / rgyal po chen po phyi rol gyi sa'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: Great King, what is the external earth element?

original: gang ci yang rung ste phyi rol gyi sra ba dang mkhrang ba'i rnam pa dang / nye bar ma gyur pa dang / ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ste phyi rol gyi sra ba dang mkhrang ba'i rnam pa dang / nye bar ma gyur pa dang / ma zin pa 'di ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is hard, solid, and not appropriated, and is external, is called the external earth element.

original: rgyal po chen po de la nang gi sa'i khams 'byung ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de la nang gi sa'i khams 'byung ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, when the internal earth element arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang sogs par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang sogs par mi 'gro'o //
translated: When it ceases, it does not accumulate anywhere.

original: rgyal po chen po bud med nang du bdag ni bud med do zhes rtog cing /üîΩde nang du bud med ces brtags nas phyi rol du skyes pa zhes rtog go //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bud med nang du bdag ni bud med do zhes rtog cing / de nang du bud med ces brtags nas phyi rol du skyes pa zhes rtog go //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat King, a woman thinks of herself as a woman internally.üîΩHaving thought of herself as a woman internally, she thinks of a man externally.

original: de'i phyi rol du skyes pa skyes pa zhes brtags nas chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du skyes pa skyes pa zhes brtags nas chags par 'gyur te /
translated: Having thought of a man externally as a man, she becomes attached.

original: phyi rol gyi skyes pa dang phrad par 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skyes pa dang phrad par 'dod do //
translated: She desires to unite with an external man.

original: skyes pa yang nang du bdag skyes pa zhes rtog ste /
analyzed: skyes pa yang nang du bdag skyes pa zhes rtog ste /
translated: A man thinks of himself as a man internally.

original: de nang du bdag ni skyes ba zhes brtags nas /
analyzed: de nang du bdag ni skyes ba zhes brtags nas /
translated: Having thought of himself as a man internally,

original: phyi rol du bud med la bud med ces rtog go //
analyzed: phyi rol du bud med la bud med ces rtog go //
translated: he thinks of a woman externally as a woman.

original: phyi rol du bud med la bud med ces brtags nas chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol du bud med la bud med ces brtags nas chags par 'gyur te /
translated: Externally, one imagines a woman to be a woman and becomes attached.

original: phyi rol gyi bud med dang phrad par 'dod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bud med dang phrad par 'dod do //
translated: One desires to unite with an external woman.

original: phrad par 'dod pas phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad par 'dod pas phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the desire to unite, one unites.

original: phrad pa'i rkyen gyis mer mer po skye bar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod do //
analyzed: phrad pa'i rkyen gyis mer mer po skye bar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod do //
translated: Through the condition of uniting, the kalala arises.

original: rgyal po chen po gang la kun du brtags pa dang / gang kun du rtog pa de gnyis ka yang med do //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gang la kun du brtags pa dang / gang kun du rtog pa de gnyis ka yang med do //
translated: Your Majesty, that which is imagined and that which imagines are both non-existent.

original: bud med la ni bud med med do //
analyzed: bud med la ni bud med med do //
translated: There is no woman in a woman.

original: skyes pa la ni skyes pa med do//
analyzed: skyes pa la ni skyes pa med do//
translated: There is no man in a man.

original: de ltar med cing yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa skyes te /
analyzed: de ltar med cing yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa skyes te /
translated: Thus, a false imagination arises that is non-existent.

original: kun du rtog pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa de yang ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
translated: That imagination also does not exist by way of its own nature.

original: kun du rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du phrad pa dang / mer mer po yang ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du phrad pa dang / mer mer po yang ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
translated: Just as with imagination, union and the kalala also do not exist by way of their own nature.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa de ji ltar sra ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa de ji ltar sra ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How could that which does not exist by way of its own nature arise as solid?

original: rgyal po chen @249a * //
analyzed: rgyal po chen @249a * //
translated: Your Majesty,

original: po de ltar kun du rtog pa shes par byas nas sra ba nyid rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: po de ltar kun du rtog pa shes par byas nas sra ba nyid rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Having understood the conception in this way, one should understand solidity.

original: ci nas sra ba ni skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas sra ba ni skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that when solidity arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ltar gang lus 'di dur khrod kyi mthar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod de /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ltar gang lus 'di dur khrod kyi mthar 'gyur ba'i dus de yod de /
translated: Great King, it is like this: there is a time when this body will go to the end of the charnel ground.

original: de'i sra ba de 'jig cing 'gag par 'gyur ba'i tshe shar phyogs su mi 'gro /
analyzed: de'i sra ba de 'jig cing 'gag par 'gyur ba'i tshe shar phyogs su mi 'gro /
translated: When that solidity is destroyed and ceases, it does not go to the east.

original: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / steng dang / 'og dang / phyogs mtshams rnams su yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: It does not go to the south, west, or north, to the nadir or the zenith, or to the intermediate directions.

original: rgyal po chen po nang gi sa'i khams ni de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po nang gi sa'i khams ni de ltar blta'o //
translated: Great King, the internal earth element should be seen in this way.

original: snga ma bzhin du de la rgyal po chen po de ltar sa'i khams te 'byung ba yang stong /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de la rgyal po chen po de ltar sa'i khams te 'byung ba yang stong /
translated: As before, ‚ÄúGreat King, the earth element is like this: its arising is empty.

original: sa'i khams 'jig pa dang / 'byung ba yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo /
analyzed: sa'i khams 'jig pa dang / 'byung ba yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo /
translated: The destruction and arising of the earth element is empty of essence.

original: rgyal po chen po sa'i khams ni tha snyad tsam ma gtogs par sa'i khams nyid mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po sa'i khams ni tha snyad tsam ma gtogs par sa'i khams nyid mi dmigs te /
translated: Your Majesty, the earth element is not apprehended apart from mere convention.

original: tha snyad de yang bud med ma yin /
analyzed: tha snyad de yang bud med ma yin /
translated: That convention is not a woman.

original: skyes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not a man.

original: rgyal po chen po de ltar de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rtogs shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ltar de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi shes rab kyis rtogs shig ces gsungs so //
translated: Your Majesty, you should understand that through correct wisdom.

original: des na ci zhig la dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: des na ci zhig la dpyad par bya ste /
translated: What then is to be examined?

original: dpyad par bya ba'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba'i yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not an object of examination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni dpyad pa dang bral ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dpyad pa dang bral ba'o zhes so //
translated: All phenomena are free from examination.

original: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the application of mindfulness to the body in this way,

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the application of mindfulness to feelings,

original: tshor ba rnam par dpyad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam par dpyad pa gsungs so //
translated: the examination of feelings is stated.

original: tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Feelings are of three kinds:

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, and the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de la gzugs bzhin du tshor ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs bzhin du tshor ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Feeling does not ultimately exist, like form.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te sdug bsngal de bde ba ma yin pa'i myong ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal de bde ba ma yin pa'i myong ba yin la /
translated: If suffering is the experience of not being happy,

original: de nyid du ste don dam par yod pa yin na de'i tshor ba dga' la mi gnod de /
analyzed: de nyid du ste don dam par yod pa yin na de'i tshor ba dga' la mi gnod de /
translated: and it exists ultimately, then that feeling of pleasure would not be harmful.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i rnams ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i rnams ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur /

original: bde ba yang gal te don dam par yod na /
analyzed: bde ba yang gal te don dam par yod na /
translated: If pleasure exists ultimately,

original: de'i tshe mya ngan gdung sogs la ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe mya ngan gdung sogs la ste /
translated: then at that time, when one is afflicted by grief,üîΩand so on,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / smyos ba la sogs pas gdungs pa la'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / smyos ba la sogs pas gdungs pa la'o //
translated: and so on refers to being afflicted by desire, fear, insanity, and so on.

original: zhim sogs ni gal te bde ba yin na'o //
analyzed: zhim sogs ni gal te bde ba yin na'o //
translated: If delicious and so on are pleasure,

original: zhim pa la sogs pa ni ro mchog gi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhim pa la sogs pa ni ro mchog gi bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: delicious and so on refers to delicious food and drink and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni me tog dang @249b tsandan la sogs pa'i bde ba bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni me tog dang @249b tsandan la sogs pa'i bde ba bzung ste /
translated: And so on refers to the pleasure of flowers, sandalwood, and so on.

original: bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the causes of pleasure.

original: gal te bde ba yin na ci ste dga' bar mi byed /
analyzed: gal te bde ba yin na ci ste dga' bar mi byed /

original: gal te dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: If it is the nature of an existent thing,

original: brgya la yang bzlog par spro ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brgya la yang bzlog par spro ba yang ma yin no //

original: de lta bas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar bya ba ni rtogs pas gzhag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar bya ba ni rtogs pas gzhag pa nyid yin no //

original: de brjod pa ni ci ste rab dga' la mi gnod ces so //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni ci ste rab dga' la mi gnod ces so //
translated: What is said about that? ‚Äú Why does it not harm one who is delighted?‚Äù

original: de la gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa ni stobs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa ni stobs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
translated: The reply to that is: ‚ÄúBecause it is powerful.‚Äù

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: In the state of delight,

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: pain is not completely absent.

original: 'on kyang phul du byung ba'i 'jug pa'i bde bas /
analyzed: 'on kyang phul du byung ba'i 'jug pa'i bde bas /
translated: But it is obscured by the pleasure that is predominant.

original: mi mngon par byas pa las yod kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin no //üîΩstobs dang ldan pa ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: mi mngon par byas pa las yod kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin no // stobs dang ldan pa ni shin tu stobs dang ldan pas so //
translated: Although it exists, it is not experienced.üîΩPowerful means very powerful.

original: zil mnan phyir ni mngon par zil gyis mnan cing nye bar bcom pas so //
analyzed: zil mnan phyir ni mngon par zil gyis mnan cing nye bar bcom pas so //
translated: Because it is suppressed means because it is completely suppressed and destroyed.

original: de gal te yod na yang bde ba myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de gal te yod na yang bde ba myong ba ma yin te /
translated: But even if it does exist, it is not experienced.

original: rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rig par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: It is not an object of awareness.

original: de'i tshe 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes /

original: gang zhig nyams myong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig nyams myong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is called ‚Äúexperience‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: myong ba nyid ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: myong ba nyid ni tshor ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Experience is the nature of feeling.

original: ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar te rnam pa gang gis so //

original: bde ba bde ba'i gsal ba gang zhig nyams myong ba dag nyid min na ste /
analyzed: bde ba bde ba'i gsal ba gang zhig nyams myong ba dag nyid min na ste /
translated: If pleasure is not the experience of the manifestation of pleasure,

original: gang gis nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //üîΩmyong bar byed pas myong ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gis nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o // myong bar byed pas myong ba zhes brjod do //
translated: if it is not the nature of what is experienced,üîΩit is called experience because it causes experience.

original: myong ba ni nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: myong ba ni nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: Experience is called ‚Äúwhat is experienced‚Äù in the statement.

original: gal te yang myong bar bya ba ma yin pa yang myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang myong bar bya ba ma yin pa yang myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If what is not to be experienced is also experienced,

original: de'i tshe cung zad kyang myong ba ma yin pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe cung zad kyang myong ba ma yin pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te de ltar na yang rnam pa thams cad du ma myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na yang rnam pa thams cad du ma myong ba ni ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang nyams su myong ba na yang phra bas nyams su ma myong ba dang 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyams su myong ba na yang phra bas nyams su ma myong ba dang 'dra ba yin no zhe na /

original: sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúSuffering, etc.‚Äù

original: phra mo nyid de nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phra mo nyid de nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of the illustration of that very subtlety.

original: sdug bsngal yod cing bdog pa'o ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod cing bdog pa'o ;
translated: Suffering exists and is present.

original: /'o na bde ba stobs dang ldan pa 'di la ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na bde ba stobs dang ldan pa 'di la ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: But what about this powerful pleasure?

original: 'di yi rags pa gsal yin nam //
analyzed: 'di yi rags pa gsal yin nam //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIs this gross, clear, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes te / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs na rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te / rab tu dga' ba'i gnas skabs na rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is engaged in the state of supreme joy.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i bde bas rags shing stobs dang ldan pas sdug bsngal 'di bsal zhing zil @250a * //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i bde bas rags shing stobs dang ldan pas sdug bsngal 'di bsal zhing zil @250a * //
translated: Is this suffering not removed and overcome by that powerful pleasure, because it is gross and powerful?

original: gyis mnan pa ma yin nam zhes pa ni gzhan la 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: gyis mnan pa ma yin nam zhes pa ni gzhan la 'bod pa'o //
translated: This is an address to another.

original: kye gal te khyod de ltar 'dod na /üîΩphra ba zhes bya ba'i sdug bsngal bde ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na /
analyzed: kye gal te khyod de ltar 'dod na / phra ba zhes bya ba'i sdug bsngal bde ba nyams su myong ba'i dus na /
translated: O, if you assert that,üîΩthen at the time of experiencing pleasure,

original: cung zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zhig kyang dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: the suffering called subtle is not perceived at all.

original: des na ci zhig de'i phra ba yin zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci zhig de'i phra ba yin zhes brjod par bya zhe na /

original: 'on te / de ni de las gzhan dga' tsam //
analyzed: 'on te / de ni de las gzhan dga' tsam //

original: zhes te / de las ni phul du byung ba'i bde ba las so //
analyzed: zhes te / de las ni phul du byung ba'i bde ba las so //
translated: It is more pleasant than that, i.e., than the highest pleasure.

original: gzhan dga' tsam ni gnyis pa bde ba tsam ste /
analyzed: gzhan dga' tsam ni gnyis pa bde ba tsam ste /
translated: It is more pleasant than that, i.e., than the second pleasure, which is mere pleasure.

original: shin tu chung ba'i bde ba'i cha tsam du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu chung ba'i bde ba'i cha tsam du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is a mere part of a very small pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal phra bar 'gyur ro zhes gal te mngon par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phra bar 'gyur ro zhes gal te mngon par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that it is subtle suffering,

original: ci ste de'ang de'i phra nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste de'ang de'i phra nyid de /
translated: then that is also its subtlety.

original: gzhan rab tu dga' ba tsam bde ba 'di'i phra ba tsam yin na sdug bsngal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rab tu dga' ba tsam bde ba 'di'i phra ba tsam yin na sdug bsngal ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is the subtlety of this pleasure, which is more pleasant than that, i.e., than the second pleasure, then it is not suffering,

original: dga' ba bde ba'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba bde ba'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because pleasure is the type of feeling that is pleasant.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi phra ba nyid ni bde ba myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi dus na med do zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi phra ba nyid ni bde ba myong ba'i rang bzhin gyi dus na med do zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the subtlety of suffering does not exist when the nature of pleasure is being experienced.

original: de ltar na yang sdug bsngal ni brtags pas glo bur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang sdug bsngal ni brtags pas glo bur ba yin te /
translated: In that case, suffering is adventitious because it is imagined.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir /

original: brgya la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brgya la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //

original: 'dir gal te 'gal rkyen zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te 'gal rkyen zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, someone says: ‚ÄúIf the condition of the opposite, etc.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba'i bde ba'i rkyen ni rgyu ste gang rig pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gal ba'i bde ba'i rkyen ni rgyu ste gang rig pa'o //

original: des skyes pas te /
analyzed: des skyes pas te /
translated: It is arisen from that.

original: mngon par phyogs pa yod pa na'o //
analyzed: mngon par phyogs pa yod pa na'o //
translated: It is present when it is manifest.

original: yang na 'gal ba'i rkyen bde ba'i rgyu skyes shing skye ba na'am /
analyzed: yang na 'gal ba'i rkyen bde ba'i rgyu skyes shing skye ba na'am /

analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen gang gi yin pa zhes pa'o //

original: de'i tshe rtog pas mngon par zhen pa nyid kyi tshor ba zhes pa 'ongs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtog pas mngon par zhen pa nyid kyi tshor ba zhes pa 'ongs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: At that time, is it not the case that feeling is just the manifest adherence of thought?

original: ci ste gang de nyid ni kho bo cag gis brjod pa de nyid da ltar grub cing 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gang de nyid ni kho bo cag gis brjod pa de nyid da ltar grub cing 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: If one says: ‚ÄúThat very thing that we have stated has now been established and has come about,‚Äù

original: ci zhig rtog pas mngon par zhen cing rtog pas byas pa'i mngon par zhen par byed /
analyzed: ci zhig rtog pas mngon par zhen cing rtog pas byas pa'i mngon par zhen par byed /
translated: What is imagined by conceptualization? What is imagined by conceptualization as existent?

original: nyid ces pa ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: nyid ces pa ni nges par gzung ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù has the meaning of restriction.

original: de nyid tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / de dag las gzhan pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / de dag las gzhan pa yin te /
translated: It is just pleasure, pain, and that which is neither of those two.

original: gzhan dngos po'i bde ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan dngos po'i bde ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: There is no other thing that is pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no cause of pleasure, etc.

original: 'di ltar yang gnyug ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba na yang gang zhig bde ba'i @250b rgyu nyid du yongs su brtags pa de mngon par zhen pa las bde ba myong ngo zhes skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gnyug ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba na yang gang zhig bde ba'i @250b rgyu nyid du yongs su brtags pa de mngon par zhen pa las bde ba myong ngo zhes skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, when one is separated from the innate nature, that which is imagined to be the cause of pleasure is experienced as pleasure due to adherence to it.

original: gzhan 'di las gzhan no //
analyzed: gzhan 'di las gzhan no //
translated: This is different from that.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar gang nyid gzhan sdug bsngal gyis sgrub par byed pa de nyid gzhan bde 'ga' zhig gis sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar gang nyid gzhan sdug bsngal gyis sgrub par byed pa de nyid gzhan bde 'ga' zhig gis sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could that which is established as pain for one be established as pleasure for another?

original: gcig po de'i gang zhig sgra thos pa las kyang sdug bsngal du 'gyur na yang dus gzhan du mthong ba las dga' ba'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig po de'i gang zhig sgra thos pa las kyang sdug bsngal du 'gyur na yang dus gzhan du mthong ba las dga' ba'i ngo bo skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is suffering to hear the sound of that one thing, then at another time, the essence of pleasure arises from seeing it.

original: de lta bas na bde ba la sogs pa dang / de'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba la sogs pa dang / de'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni brtags pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on and the means of achieving them are imagined,

original: dngos po pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: but they are not real things.

original: sbrul ni rma bya'i bde ba'i ched du skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: sbrul ni rma bya'i bde ba'i ched du skye 'gyur te //
translated: The snake is born for the sake of the peacock‚Äôs pleasure.

original: dug la goms dang ldan pas dug ni bcud len yin //
analyzed: dug la goms dang ldan pas dug ni bcud len yin //
translated: Through habituation to poison, poison becomes an elixir.

original: tshor bas rnga mo'i kha yi zug rdu ni //
analyzed: tshor bas rnga mo'i kha yi zug rdu ni //
translated: The pain of the camel‚Äôs mouth is

original: dga' ba'i khyad par gyi ni rgyu ru 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' ba'i khyad par gyi ni rgyu ru 'gyur //
translated: the cause of a special kind of pleasure.

original: zhes so // tshor bar mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par dpyad pa nyid kyis ldog nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // tshor bar mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par dpyad pa nyid kyis ldog nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that since the nature of the conception of feeling is to be reversed, it can be reversed through analysis,

original: de nyid phyir na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid phyir na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Candrakƒ´rti says, ‚ÄúFor this very reason,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang nyid kyi phyir tshor ba mngon par zhen pa de nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa 'di yin la /
analyzed: gang nyid kyi phyir tshor ba mngon par zhen pa de nyid kyi phyir rnam par dpyod pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa 'di yin la /
translated: Because of just that very clinging to feeling, this analysis is this conceptualization.

original: bde ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo 'di'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo 'di'i gnyen po ste /
translated: This essence of clinging to pleasure, etc., is the antidote to that.

original: 'gal 'gegs kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal 'gegs kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cessation of the opposite.

original: bsgom pa ni sems par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni sems par byed pa yin la /
translated: Cultivation is the mental activity.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa med na de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa med na de'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no establishment of that, then there is no clinging to that.

original: gzhan yang 'dis kyang tshor ba mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dis kyang tshor ba mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that this also is clinging to feeling,

original: rnam rtog ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam rtog ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: conceptualization, etc., is stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'dir yang 'brel to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni 'dir yang 'brel to //
translated: Because of just that, is also connected here.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid zhing yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid zhing yin te /
translated: Conceptualization itself is the field,

original: skye ba'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the place of birth.

original: der skyes pa ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
translated: That which is born there is that which has arisen.

original: bsam gtan ni 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan ni bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni 'dod pa dang bral ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral bas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan ni bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of the first meditation, which is free from the passions of the realm of desire, free from evil and wrong states, associated with initial and sustained thought, and filled with the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Concentration is the attainment of the first meditation.

original: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid zas yin la lus tshim par byed pa'i rgyu yin @251a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de nyid zas yin la lus tshim par byed pa'i rgyu yin @251a * //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.

original: pa'i phyir te /üîΩgang rnams kyi de dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩgang rnams kyis she na /üîΩrnal 'byor ba'i ste /üîΩ'di ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir te / gang rnams kyi de dag yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // gang rnams kyis she na / rnal 'byor ba'i ste / 'di ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: It is food because it is the cause of the satisfaction of the body.üîΩThe body is satisfied by the food of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.

original: rtog pas sprul pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i zas kyis gzung ba'i lus ni rnal 'byor ba'i yin no ;
analyzed: rtog pas sprul pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i zas kyis gzung ba'i lus ni rnal 'byor ba'i yin no ;
translated: The body is satisfied by the food of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.üîΩThe body is satisfied by the food of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.üîΩThe body is satisfied by the food of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.üîΩThe body is satisfied by the food of the joy and pleasure born of concentration.

original: / de lta bas na tshor ba ni rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes grub bo //
analyzed: / de lta bas na tshor ba ni rtog pa'i mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that feeling is the manifest clinging to conceptualization.

original: de ltar rgyu khas blangs nas tshor bar mngon par zhen pa bstan pa'i phyir ni rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir tshor ba dngos po la yod pa nyid du mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu khas blangs nas tshor bar mngon par zhen pa bstan pa'i phyir ni rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir tshor ba dngos po la yod pa nyid du mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having accepted the cause in this way, in order to demonstrate the clinging to feeling, he says, ‚ÄúThe cause itself is impossible,‚Äù in order to demonstrate that it is not reasonable for feeling to exist as a real entity.

original: gang gi dbang don zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi dbang don zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe sense faculty and object,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning here is as follows.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin la /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin la /
translated: Feeling is conditioned by contact.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum po dag 'dus pa ni reg pa yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum po dag 'dus pa ni reg pa yin te /
translated: The coming together of the three‚Äîthe object, the sense faculty, and consciousness‚Äîis contact.

original: reg pa drug 'dus pa las byung zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: reg pa drug 'dus pa las byung zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: This is because of the statement, ‚ÄúContact arises from the coming together of the six.‚Äù

original: gsum 'dus pa las byung ba'i reg pa nyid de yang rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las byung ba'i reg pa nyid de yang rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: The arising of contact from the coming together of the three is also unreasonable.

original: de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba gang las 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis tshor ba gang las 'gyur /
translated: How could there be feeling conditioned by that?

original: 'dir yang dbang don bar dang bcas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang don bar dang bcas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Here, too, the sense faculty and object would either be separated by space or not.

original: de bar med par 'gyur ba yin /üîΩde la dbang po dang yul te dbang po dang yul dag par dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de bar med par 'gyur ba yin / de la dbang po dang yul te dbang po dang yul dag par dang bcas pa ste /
translated: There is no interval between them.

original: bar dang bcas pa gal te yin na de'i tshe phrad pa ste /
analyzed: bar dang bcas pa gal te yin na de'i tshe phrad pa ste /
translated: In that case, if the sense faculty and object are with interval, that is, with a space between them, then how could there be contact,

original: 'dus shing tshogs pa gang las 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dus shing tshogs pa gang las 'gyur /
translated: that is, a coming together and aggregation?

original: dbang po dang don 'di dag phrad par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don 'di dag phrad par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that these sense faculties and objects make contact.

original: reg pa yang 'dus pa la brjod la bar chod pa yin na yang der ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa yang 'dus pa la brjod la bar chod pa yin na yang der ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that since contact is also said to be an aggregation, how could there be contact if there is an interval between them?
