original: 'on te gnyis ba'i rnam pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ba'i rnam pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if they are of the aspect of non-dual, that also is illogical. To demonstrate this, he says:

original: bar med na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bar med na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Even if there is no interval,

original: bar med na yang bar chad pa med pa yin pas gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: bar med na yang bar chad pa med pa yin pas gcig nyid yin te /
translated: since there is no interval, there is no separation, and they are one.

original: dbang po dang yul dag de'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dag de'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The sense faculty and object are of the nature of that.

original: cha chung zhig gis gyang gal te tshod pa ma yin na de lta na yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis bar med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha chung zhig gis gyang gal te tshod pa ma yin na de lta na yang bdag nyid thams cad kyis bar med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If even a small part is not obstructed, then in that case, they would be without interval with their entire nature.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis der 'dus pa yin na yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis der 'dus pa yin na yang de nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the case that they are assembled there with their entire selves, then that is so.

original: de ltar na yang gang zhig gang dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang zhig gang dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: But even so, what is it that makes contact with what?

original: gcig yin na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig yin na tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is one, then because there is no difference,

original: gang zhig gang dang phrad bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang phrad bar 'gyur /
translated: what is it that makes contact with what?

original: @251b bdag nyid bdag dang phrad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @251b bdag nyid bdag dang phrad pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for the self to make contact with itself.

original: de ltar na yang rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa nyid dngos po la phrad pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rdul phra rab rnams cha shas med pa nyid dngos po la phrad pa yin la /
translated: In that case, it is the case that partless subtle particles make contact with things.

original: de la cha shas dang ldan pa'i phrad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la cha shas dang ldan pa'i phrad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that those with parts make contact,

original: rags pa nyid la de srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa nyid la de srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is possible for the coarse.

original: de la yang phrad pa sun phyung ba nyid kyis cung zad cig sun phyung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang phrad pa sun phyung ba nyid kyis cung zad cig sun phyung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But even in that case, nothing is refuted by the refutation of contact.

original: 'di la rdul phran zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la rdul phran zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains that even subtle particles

original: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'di ltar phrad par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la yang 'di ltar phrad par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: are not reasonable as contact.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab gcig kyang rdul phra rab gzhan la 'jug pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab gcig kyang rdul phra rab gzhan la 'jug pa med de /
translated: Because one atom does not enter another atom.

original: nang du 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nang du 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist internally.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: Because of that.

original: skabs med cing rdul phra rab la mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: skabs med cing rdul phra rab la mtshams med pa'o //
translated: There is no space, and atoms have no boundaries.

original: mnyam pa de mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyam pa de mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Equality is sameness,

original: mtho ba dang dma' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ba dang dma' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no high or low.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar cha med pa la phrad pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar cha med pa la phrad pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, how can there be contact in the partless?

original: de ltar yin na yang rdul phra rab rdul phra rab la 'jug par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang rdul phra rab rdul phra rab la 'jug par ma gyur mod /
translated: Even though that is so, an atom does not enter an atom.

original: phrad pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: phrad pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Only mere contact exists.

original: de lta bas na bsgrub bya grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub bya grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the probandum is not established.

original: ma zhugs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma zhugs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To respond: ‚ÄúNot entering,‚Äù and so on.

original: rdul phra rab ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel pa ni phrad pa yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel pa ni phrad pa yin te /
translated: An atom is contact when it is connected with its entirety.

original: gzhan du na cha shas dang bcas bar thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na cha shas dang bcas bar thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it has parts.

original: de ltar na yang de'i rang bzhin bdag nyid thams cad kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i rang bzhin bdag nyid thams cad kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: In that case, its nature is pervaded by all of itself.

original: de ltar na de'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa la phrad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rang bzhin ma 'dres pa la phrad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, its unmixed nature would not be in contact.

original: de la 'dres pa nyid ni de la zhugs pa med par 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dres pa nyid ni de la zhugs pa med par 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, its very mixing would not be in contact.

original: 'dir ma zhugs shing zhugs pa med pa yin na 'dres pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ma zhugs shing zhugs pa med pa yin na 'dres pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, if it is not engaged and not in contact, it is not mixed.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: If it is not a different nature,

original: ma 'dres pa la ste 'dres pa med pa la phrad cing tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la ste 'dres pa med pa la phrad cing tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not in contact with the unmixed, that is, with that which is not mixed.

original: cha med pa yang rnam pa thams cad du phrad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cha med pa yang rnam pa thams cad du phrad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that that which is partless is not suitable in any way to be in contact,

original: cha med pa'ang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: cha med pa'ang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAlso, that which is partless,‚Äù and so on.

original: cha med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi dngos po yin la'ang zhes pa ni nyes pa'i gzhan sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: cha med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi dngos po yin la'ang zhes pa ni nyes pa'i gzhan sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Partless‚Äù is an entity of emptiness. ‚Äú Also‚Äù is a particle indicating another fault.

original: phrad pa ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: phrad pa ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: ‚Äú Contact‚Äù is called ‚Äúa collection.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar 'thad bar 'gyur te zhes smos pa ni srid pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'thad bar 'gyur te zhes smos pa ni srid pa'i tshig ste /
translated: How could that be tenable?

original: ji ltar phrad par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar phrad par rig par 'gyur /
translated: How could contact be known?

original: phra ba thams cad kyang @252a * //
analyzed: phra ba thams cad kyang @252a * //
translated: All that is subtle

original: nges par cha gcig gi sgo nas 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par cha gcig gi sgo nas 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: must certainly be in terms of a part.

original: yang gang la cha med pa nyid de'i lus kyi cha med pa las med pa nyid thob bo zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: yang gang la cha med pa nyid de'i lus kyi cha med pa las med pa nyid thob bo zhes dgongs so //
translated: Moreover, it is thought that if something is partless, then its partlessness is obtained from the partlessness of its body.

original: 'di la cha tsam yang tshad mas rtogs pa gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la cha tsam yang tshad mas rtogs pa gang na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that not even a part of this is realized by valid cognition anywhere,

original: rnam shes lus med pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam shes lus med pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚ÄúConsciousness is without body,‚Äù and so on.

original: ni zhes pa ni shin tu bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: ni zhes pa ni shin tu bsgrub pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Indeed‚Äù indicates a strong affirmation.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul rnam par rig pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul rnam par rig pa yin la /
translated: Consciousness is the awareness of objects.

original: yang phrad par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang phrad par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, contact is not tenable,

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus med pa'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir zhes te /
translated: Because it is without body.

original: 'di gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin la /
analyzed: 'di gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin la /
translated: This is a statement of the reason.

original: lus kyis stong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ste /
analyzed: lus kyis stong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ste /
translated: Consciousness is empty of body.

original: lus med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because they are not bodies.

original: phan tshun 'brel ba nyid ni phrad pa yin la /
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel ba nyid ni phrad pa yin la /
translated: Mutual connection is contact.

original: de yang lus dad ldan pa nyid la yod do //
analyzed: de yang lus dad ldan pa nyid la yod do //
translated: And that exists for those who have bodies.

original: gang la yang lus med pa de la ji ltar phrad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la yang lus med pa de la ji ltar phrad par 'gyur /
translated: How could there be contact for those who have no bodies at all?

original: de ltar na gsum ka la yang phrad pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gsum ka la yang phrad pa bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted contact in all three cases,

original: da ni tshogs pa nyid dngos po la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshogs pa nyid dngos po la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that the collection itself does not exist for things,

original: tshogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe collection too,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni nyes pa gzhan sdud pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni nyes pa gzhan sdud pa yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äútoo‚Äù includes other faults.

original: tshogs pa 'ang ste 'dus pa yang ngo //
analyzed: tshogs pa 'ang ste 'dus pa yang ngo //
translated: The collection too, that is, the assembly,

original: rta'i rva bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rta'i rva bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: does not exist, because it is like the horns of a rabbit, that is, it is nonexistent.üîΩBecause things are devoid of reality, it is not tenable that they have contact.üîΩThis is the commentary on the nature of things.

original: dngos po de kho na nyid dang bral ba'i phyir phrad pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes rang bzhin dang 'grel te tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de kho na nyid dang bral ba'i phyir phrad pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes rang bzhin dang 'grel te tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the collection itself does not exist.

original: ji ltar yang dngos po med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dngos po med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How could it be that things are nonexistent?

original: sngar ni ji ltar rnam dpyad bzhin //
analyzed: sngar ni ji ltar rnam dpyad bzhin //
translated: As was previously analyzed.

original: zhes te / ji ltar sngar gtan la phab pa bzhin yin te /
analyzed: zhes te / ji ltar sngar gtan la phab pa bzhin yin te /
translated: Thus, it is just as previously determined.

original: de bzhin sor mo'i tshogs nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo'i tshogs nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, the collection of fingers, etc.

original: rgyu med pa nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude that there is no cause,

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na bstan pa'i rim pas reg pa yod min te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan pa'i rim pas reg pa yod min te /
translated: Thus, by the order of the teaching, contact does not exist.

original: gsum 'dus pa med pa na tshor ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa med pa na tshor ba med pa yin la /
translated: When the three do not meet, there is no feeling.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Feeling is the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba yin la /
translated: Arising is birth.

original: de gang las rigs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de gang las rigs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: From what could that be reasonable?

original: rgyu med pa na 'bras bu srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa na 'bras bu srid pa ma yin no //
translated: When there is no cause, there is no possibility of an effect.

original: de'i phyir don dam par tshor ba med par phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa'i yul med pa'i @252b phyir ci'i don du ngal ba 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par tshor ba med par phan pa dang phan pa ma yin pa'i yul med pa'i @252b phyir ci'i don du ngal ba 'di yin /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, since there is no feeling, there is no object of benefit or harm. So why this trouble?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched don dag tu ngal ba byed pa yin na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal spang ba'i ched don dag tu ngal ba byed pa yin na /
translated: If one makes an effort for the sake of abandoning pleasure and pain,

original: de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir /
translated: why is that?

original: nam mkha' ldang ba'i don bzhin du rigs pa ma yin zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ldang ba'i don bzhin du rigs pa ma yin zhes dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not reasonable, like the sky-flower.

original: bde ba bsgrub pa'i ched du ngal bar ma gyur mod /
analyzed: bde ba bsgrub pa'i ched du ngal bar ma gyur mod /
translated: It is not that one does not strive for the sake of achieving happiness,

original: sdug bsngal shin tu bzod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu bzod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is utterly unable to bear suffering.

original: de spang ba'i don du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de spang ba'i don du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of abandoning that,

original: gang las gang la gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang las gang la gnod par 'gyur //
translated: from what and for whose sake?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The meaning is that

original: tshor ba rnam par dpyad pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod pa'i yin te rnam bar dpyad pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam par dpyad pas rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnod pa'i yin te rnam bar dpyad pas so //
translated: because feeling is analyzed and has no intrinsic nature, how can it be harmed?

original: bdag la sogs pa sngar bsal ba'i phyir tshor ba po med pa'i yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa sngar bsal ba'i phyir tshor ba po med pa'i yin no //
translated: Because the experiencer does not exist, since the self and so on have been refuted earlier.

original: dgod par bye dpa'i rgyu yang rnam par rtog bas brtags pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: dgod par bye dpa'i rgyu yang rnam par rtog bas brtags pa'i phyir don dam par yod pa'i ma yin no //
translated: And because the cause of the designation is imagined by conception, it does not exist ultimately.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na gang gis gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na gang gis gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by whom is it harmed?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral ba'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir gang las 'gyur te ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral ba'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir gang las 'gyur te ;
translated: Because of being free from the feeling of suffering, and because of being free from the cause of harm, from what does it arise?

original: don dam par gang gi yang gang las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par gang gi yang gang las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Ultimately, nothing arises from anything at all.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba po med pa'i phyir tshor ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba po med pa'i phyir tshor ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because there is no experiencer, feeling also is not tenable.

original: de ni tshor ba med pa'i phyir de'i rkyen las byung ba'i srid pa yang rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni tshor ba med pa'i phyir de'i rkyen las byung ba'i srid pa yang rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, since there is no feeling, the existence that arises from its conditions is also ultimately untenable because it lacks a cause,üîΩit is said: When,

original: gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: at that time,

original: gang gi tshor ba myong ba de ni tshor ba po yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshor ba myong ba de ni tshor ba po yin la /
translated: the experiencer of feeling exists, he is the feeler.

original: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When there is not even the slightest existence of a self, etc.,

original: de med pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag tu dpyad zin pa'i phyir tshor ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag tu dpyad zin pa'i phyir tshor ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: because of the absence of that and because of the immediate analysis, feeling does not exist.

original: de'i tshe gnas skabs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas skabs 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, in this situation,

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu la'o //
translated: in this way,

original: gang gi skye ba dang bral ba mthong nas ste /
analyzed: gang gi skye ba dang bral ba mthong nas ste /
translated: when one sees the absence of arising,

original: dmigs nas sred pa ci'i phyir ldog mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs nas sred pa ci'i phyir ldog mi 'gyur te /
translated: why would craving not cease?

original: de'i sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur na yang /üîΩltos pa med pa nyid du ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur na yang / ltos pa med pa nyid du ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur /
translated: If you are pained by the suffering of others,üîΩwhy do you not turn away from what is not yours?üîΩWhy do you not abandon what is not yours,

original: gang zhig da ltar yang de dang bdag bral zhing ldog pa nyid du ci ste dor bar mi byed /
analyzed: gang zhig da ltar yang de dang bdag bral zhing ldog pa nyid du ci ste dor bar mi byed /
translated: since it is now separated from you?

original: de lta gyur na yang gal te tshor bar byed pa po med par tshor ba yang med pa yin na /üîΩgang gis na 'di ltar bde bsgrub par byed pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par @253a * //
analyzed: de lta gyur na yang gal te tshor bar byed pa po med par tshor ba yang med pa yin na / gang gis na 'di ltar bde bsgrub par byed pa nyid kyis dngos po rnams la mthong ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par @253a * //
translated: If, in this way, there is no feeling without a feeler,üîΩthen by what means is the designation ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and so on applied to things,

original: 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur zhe na /
translated: since the attainment of pleasure is the very purpose of life?

original: 'di la mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, the root verse states, ‚ÄúSeeing, hearing, and so on . . .‚Äù

original: mthong ba yang gang mig gi dbang pos so //
analyzed: mthong ba yang gang mig gi dbang pos so //
translated: Seeing is seeing with the eye.

original: reg pa yang lus kyi dbang po las skyes pa'i sems kyis shes pas so //
analyzed: reg pa yang lus kyi dbang po las skyes pa'i sems kyis shes pas so //
translated: Touching is known through the mind that arises from the body faculty.

original: gal te de ltar na sems kyis tshor ba po dngos po la yod do zhe na /üîΩrmi lam sgyu 'dra'i bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sems kyis tshor ba po dngos po la yod do zhe na / rmi lam sgyu 'dra'i bdag nyid kyis //
translated: If you say that the feeler exists in things through the mind,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: the root verse states, ‚ÄúLike a dream, like an illusion . . .‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyis rmi lam lta bu yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rmi lam lta bu yin la /
translated: They are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.

original: rang bzhin gyis sgyu ma lta bu yin no //üîΩrten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa'i sems nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sgyu ma lta bu yin no // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa'i sems nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: They are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin no //üîΩlan 'ga' yang de las tha dad pa sems kyis mthong ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin no // lan 'ga' yang de las tha dad pa sems kyis mthong ba ni ma yin la /
translated: They are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a reflected image.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.

original: sems dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid du de mthong ba yin te /üîΩtshogs pa gcig la 'brel pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig skyes pa nyid du de mthong ba yin te / tshogs pa gcig la 'brel pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.

original: don dam par mthong ba ni yod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: don dam par mthong ba ni yod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: They are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.üîΩThey are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.

original: gang gis 'di ltar mthong ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar mthong ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba /
translated: They are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation.

original: tshor ba de yis mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba de yis mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: They are by nature like a dream.üîΩThey are by nature like an illusion.üîΩThey are by nature like a reflected image.üîΩThey are by nature like an echo.üîΩThey are by nature like a mirage.üîΩThey are by nature like a magical creation

original: gang gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad mthong ba yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na tshor ba mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bde ba sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad mthong ba yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i rgyu des na tshor ba mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: The reason is that the seeing of pleasure and so on is different from the seeing of feeling.

original: dngos po la mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, feeling is not seen.

original: 'on te de ltar na yang lhan cig skyes pa mthong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na yang lhan cig skyes pa mthong ba ma yin la /
translated: But even if that is so, coemergent feeling is not seen.

original: 'on kyang shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can gyis de skye bar 'gyur ba dus phyi ma la 'dzin par brjod do zhe na /üîΩ'di sun dbyung ba'i don du sngar dang shes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can gyis de skye bar 'gyur ba dus phyi ma la 'dzin par brjod do zhe na / 'di sun dbyung ba'i don du sngar dang shes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: But the consciousness that has the aspect of the object is said to apprehend it at a later time when it arises.

original: nges par lhan cig tu skyes pa'i tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: nges par lhan cig tu skyes pa'i tshor ba yin te /
translated: To refute this, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúThe feeling that definitely arises simultaneously with consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan du na sngar te sngar byung ba dang / phyi mar te phyis kyi dus kyi yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du na sngar te sngar byung ba dang / phyi mar te phyis kyi dus kyi yin la /
translated: If it were different, the feeling that arises earlier would be remembered by the consciousness that arises later.

original: skyes pa ste byung ba'i shes pa des dran par 'gyur gyi myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa ste byung ba'i shes pa des dran par 'gyur gyi myong ba ma yin te /
translated: But it is not experienced by that consciousness.

original: myong ba ma yin la dran pa'i ngo bos yul du byed pa yin la mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba ma yin la dran pa'i ngo bos yul du byed pa yin la mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not an experience, but it is the object of memory, and it is not reasonable that it is direct perception.

original: shes pa de'i dus na de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de'i dus na de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of that consciousness, it has already ceased.

original: 'das pa'i ni rang gi ngo bo myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i ni rang gi ngo bo myong bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the past is experienced in its own nature,

original: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: myong ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: myong ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: Experience is the experience of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni na pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni na pa tsam yin la /
translated: Therefore, this is mere talk.

original: de la rang gi ngo bo myong ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo myong ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that one‚Äôs own nature is experienced in that.

original: tshor ba ni @253b rang gi ngo bo rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba ni @253b rang gi ngo bo rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not reasonable for feeling to be the defining characteristic that establishes its own nature,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] states, ‚ÄúNot experienced by itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo yin la /üîΩmyong min la ste /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid de rang gi ngo bo yin la / myong min la ste /
translated: ‚Äú Itself‚Äù is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Not experienced‚Äù means not cognized.

original: rang rig pa sngar sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa sngar sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú By itself‚Äù means by reflexive awareness, because reflexive awareness has already been refuted.

original: de ltar na shes pa gzhan des tshor ba myong ba yin no zhes /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa gzhan des tshor ba myong ba yin no zhes /
translated: Thus, it is the other consciousness that experiences the feeling.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang myong ba ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang myong ba ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: But it is not experienced by another,

original: gzhan nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is not the same as that.

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i dus dus su byung ba'i zhes pas myong ba ma yin zhing rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i dus dus su byung ba'i zhes pas myong ba ma yin zhing rig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not experienced or cognized by a consciousness that arises at a different time,

original: shes pa bzhin shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin shes pa gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like consciousness, it is not experienced by another consciousness.

original: tshor ba po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And there is no experiencer of feeling,

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: because of what?

original: tshor ba cung zad kyang ma myong ba las te /
analyzed: tshor ba cung zad kyang ma myong ba las te /
translated: Because no feeling whatsoever is experienced,

original: sems sam gzhan gyis myong ba tshor ba po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems sam gzhan gyis myong ba tshor ba po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no experiencer of feeling, whether it is the mind or something else.

original: des na rgyu 'dir tshor ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rgyu 'dir tshor ba med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in reality, there is no feeling here,

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of the characteristic of feeling.

original: mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa tshor ba 'dir de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las ma gtogs pa tshor ba 'dir de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Apart from mere adherence, feeling does not exist in reality,

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and it does not exist ultimately.

original: de'i rang bzhin ngo bo rtogs par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ngo bo rtogs par byed pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is not the slightest realization of the nature of its own-being.

original: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus it is said in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa:

original: 'on kyang yang tshor ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o //üîΩtshor ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yang tshor ba ni mngon par zhen pa'o // tshor ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFeeling is attachment.üîΩFeeling is grasping.

original: tshor ba ni nye bar len pa'o //üîΩtshor ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nye bar len pa'o // tshor ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Feeling is appropriation.üîΩFeeling is objectification.

original: tshor ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Feeling is discursive thought.‚Äù

original: chos yang dag par bsdu ba'i mdo las kyang gsungs te /üîΩtshor ba myong ba rab bstan pa ;üîΩ/ tshor ba po las tshor ba gzhan //
analyzed: chos yang dag par bsdu ba'i mdo las kyang gsungs te / tshor ba myong ba rab bstan pa ; / tshor ba po las tshor ba gzhan //
translated: And in the Dharmasamgiti-sutra:üîΩ‚ÄúFeeling is taught to be experience.

original: gud na yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: gud na yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Feeling is not different from the feeler.üîΩIf it were,

original: gang gis de ni tshor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis de ni tshor bar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be felt?

original: byang chub ci 'dra de bzhin du //
analyzed: byang chub ci 'dra de bzhin du //
translated: Just as is enlightenment,

original: zhi zhing ngag la 'od gsal bar //üîΩtshor ba 'di la mkhas pa rnams //
analyzed: zhi zhing ngag la 'od gsal bar // tshor ba 'di la mkhas pa rnams //
translated: peaceful, bright,üîΩso the wise,

original: dran pa de 'dra nye bar gzhag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa de 'dra nye bar gzhag / ces gsungs so //
translated: with mindfulness thus established in feeling,

original: de lta bas na tshor ba po dang / tshor ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba po dang / tshor ba'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, the experiencer and the nature of feeling are emptiness.

original: ci de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la bya ba med pa yin zhing /
analyzed: ci de lta bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin la bya ba med pa yin zhing /
translated: Since that is so, is it dependent origination, but without action,

original: bdag po med pa sgyu ma spros pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i lus 'di snang ngo //üîΩde'i phyir bde ba'am @254a * //
analyzed: bdag po med pa sgyu ma spros pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i lus 'di snang ngo // de'i phyir bde ba'am @254a * //
translated: and without a master, like an illusory emanation, this body that appears as the object of perception becomes the domain of experience.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gir 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gir 'gyur ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, there is no happiness or suffering that is one‚Äôs own.

original: de ltar bdag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:üîΩSince there is no self, there is no master.üîΩSince there is no master, this collection is without a single thing that follows.

original: bdag med pa la gang gi yang bdag la sogs pa'i rigs pa po med pas bdag po med pa'i tshogs 'di la gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam 'di la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: bdag med pa la gang gi yang bdag la sogs pa'i rigs pa po med pas bdag po med pa'i tshogs 'di la gcig rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tsam 'di la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba /
translated: Since it is merely dependent origination, like an illusory nature,

original: dmigs pa'i spyod yul du nye bar gyur pa nyid mig 'phrul bzhin du mthong ba na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i spyod yul du nye bar gyur pa nyid mig 'phrul bzhin du mthong ba na /
translated: when this is seen to be the object of perception, like a magical illusion,

original: rmad du 'byung ba smra ba ni /
analyzed: rmad du 'byung ba smra ba ni /
translated: The one who speaks wondrously

original: 'di ci ste gnod par bya zhes te /
analyzed: 'di ci ste gnod par bya zhes te /
translated: says, ‚ÄúWhy should this be harmed?‚Äù

original: 'dis ji ltar brjod pa'i rim pas myong ba po 'ga' yang med pa dang / tshor ba yang 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar brjod pa'i rim pas myong ba po 'ga' yang med pa dang / tshor ba yang 'ga' yang med na /
translated: Since, by this [analysis], there is no experiencer at all, and there is no feeling at all,

original: don dam par tshor ba 'dis gang la gnod par bya ste /üîΩsdug bsngal bar bya la /
analyzed: don dam par tshor ba 'dis gang la gnod par bya ste / sdug bsngal bar bya la /
translated: then ultimately, by what feeling should this [self] be harmed?

original: rnam par dpyad na cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: [It should not be harmed by any feeling,] because, when analyzed, there is not the slightest [feeling].

original: de lta bas na 'di ni phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this [self] is imagined to be the producer of pleasure, etc., only by the conceptualization of error.

original: de ltar na 'di ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the teaching of the application of mindfulness to feeling.

original: da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the application of mindfulness to mind, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: yid ni dbang rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yid ni dbang rnams zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is the six collections of consciousness,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la drug po'i mtha' yid kyi rnam par shes pa la rtog par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la drug po'i mtha' yid kyi rnam par shes pa la rtog par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: There, the ‚Äúsix‚Äù is the end of the six collections of consciousness, and the ‚Äúmind‚Äù is the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar yang gang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di nye bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, where is this mental consciousness located?

original: de la re zhig dbang po rnams te /üîΩmig la sogs pa rnams la yid gnas shing /
analyzed: de la re zhig dbang po rnams te / mig la sogs pa rnams la yid gnas shing /
translated: First, it is not located in the sense faculties,üîΩsuch as the eyes.

original: nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The mind does not abide or reside in the eyes, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yid nye bar gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yid nye bar gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not located in the objects, such as form.

original: bar na'ang ma yin te dbang po dang yul gyi bar te /
analyzed: bar na'ang ma yin te dbang po dang yul gyi bar te /
translated: It is not located in between, that is, between the sense faculty and the object.

original: dbus na yang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbus na yang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not located in the middle, in the middle of the body.

original: gcig tu yang nges pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu yang nges pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have the nature of being determined as one or the other.

original: nang yang sems min phyi min zhing //
analyzed: nang yang sems min phyi min zhing //
translated: It is not inside, it is not outside,

original: zhes te / nang ste lus kyi dbus na sems ma yin zhing /
analyzed: zhes te / nang ste lus kyi dbus na sems ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not inside, that is, in the middle of the body.

original: phyi min te phyi rol gyi lus kyi yan lag rnams la yang sems rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi min te phyi rol gyi lus kyi yan lag rnams la yang sems rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not outside, that is, in the limbs of the body.

original: gzhan du yang ni rnyed ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ni rnyed ma yin //
translated: It is not found elsewhere.

original: zhes brjod ma thag pa'i gnas rnams las yul gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod ma thag pa'i gnas rnams las yul gzhan 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not found anywhere else apart from the places just mentioned.

original: gang du ma rnyed pa na /
analyzed: gang du ma rnyed pa na /
translated: Since it is not found anywhere,

original: rnam par brtags pa thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa thob pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not attained through analysis.

original: @254b de bzhin du nang du ji zhig ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: @254b de bzhin du nang du ji zhig ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, how could it be internally?

original: de ltar na ji ltar de dgag par byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar de dgag par byed ce na /
translated: In this way, how could it be refuted?

original: gang zhig lus min zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig lus min zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äú That which is not the body‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: sems gang zhig lus ma yin te /
analyzed: sems gang zhig lus ma yin te /
translated: That which is not the body is the mind.

original: phyi rol dang nang gi lus la ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi lus la ma yin no //
translated: It is not the internal or external body.

original: gzhan du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not elsewhere.

original: lus las gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lus las gzhan phyi rol gyi dngos po la yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not in external things that are other than the body.

original: 'dres min zhes pa ni bya ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'dres min zhes pa ni bya ba'i bye brag go //
translated: ‚Äú Not mixed‚Äù is a particular action.

original: nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid gnyis po dang 'dris pa la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i bdag nyid gnyis po dang 'dris pa la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not abide in the two, the internal and external natures, that are mixed.

original: sems gang zhig gsum po la sogs su ma yin no //
analyzed: sems gang zhig gsum po la sogs su ma yin no //
translated: That which is not the mind is the three and so on.

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not different.

original: rang dbang can yang 'ga' yang gnas pa med de /
analyzed: rang dbang can yang 'ga' yang gnas pa med de /
translated: It does not abide anywhere as independent.

original: sems gang zhig don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems gang zhig don dam par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is the mind does not exist in the least in the ultimate.

original: 'di dngos por yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dngos por yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist as a thing.

original: rtog pas brtags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas brtags pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is only imagined by conceptualization.

original: 'khor ba ji srid du sems sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rab tu snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid du sems sgyu ma dang 'dra bar rab tu snang ba yin te /
translated: The mind appears as an illusion for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is essenceless.

original: de'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes te /
translated: Therefore, because of that reason,

original: rgyu des na sems dang srog rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu des na sems dang srog rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: the mind and life are naturally in nirvana,

original: yongs su grol ba'i rang bzhin yin zhing /
analyzed: yongs su grol ba'i rang bzhin yin zhing /
translated: and they are essentially liberated,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang nyid ni bden pa ma yin yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis bden par sgro btags nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nyams par byas pa'i sems kyi rgyud rnams 'khor ba'i btson rar 'gal bar bkag pas rang dbang du 'jug
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro // rang nyid ni bden pa ma yin yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis bden par sgro btags nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyis nyams par byas pa'i sems kyi rgyud rnams 'khor ba'i btson rar 'gal bar bkag pas rang dbang du 'jug
translated: because the characteristic of essencelessness is always present in the mindstreams of all sentient beings, naturally in nirvana.

original: pa rnams yongs su ma grol bar brjod de /
analyzed: pa rnams yongs su ma grol bar brjod de /
translated: Although it is not real, it is imputed to be real by the power of unreal conceptualization. The mindstreams that are impaired by the latent potentialities of the afflictions are said to be not liberated because they are bound in the prison of cyclic existence by the power of the afflictions.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.

original: 'di ltar yid rnam par dpyad kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dpyad pa'i ched du /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid rnam par dpyad kyang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dpyad pa'i ched du /
translated: In this way, even though the mind is analyzed, in order to analyze the eye consciousnesses, etc.,

original: shes bya las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bya las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Lord] declares, ‚ÄúFrom the object of knowledge,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar yang shes pa ni gang du yang yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po gnas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang shes pa ni gang du yang yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po gnas pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, also, consciousness does not exist anywhere as an entity that is either existent or non-existent.

original: 'on kyang mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa shes bya'i 'dzin pa por brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa shes bya'i 'dzin pa por brjod do //
translated: However, it is said to be the apprehender of the object of knowledge, such as form, etc., which arises from the condition of the collection of the eye, etc.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi bsam pa dogs par byas nas rtogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi bsam pa dogs par byas nas rtogs par mdzad do //
translated: In this way, having anticipated the opponent‚Äôs opinion, he resolves it.

original: de yang shes par bya ba las sngar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de yang shes par bya ba las sngar 'gyur ram /
translated: Moreover, does it arise prior to the object of knowledge,

original: @255a * // shes bya dang dus mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: @255a * // shes bya dang dus mtshungs pa'am /
translated: or is it simultaneous with the object of knowledge,

original: shes bya las phyis 'gyur ba yin zhes so //
analyzed: shes bya las phyis 'gyur ba yin zhes so //
translated: or does it arise subsequent to the object of knowledge?

original: de la gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po yin na de la gsungs pa shes bya la ste gzung bar bya ba'i lus las /
analyzed: de la gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po yin na de la gsungs pa shes bya la ste gzung bar bya ba'i lus las /
translated: If the first alternative of the above is the case, then [the Lord] declares, ‚ÄúFrom the object of knowledge,‚Äù i.e., from the body of the object of knowledge, which is to be apprehended.

original: sngar te snga ma nyid du shes bya ma skyes pa nyid na gal te shes pa skyes par brjod nas /
analyzed: sngar te snga ma nyid du shes bya ma skyes pa nyid na gal te shes pa skyes par brjod nas /
translated: Previously, that is, when the object of cognition has not yet arisen, you assert that cognition arises.

original: de'i tshe de ni ci la dmigs te skyes /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ni ci la dmigs te skyes /
translated: In that case, what does it cognize when it arises?

original: sngar shes bya dmigs pa med par ci la dmigs pas te /
analyzed: sngar shes bya dmigs pa med par ci la dmigs pas te /
translated: When the object of cognition does not exist, what does it cognize?

original: ci la brten nas 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci la brten nas 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur /
translated: What does it depend on in order to arise?

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brten te gsungs pa /üîΩshes bya ste gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang lhan cig ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brten te gsungs pa / shes bya ste gzung bar bya ba'i yul dang lhan cig ste /
translated: The second position is addressed:üîΩIf the object of cognition, that is, the apprehended object,

original: dus mtshungs par gal te shes pa yin na /
analyzed: dus mtshungs par gal te shes pa yin na /
translated: and the cognition exist simultaneously,

original: de ni ci la dmigs te 'di skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni ci la dmigs te 'di skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: what does it cognize when it arises?

original: dus mtshungs pa'i shes par bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa'i shes par bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: An object of cognition that exists simultaneously is not a cause.

original: dmigs pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir yul ni rgyu ma yin zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir yul ni rgyu ma yin zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: This is because the object is not the cause of cognition, as stated in the line ‚ÄúThe object is not the cause.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gsum pa khas len na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa khas len na /
translated: If you accept the third position,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states:

original: 'on te shes bya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te shes bya zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: But if the object of cognitionüîΩarises from the cognition itself,üîΩwhat is it that arises?

original: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù indicates a question.

original: shes las zhes pa ni sngar gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes las zhes pa ni sngar gyi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the cognition‚Äù refers to the previous cognition.

original: phyis zhes pa ni de'i rjes la yin te /
analyzed: phyis zhes pa ni de'i rjes la yin te /
translated: Later means after that.

original: shes bya 'gags pa'i dus la shes pa skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: shes bya 'gags pa'i dus la shes pa skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the consciousness arises and occurs at the time when the object of consciousness has ceased,

original: de'i tshe shes pa gang las skyes te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa gang las skyes te /
translated: then from what does the consciousness arise?

original: shes pa'i dus na shes bya 'gags pa'i phyir gang la dmigs nas shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na shes bya 'gags pa'i phyir gang la dmigs nas shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the object of consciousness has ceased at the time of the consciousness, what would the consciousness be conscious of?

original: gang la brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang la brten nas skye bar 'gyur /
translated: What would it be conscious of?

original: de lta bas na yul la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang shes pa don dam par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na yul la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las kyang shes pa don dam par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, consciousness is not ultimately established from the collection of objects and so on.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di ni dkon mchog brtsegs pa las ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: This application of mindfulness to the mind is as it is taught in the Ratnaku·π≠a:

original: de 'di ltar sems yongs su tshol te /üîΩ'dod chags par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de 'di ltar sems yongs su tshol te / 'dod chags par gyur pa'am /
translated: He searches for the mind in this way:üîΩIs the mind that has become desirous,

original: zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or has become hateful,

original: gti mug par 'gyur ba'i sems de gang yin ci 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gti mug par 'gyur ba'i sems de gang yin ci 'das pa'am /
translated: or has become ignorant, is that mind past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: or future,

original: da ltar byung ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba zhig yin nam /
translated: or present?

original: de la sems 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa'o //
translated: The past mind has ceased.

original: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni ma phyin pa'o //
translated: What is future has not yet come.

original: da ltar byung ba ni gnas med do snyam mo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni gnas med do snyam mo //
translated: What is present has no abiding.

original: 'od srungs sems ni nang na yang med /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni nang na yang med /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, mind is not internal,

original: phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med /
translated: it is not external,üîΩand it is not to be apprehended as both.

original: gnyis ka na med pa la yang mi dmigs so /'od srungs @255b sems ni dpyad du med pa /
analyzed: gnyis ka na med pa la yang mi dmigs so /'od srungs @255b sems ni dpyad du med pa /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, mind is not to be analyzed,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: it is not to be demonstrated,

original: rten ma yin pa /üîΩsnang ba med pa /
analyzed: rten ma yin pa / snang ba med pa /
translated: it is not a support,üîΩit is not a manifestation,

original: rnam par rig pa med pa gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: and it is not a location.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, mind is not seen by any of the buddhas,

original: 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not seen, it will not be seen.

original: log par zhugs pa'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa'i 'du shes las chos rnams 'byung ba ma gtogs par sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang ma gzigs /
translated: Except for the arising of phenomena from the mistaken perception of the mind, it is not seen by any of the buddhas,üîΩit is not seen, it will not be seen.

original: mi gzigs / gzigs par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu ba ci 'dra bar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi gzigs / gzigs par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu ba ci 'dra bar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the movement of that which is not seen, is not seen, and will not be seen?

original: 'od srungs sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sgyu ma dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, mind is like an illusion.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags pas skye ba rnam pa mang po yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du brtags pas skye ba rnam pa mang po yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: It is the basis for the manifold false imaginations.

original: 'od srungs 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'bab chu'i rgyun dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a waterfall,

original: mi gnas pa skyes nas 'jig cing 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa skyes nas 'jig cing 'jug pa'o //
translated: not remaining in the same place, arising and passing away.

original: 'od srungs sems rlung dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems rlung dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like the wind,

original: ring du 'gro zhing gzung du med par rlung rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: ring du 'gro zhing gzung du med par rlung rgyu ba'o //
translated: going far away, ungraspable, moving.

original: 'od srungs sems ni mar me'i 'phro ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni mar me'i 'phro ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a lamp,

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from causes and conditions.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like space,üîΩdefiled by adventitious afflictions.

original: 'od srungs sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like lightning,üîΩseized for a moment, not remaining.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a dream,üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a ghost,üîΩalways seeking filth.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a monkey,üîΩalways seeking fruits.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a charnel ground,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur ba rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa glo bur ba rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the source of all the mental afflictions.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a sword,üîΩalways seeking conflict.

original: 'od srungs sems ni glog dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni glog dang mtshungs te /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a fish-hook,üîΩalways seeking the water.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a trap,üîΩalways seeking to bind.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a prison,

original: skad cig tu 'dzin cing mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig tu 'dzin cing mi gnas pa'o //
translated: always seeking to imprison.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a thief,üîΩalways seeking to steal.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a murderer,üîΩalways seeking to kill.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a demon,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: always seeking to harm.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a disease,üîΩalways seeking an illness.

original: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni kun du btsal na mi rnyed do //
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like an enemy,üîΩalways seeking to harm.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a cloud,üîΩalways seeking to rain down.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a flood,

original: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi rnyed pa de ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: always seeking to destroy.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a thief,üîΩalways seeking to steal.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a demon,üîΩalways seeking to harm.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a disease,üîΩalways seeking an illness.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like an enemy,üîΩalways seeking to harm.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, the mind is like a cloud,üîΩalways seeking to rain down.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa,

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is not observed is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: is not future,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: is not present. That is completely beyond the three times.

original: gang dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang dus gsum las yang dag par 'das pa de ni yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: That which is completely beyond the three times does not exist,

original: med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: does not not exist.

original: de ltar sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the application of mindfulness to the mind,

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the application of mindfulness to phenomena,

original: brjod pa'i rim pas sbyar bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pas sbyar bar gsungs pa /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares the sequence of statements:

original: de ltar na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'ang gi sgra ni kho na'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / 'ang gi sgra ni kho na'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, too, all phenomena,

original: 'di ltar kho nar ji ltar brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos kun te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho nar ji ltar brjod pa'i tshul gyis chos kun te /
translated: in this very way, as they have been described,

original: dngos po thams cad skye zhing 'byung bar rig par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skye zhing 'byung bar rig par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: are not to be known as arising or occurring,

original: rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: are not to be realized.

original: de rnams kyang rang gi rgyu las sngar ram /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang gi rgyu las sngar ram /
translated: Those, too, are not prior to their causes,

original: @256a * // dus mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: @256a * // dus mtshungs pa'am /
translated: or later?

original: phyi nas skye ba la skyon 'di nyid yin par ji ltar srid pa bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas skye ba la skyon 'di nyid yin par ji ltar srid pa bzlog par bya'o //
translated: This very error is to be averted as in the case of arising.

original: skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir 'gag pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir 'gag pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And cessation is not tenable because of the absence of arising,

original: ma skyes pa las skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa las skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that what has not arisen arises.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,üîΩit is said that all phenomena are the door of liberation, the realm of the Dharma,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / chos kyi dbyings su nges pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / chos kyi dbyings su nges pa /
translated: determined as the realm of phenomena,

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: reaching to the end of space,

original: ma brtags pa /
analyzed: ma brtags pa /
translated: unimagined,

original: tha snyad dang bral ba /
analyzed: tha snyad dang bral ba /
translated: free from conventions,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and not to be expressed.

original: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa brjod pa chos thams cad la zhen pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa brjod pa chos thams cad la zhen pa med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena is described as being free from attachment to all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yang /
analyzed: chos thams cad dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yang /
translated: The cultivation of the close placement of mindfulness of all phenomena

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang / gang la byang chub med pa dang / gang la lam med pa dang / gang la thar pa med pa dang / gang las 'byung ba med pa'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa dang / gang la byang chub med pa dang / gang la lam med pa dang / gang la thar pa med pa dang / gang las 'byung ba med pa'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: When bodhisattvas look at phenomena as phenomena, they do not see any phenomenon that is not a Buddha-Dharma, that is not enlightenment, that is not the path, that is not freedom, and that does not lead to freedom.

original: des chos thams cad 'byung ba shes nas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des chos thams cad 'byung ba shes nas sems can rnams la sgrib pa med par shes par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood the arising of all phenomena, they attain the door of the meditative absorption of great compassion in order to make beings understand the absence of obscurations.

original: des chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la yang sgyu mar 'du shes pa thob ste /
analyzed: des chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad la yang sgyu mar 'du shes pa thob ste /
translated: They attain the perception of all phenomena and all reactive emotions as illusions.

original: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa med pa 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: These phenomena are without reactive emotions; they are not associated with reactive emotions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi don la brten te nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni nges pa'i don gyi don la brten te nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyang med /
translated: Thus, they are based on the meaning of the definitive meaning, in which there is no collection of afflictions,

original: phung por gyur ba yang med /üîΩ'dod chags kyi dngos po yang med /
analyzed: phung por gyur ba yang med / 'dod chags kyi dngos po yang med /
translated: no aggregates,üîΩno thing of desire,üîΩno thing of hatred,

original: zhe sdang gi dngos po yang med /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi dngos po yang med /
translated: no thing of delusion.

original: gti mug gi dngos po med kyi nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi dngos po med kyi nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ste /
translated: Because these afflictions are realized, it is enlightenment.üîΩThe essence of the afflictions is also the essence of enlightenment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes de ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de bzhin no zhes de ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, they establish mindfulness in that way.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Also, it is said:

original: gang las skye ba yod min nyid //
analyzed: gang las skye ba yod min nyid //
translated: Where there is no arising at all,

original: de la myang 'das ga la yod //
analyzed: de la myang 'das ga la yod //
translated: how can there be nirvana?

original: 'gro ba sgyu @256b mar gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgyu @256b mar gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the world is clear as an illusion,

original: dang po nas gzhi 'bad med par //
analyzed: dang po nas gzhi 'bad med par //
translated: from the beginning, without effort,

original: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: whatever is dependently arisen

original: de la khyod ni stong nyid bzhed //
analyzed: de la khyod ni stong nyid bzhed //
translated: you assert to be emptiness.

original: de bzhin du ni dam chos te //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dam chos te //
translated: Likewise, the sublime Dharma

original: de dang mtshungs pa de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa de bzhin gshegs //
translated: and the TathƒÅgata are similar.

original: de ni de nyid don med pa'ang //
analyzed: de ni de nyid don med pa'ang //
translated: That is also meaningless in reality.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rdzas su bzhed //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rdzas su bzhed //
translated: It is accepted as the substance of suchness.

original: yang dag de ni mi slu la //
analyzed: yang dag de ni mi slu la //
translated: That reality is nondeceptive.

original: de rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas brjod //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas brjod //
translated: The realization of that is called buddha.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pas //
analyzed: de ltar chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pas //
translated: In this way, the application of mindfulness to the teaching is taught.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes shing ma 'gags par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes shing ma 'gags par bstan pa yin la /
translated: All phenomena are taught to be non-arisen and unceasing.

original: de ltar na yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa mi 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: However, in that case, conventional truth would be untenable,üîΩand therefore the presentation of the two truths would be untenable.

original: de'i phyir bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do zhes yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do zhes yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to completely abandon that,

original: rgol ba nye bar dgod pa na /
analyzed: rgol ba nye bar dgod pa na /
translated: the opponent's position is stated:

original: gal te de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is like that, etc.

original: gal te don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin na de lta na yang kun rdzob med de /
analyzed: gal te don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin yin na de lta na yang kun rdzob med de /
translated: If ultimately all phenomena have the nature of being non-arisen and unceasing, then even conventional [phenomena] would not exist,

original: yod pa ma yin la tha snyad med par 'gyur zhing don dam pa'i bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin la tha snyad med par 'gyur zhing don dam pa'i bden pa gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and there would be no conventions, and ultimate truth would be the only truth.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob med pas na bden pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob med pas na bden pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, since the conventional does not exist, there are two truths.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa yang ngo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa yang ngo //
translated: The conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: gang brjod pa /
analyzed: gang brjod pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam yang ;
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam yang ;
translated: The conventional and the ultimate

original: /'di ni bden pa gnyis su bzhed //
analyzed: /'di ni bden pa gnyis su bzhed //
translated: are accepted as the two truths.

original: ces so // de la bden pa gnyis po 'di ga la yod de /
analyzed: ces so // de la bden pa gnyis po 'di ga la yod de /
translated: Where are these two truths?

original: 'di ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not exist in this way.

original: de med pas kyang 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i las dang bya ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nye bar sogs pa la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med pas kyang 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba'i las dang bya ba'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin nye bar sogs pa la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since they do not exist, the connection between the karma of going to a world beyond and the result of action would not be tenable.

original: tha snyad thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all conventions would not exist.

original: 'on te de ltar na gal te med na yang de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na gal te med na yang de bzhin du /
translated: But if that is so, if they do not exist, then in the same way,

original: smig rgyu la chur gtogs pa nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa'i blos rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur gtogs pa nyid kyis kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa'i blos rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: the nature of the conventional is posited by the conceptual mind that apprehends a mirage as water.

original: de'i phyir bden pa gnyis 'thad pa yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa gnyis 'thad pa yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore the two truths are tenable.

original: brjod pa 'on te de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa 'on te de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reply is But that also, etc.

original: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te zhes pa ni 'dri ba yin la /
translated: But is a question.

original: de yang zhes pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: de yang zhes pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
translated: That also is the relative.

original: gcig tu don dam pa'i bden pa ni ma yin no zhes pa ni yang gi don to /
analyzed: gcig tu don dam pa'i bden pa ni ma yin no zhes pa ni yang gi don to /
translated: The meaning of also is that it is not exclusively ultimate reality.

original: i/ gzhan kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bos rnam par 'jog na'o //
analyzed: i/ gzhan kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bos rnam par 'jog na'o //
translated: If it is posited by the nature of the conceptualization of the other, the relative, then how can sentient beings attain nirvana?

original: yang na yang gi sgra @257a * //
analyzed: yang na yang gi sgra @257a * //
translated: The word also

original: ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa tha dad pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ni nges par gzung ba dang / rim pa tha dad pa nyid yin la /
translated: is used to indicate a definite exclusion and a different order.

original: gzhan nyid kyis kun rdzob ces sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis kun rdzob ces sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be connected with the other, the relative.

original: de ltar na gcig bsgrubs na gzhan nyams par 'gyur ba yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsems can mya ngan ga la 'da' //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig bsgrubs na gzhan nyams par 'gyur ba yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir / sems can mya ngan ga la 'da' //
translated: In order to show that if one is established the other is damaged,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said: How can sentient beings attain nirvana?

original: gal te don dam par de'i rang bzhin gyis stong yang blo'i yul du byas pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu brjod na gang zhig 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bden pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas rtogs na spros pa thams cad
analyzed: gal te don dam par de'i rang bzhin gyis stong yang blo'i yul du byas pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu brjod na gang zhig 'di ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i bden pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas rtogs na spros pa thams cad
translated: If you say that although ultimately it is empty of intrinsic reality, it is conventionally said to be an object of the mind, then when one realizes the ultimate truth, the nature of all phenomena, which is the absence of intrinsic reality, through the yoga of nonobservation,

original: dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur na ;üîΩde yang sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing yongs su grol ba gang las 'gyur te ma yin pa nyid de //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur na ; de yang sems can yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing yongs su grol ba gang las 'gyur te ma yin pa nyid de //
translated: one would attain nirvana, which is free from all elaborations.üîΩBut how could that be the case? It could not be.

original: de yang blo'i yul du byas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de yang blo'i yul du byas pa'i phyir la /
translated: That is also an object of the mind,
