translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang phan tshun du gcig la gcig gis grub na de'i phyir brjod pa'i nyes par thal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi bsam pa sngon du song bas /
analyzed: 'on kyang phan tshun du gcig la gcig gis grub na de'i phyir brjod pa'i nyes par thal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi bsam pa sngon du song bas /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence of consciousness is not yet established, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn dependence on that, objects of knowledge are established.‚Äù

original: ci ste phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ste phan tshun zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIn dependence on consciousness,‚Äù then since the existence

original: ci ste yang 'di ltar rjod par byed na phan tshun du ste /üîΩshes pa dang shes bya yang phan tshun gyi dbang gis te /üîΩstobs kyis shes pa dang shes par bya ba dag kyang yod pa nyid du nges par byed na ni /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di ltar rjod par byed na phan tshun du ste / shes pa dang shes bya yang phan tshun gyi dbang gis te / stobs kyis shes pa dang shes par bya ba dag kyang yod pa nyid du nges par byed na ni /
translated: that is, by the power of each other,üîΩconsciousness and the object of consciousness are ascertained as existing,

original: shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya dang / shes bya'i dbang gis shes pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang gis shes bya dang / shes bya'i dbang gis shes pa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go zhe na /
translated: then it would mean that the object of consciousness exists by the power of consciousness and consciousness exists by the power of the object of consciousness.

original: de de ltar yin na gnyi ga yang ni med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar yin na gnyi ga yang ni med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then both would not exist.

original: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: Both consciousness and the object of consciousness would not exist.

original: gcig kyang med cing grub pa med na gcig la gcig brten pa'i phyir gcig ma grub na gnyis pa yang grub par mi 'gyur @259b ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang med cing grub pa med na gcig la gcig brten pa'i phyir gcig ma grub na gnyis pa yang grub par mi 'gyur @259b ro //
translated: If one does not exist and is not established, then since they are mutually dependent, the second would not be established either.

original: 'dir rang bzhin dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin dang mthun pa'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach a natural example that accords with this,

original: gal te pha ming zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te pha ming zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the father‚Äôs name‚Äù and so on is said.

original: pha ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: pha ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The father is the one who gives birth.

original: gal te bud med de /
analyzed: gal te bud med de /
translated: If the woman

original: bu med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: bu med par gyur na'o //
translated: does not have a son.

original: bu skyed ba la stos nas 'di tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: bu skyed ba la stos nas 'di tha snyad yin la /
translated: In dependence on the son, the father is designated.

original: de ltar na gang las bu 'byung ba yin gang ste gang gi phyir pha med pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba'i bu 'byung zhing skye ba yod /
analyzed: de ltar na gang las bu 'byung ba yin gang ste gang gi phyir pha med pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba'i bu 'byung zhing skye ba yod /
translated: In that case, from what does the son arise? What is the son who is to be generated? Since there is no father, how could the son who is to be generated exist and arise?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bu med par ni pha med pas //
analyzed: bu med par ni pha med pas //
translated: Because without the son, there is no father.

original: zhes pa 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir bu med de yod pa ma yin na pha yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bu med de yod pa ma yin na pha yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because without the son, who does not exist, there is no father.

original: phar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: phar mi 'gyur la /
translated: He would not be a father.

original: phas kyang bu bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: phas kyang bu bskyed par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: And the father would not generate the son.

original: de yang bu ji srid du skyed par byed pa ma yin na de srid du pha nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang bu ji srid du skyed par byed pa ma yin na de srid du pha nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: And as long as he is not generating the son, he would not be a father.

original: de srid du bu las bur 'gyur bar srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pas na gcig med pas gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: de srid du bu las bur 'gyur bar srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pas na gcig med pas gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: Since the son would not be a son in dependence on the father, and the father would not be a father in dependence on the son, because they would exist without depending on each other, if one did not exist, the other would not exist.

original: gnyi ga yang ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ni med par 'gyur //
translated: Thus both would not exist.

original: zhes te / bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes te / bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the condensed meaning.

original: don 'di dpe las byung ba la sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di dpe las byung ba la sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply this meaning to the example,

original: de bzhin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'dir pha dang bu dper brjod pa de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i gnyis po de dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir pha dang bu dper brjod pa de bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i gnyis po de dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as father and son are mentioned here as examples, so too the two, the object of cognition and the cognition, do not exist.

original: de bzhin du dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, they are not things.

original: 'di ltar yang shes par bya ba'i shes pa la shes byar yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang shes par bya ba'i shes pa la shes byar yang brjod do //
translated: Thus, the cognition of the object of cognition is also called the object of cognition.

original: shes pa yongs su gcad par bya bas kyang shes bya yin no zhes so //
analyzed: shes pa yongs su gcad par bya bas kyang shes bya yin no zhes so //
translated: And the object of cognition is also called the object of cognition because it is the object of the cognition.

original: ji srid du shes pa ma grub pa de srid du yongs su shes pa mi grub la /
analyzed: ji srid du shes pa ma grub pa de srid du yongs su shes pa mi grub la /
translated: For as long as the cognition is not established, for that long the object of cognition is not established.

original: de srid du de'i yongs su gcad par bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba mi 'grub pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de srid du de'i yongs su gcad par bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya ba mi 'grub pas gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: And for that long, because of being the object of cognition, the object of cognition is not established. Thus, because of mutual dependence, both are nonexistent. This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar gyur na yang phan tshun gyi dbang gis grub po zhes mi ste 'on kyang shes bya'i 'bras bu shis pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang phan tshun gyi dbang gis grub po zhes mi ste 'on kyang shes bya'i 'bras bu shis pa yin la /
translated: Even though this is the case, it is not that they are established by virtue of each other. Rather, the object of cognition is the effect of the cognition.

original: shes pa de las myu gu dang sa bon bzhin du shes pa grub ces gzhan gyi bsam pa dgod pa'i ched du /
analyzed: shes pa de las myu gu dang sa bon bzhin du shes pa grub ces gzhan gyi bsam pa dgod pa'i ched du /
translated: In order to set forth the thoughts of others, he says:

original: myu gu sa bon las skye zhing //üîΩzhes pa la sog pa gsungs te /
analyzed: myu gu sa bon las skye zhing // zhes pa la sog pa gsungs te /
translated: The sprout arises from the seed.

original: sa bon gshong dang bu ga'i nang du chud pa'i las te /
analyzed: sa bon gshong dang bu ga'i nang du chud pa'i las te /
translated: The seed is the cause that is contained in the sprout and the hole.

original: sa bon de nyid las myu gu skyes par brjod cing go bar byed pa ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du 'dir shes bya ste /üîΩgzhal bya bas so //
analyzed: sa bon de nyid las myu gu skyes par brjod cing go bar byed pa ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du 'dir shes bya ste / gzhal bya bas so //
translated: Just as it is said and understood that the sprout arises from that seed, so it is here.üîΩThe object of comprehension is the object of knowledge.

original: @260a * // shes pa skyes te grub pa yis so //
analyzed: @260a * // shes pa skyes te grub pa yis so //
translated: The arising of consciousness is the establishment of consciousness.

original: de yod pa ste shes par bya ba de yod cing yang dag par yod pa'o //
analyzed: de yod pa ste shes par bya ba de yod cing yang dag par yod pa'o //
translated: That exists, that is, the object of knowledge exists and is real.

original: cis mi rtogs te /
analyzed: cis mi rtogs te /
translated: Why is it not understood?

original: 'dir yang sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here also, cause and effect are real things, like the seed and the sprout.

original: 'di ni dpe dang 'dra ba ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmyu gu zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni dpe dang 'dra ba ma yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir / myu gu zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that this is not like the example, he says:üîΩThe sprout does not exist in the seed.

original: myu gu ste 'bras bu las sa bon yod ces rtogs na /
analyzed: myu gu ste 'bras bu las sa bon yod ces rtogs na /
translated: If the seed exists in the effect, the sprout, it would be apprehended.

original: de 'di nyid 'ba' zhig gi mthu ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'di nyid 'ba' zhig gi mthu ma yin te /
translated: This is not due to the power of this alone.

original: 'on kyang gzhan te myu gu las tha dad pa'i shes pa las de yod do zhes rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan te myu gu las tha dad pa'i shes pa las de yod do zhes rtogs pa ste /
translated: But rather, it is due to the cognition of something else, i.e., the existence of the seed is understood from the cognition that is different from the sprout.

original: 'di ltar rung ba tsam gyis rgyu 'bras bus rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rung ba tsam gyis rgyu 'bras bus rtogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: For, mere possibility does not cause the effect to be understood from the cause.

original: gzhan du na sa bon nyid myu gu skyed ba ma gtogs pas kyang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis ma gtogs pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa bon nyid myu gu skyed ba ma gtogs pas kyang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa tsam gyis ma gtogs pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, the seed itself would be understood as the producer of the sprout, apart from its production of the sprout. And it follows that the nature of cause and effect would be understood merely through the understanding of their own nature.

original: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi nges pa yin no //
translated: But it is the certainty of the invariable concomitance that is the cause.

original: de'i phyir sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po rtogs pa la yang phyi nas 'ga' zhig tu sa bon las byung ba'i myu gu dmigs pa dang ldan pas sa bon du zhen pa'i bdag nyid rjes su dpag pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po rtogs pa la yang phyi nas 'ga' zhig tu sa bon las byung ba'i myu gu dmigs pa dang ldan pas sa bon du zhen pa'i bdag nyid rjes su dpag pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even when the nature of cause and effect is previously understood, later on, when the sprout arising from the seed is observed, the inference of the nature of the seed arises.

original: des sa bon yod de zhes zhen par byed do ;
analyzed: des sa bon yod de zhes zhen par byed do ;
translated: It causes the ascertainment that the seed exists.

original: / de lta bas na shes pas yul du byas pa'i 'di ltar myu gu sa bon rtogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: / de lta bas na shes pas yul du byas pa'i 'di ltar myu gu sa bon rtogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, since the object is made an object of consciousness, the sprout is the cause of the understanding of the seed.

original: shes pa yod pa nyid de /üîΩshes pa dngos po la yod pa gang las te /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid de / shes pa dngos po la yod pa gang las te /
translated: Consciousness exists.üîΩFrom what does the existence of consciousness follow?

original: gang gis shes pa yod par rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis shes pa yod par rtogs par byed de /
translated: By what is the existence of consciousness understood?

original: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir dang thug pa med pa'i 'jigs pas shes pa gzhan mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir dang thug pa med pa'i 'jigs pas shes pa gzhan mi tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reflexive awareness and because of the fear of infinite regress, another consciousness is not sought.

original: shes bya gang zhig de yis go bar 'gyur ba gang las te /
analyzed: shes bya gang zhig de yis go bar 'gyur ba gang las te /
translated: From what is the object of consciousness understood?

original: shes par bya ba shes pas shes bya'i 'bras bu des go zhing zhen par 'gyur /
analyzed: shes par bya ba shes pas shes bya'i 'bras bu des go zhing zhen par 'gyur /
translated: The object of consciousness is understood and ascertained by the consciousness that understands it.

original: rang nyid ma nges ba'i rtags pa sgrub bya go bar byed ba'i rigs pa ma yin no//
analyzed: rang nyid ma nges ba'i rtags pa sgrub bya go bar byed ba'i rigs pa ma yin no//
translated: It is not reasonable that a sign that is not itself ascertained should cause the understanding of the probandum.

original: gas par byed pa'i rgyu 'di shes bya'i go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gas par byed pa'i rgyu 'di shes bya'i go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This cause of understanding is the understanding of the object of consciousness.

original: de lta bas na dngos po'i phyogs la shes pa dang shes bya grub pas dpyad par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po'i phyogs la shes pa dang shes bya grub pas dpyad par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: As such, since consciousness and the object of consciousness are established in the context of entities, it is not possible to analyze them.

original: brtags pa'i phyogs la ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du tha snyad la brten nas nus pa yin no zhes nges so //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phyogs la ni ji ltar grags pa bzhin du tha snyad la brten nas nus pa yin no zhes nges so //
translated: However, in the context of the imputed, it is possible to do so in dependence on conventions in accordance with what is renowned.

original: da ni ; rang @260b las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: da ni ; rang @260b las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Now, in order to establish the meaning of ‚ÄúNot from itself, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
translated: Not from both, not without cause,

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Any entity whatsoever,

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: Anywhere, is ever produced,‚Äù

original: zhes pa'i don bsgrub pa'i don du rgyu med pa yang ma yin no zhes pa mtha' bzhi pa bsgrub pa'i don du re zhig dngos por smra ba'i 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don bsgrub pa'i don du rgyu med pa yang ma yin no zhes pa mtha' bzhi pa bsgrub pa'i don du re zhig dngos por smra ba'i 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúnot without cause‚Äù is established. In order to establish the four extremes, first, in order to refute the assertions of the proponents of entities, [the treatise states:]

original: re zhig 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúFirst, in the world, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar yang de rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu la ma ltos pa nyid dngos po'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes skye bar byed do zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang de rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi rgyu la ma ltos pa nyid dngos po'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes skye bar byed do zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Thus, they say that things arise from themselves and others, since various collections of things arise without depending on causes that are their own or other natures.

original: gang gi phyir padma la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba dang 'dab ma dang yal ga dang / ze'u 'brul sogs pa rnam pa du ma'i khyad par tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems dang bral ba'i chu dang 'dam la sogs pa las bskyed par mi nus so zhes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir padma la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa ba dang 'dab ma dang yal ga dang / ze'u 'brul sogs pa rnam pa du ma'i khyad par tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems dang bral ba'i chu dang 'dam la sogs pa las bskyed par mi nus so zhes so //
translated: Because the various different features of lotuses and so on, such as their roots, petals, branches, anthers, and so on, cannot be generated from mindless things such as water, mud, and so on.

original: sems pa dang ldan pa gzhan 'ga' zhig las de lta bus sprul pa las gzhol ba dmigs pa yang ma yin la /üîΩgus par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa dang ldan pa gzhan 'ga' zhig las de lta bus sprul pa las gzhol ba dmigs pa yang ma yin la / gus par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, they are not observed to be generated from some other conscious being, such as BrahmƒÅ.üîΩThey are not generated from a conscious being, because it is not reasonable that a conscious being would generate such things.

original: las la mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu mthar thug pa med pa'i khyad par rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu mthar thug pa med pa'i khyad par rnams la bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no end to karma, and because there would be the fault that all the various things would be generated simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na rgyu chung zad kyang med par 'gro ba 'di thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs par skye'o zhes pa ni de rnams kyi lugs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu chung zad kyang med par 'gro ba 'di thams cad rnam pa sna tshogs par skye'o zhes pa ni de rnams kyi lugs so //
translated: Thus, this entire world arises in various ways without even the slightest cause. This is their system.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: rang bzhin smra ba de rnams kyis //
analyzed: rang bzhin smra ba de rnams kyis //
translated: Those who propound intrinsic nature

original: rang nyid kyang ni rgyu ru brjod //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang ni rgyu ru brjod //
translated: say that intrinsic nature itself is the cause.

original: thams cad rgyu la re med par //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu la re med par //
translated: Without relying on any cause at all,

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang /üîΩpadma nyi ma ge sar sogs //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang / padma nyi ma ge sar sogs //
translated: the arising of thingsüîΩis like the variety of lotuses,

original: sna tshogs gang gis byed pa yin //
analyzed: sna tshogs gang gis byed pa yin //
translated: sunlight, and pistils.

original: rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: rma bya'i mdongs la sogs pa yang //
translated: And the eyes of peacocks and so on

original: sna tshogs gang gis sprul pa yin //
analyzed: sna tshogs gang gis sprul pa yin //
translated: are produced by a variety of causes.

original: ji ltar tsher ma la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar tsher ma la sogs pa'i //
translated: Like the sharpness and so on of thorns and so forth,

original: rno ba la sogs rgyu byed dam //üîΩglo bur yin phyir de bzhin du //üîΩsdug bsal la sogs rgyu med nyid //
analyzed: rno ba la sogs rgyu byed dam // glo bur yin phyir de bzhin du // sdug bsal la sogs rgyu med nyid //
translated: are causes.üîΩIn the same way, suffering and so on

original: ces brjod do //
analyzed: ces brjod do //
translated: have no cause at all, because they are adventitious.

original: de la 'di ltar smra ba la ni 'jig rten gyi rtog pa nyid kyis rgyu la nus pa med pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar smra ba la ni 'jig rten gyi rtog pa nyid kyis rgyu la nus pa med pa nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
translated: Here, the worldly perspective itself undermines the assertion that causes lack the ability to produce effects.

original: 'jig rten pa ni skye bo thams cad yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni skye bo thams cad yin la /
translated: The world is all people.

original: mngon sum gyi dbang po la brten pa ni shes pa'i yin la /üîΩmngon sum zhes pa 'di nye bar mtshon pa @261a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dbang po la brten pa ni shes pa'i yin la / mngon sum zhes pa 'di nye bar mtshon pa @261a * //
translated: The direct perception of the senses is the perception of the mind.

original: yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang yin te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas kyang yin te /
translated: Since the term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is a synecdoche, it also includes inference.

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yin zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is the means of knowing that, it is called ‚Äúdirect perception and inference.‚Äù

original: thams cad ni rnam pa du ma yin la /
analyzed: thams cad ni rnam pa du ma yin la /
translated: All of them are of many types.

original: rgyu ni 'jig rten sna tshogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'jig rten sna tshogs pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The cause is the cause of the variety of the world.

original: mthong ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i byed pa yang 'bras bu skyed par mthong la /üîΩ'bras bu ni gang zhig yod na yod la /
analyzed: mthong ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i byed pa yang 'bras bu skyed par mthong la / 'bras bu ni gang zhig yod na yod la /
translated: Seeing is seeing the activity of the forward and reverse entailment of that.üîΩThe effect is that which exists when it exists and does not exist when it does not exist.

original: de med na med par rtogs pa de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na med par rtogs pa de ni de'i rgyu yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: It is ascertained that that is its cause.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa nyid kyi rgyu'i byed pa las rgyu med pa'i dam bca' ba nyid las gnod par byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa nyid kyi rgyu'i byed pa las rgyu med pa'i dam bca' ba nyid las gnod par byed la /
translated: Therefore, the world‚Äôs mere understanding of the activity of the cause is undermined by the thesis of causelessness.

original: de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: padma'i sdong po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: padma'i sdong po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The lotus stalk, etc.

original: padma'i sdong po la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams te /
analyzed: padma'i sdong po la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams te /
translated: Those are the lotus stalk, etc.

original: lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / yal ga dang / ze'u 'bru la sogs pa de rnams la de skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / yal ga dang / ze'u 'bru la sogs pa de rnams la de skad ces brjod de /
translated: The leaves, petals, branches, anthers, etc. are called that.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi khyad par sna tshogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi khyad par sna tshogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the diversity of their particularities.

original: rgyu'i dbye bas zhes pa'i rgyu ste rgyu'i dbye ba las khyad par skye bar gyur te 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye bas zhes pa'i rgyu ste rgyu'i dbye ba las khyad par skye bar gyur te 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: From the diversity of causes, i.e., from the diversity of causes, particularities arise, i.e., come into being.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: Not from another,

original: nges pa med par thams cad du 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med par thams cad du 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would arise from everything else.

original: de'i phyir gang gang gis rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i rjes su byed par rtogs pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gang gis rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa'i rjes su byed par rtogs pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever is understood to be the effect of that which is concomitant with the cessation of that,

original: de gzhan las ma byung zhes khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de gzhan las ma byung zhes khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: that must be accepted as not arising from another.

original: de lta bas na rgyu so sor nges pa nyid las khyad par so sor nges par skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu so sor nges pa nyid las khyad par so sor nges par skye ba yin te /
translated: Thus, a specific effect arises from a specific cause.

original: de'i khyad par gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it is a specific feature of that, it is not causeless.

original: ci ste gal te rgyu nyid la rang nyid kyi khyad par 'di grub pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste gal te rgyu nyid la rang nyid kyi khyad par 'di grub pa yin la /
translated: But if this specific feature of the cause is established,

original: 'on kyang de nyid gang las srid par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid gang las srid par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: then it must be said from what it arises.

original: khyad par med pa las khyad par skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa las khyad par skye ba ma yin te /
translated: A specific feature does not arise from a non-specific feature,üîΩbecause it would follow that it would be causeless.

original: yang rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i dogs pa 'di spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i dogs pa 'di spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate this doubt,

original: rgyu dbye gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa dogs pa spang ba smos te /üîΩgang gis byas zhes pa ni su zhig byas shing /
analyzed: rgyu dbye gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa dogs pa spang ba smos te / gang gis byas zhes pa ni su zhig byas shing /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cause is differentiated by what?,‚Äù etc.

original: gang las byung zhes pa'o //üîΩrgyu'i dbye bas byas shes na /
analyzed: gang las byung zhes pa'o // rgyu'i dbye bas byas shes na /
translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù means ‚Äúby whom‚Äù and ‚Äúfrom what.‚Äù

original: gang gis rgyu'i dbye ba khyad par yin no zhes brjod na'o //
analyzed: gang gis rgyu'i dbye ba khyad par yin no zhes brjod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause is differentiated‚Äù means ‚Äúthe cause is specific.‚Äù

original: sngar gyi rgyu dbye ba nyid las so zhes te /
analyzed: sngar gyi rgyu dbye ba nyid las so zhes te /
translated: From the differentiation of the former cause.üîΩThe former

original: sngar gyi ste /üîΩsnga ma nyid @261b las yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi ste / snga ma nyid @261b las yin la /
translated: means the previous.

original: de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dbye ba las te /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dbye ba las te /
translated: It arises from the differentiation of the cause that generates it.

original: khyad par gyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbye ba las so //
translated: It arises from the differentiation of its special features.

original: de'i yang rgyu snga ma gang las khyad par du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yang rgyu snga ma gang las khyad par du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of that, from which it becomes special?‚Äù

original: de la yang slar rgyu'i khyad par las zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la yang slar rgyu'i khyad par las zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: it should be said that it arises from the differentiation of its cause.

original: de ltar phyi ma phyi ma'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams la snga ma snga ma'i khyad par las zhes lan brjod par bya la /
analyzed: de ltar phyi ma phyi ma'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams la snga ma snga ma'i khyad par las zhes lan brjod par bya la /
translated: Thus, it should be said that the special features of the latter arise from the special features of the former.

original: thug pa med pa mi 'dod pa cung zad du yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa mi 'dod pa cung zad du yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But this does not lead to an infinite regress, because

original: 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'i sngon gyi mtha' shes par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba la thog ma med pa'i sngon gyi mtha' shes par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: you accept that the prior limit of samsara is not known.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'bras bu phyin ci log pa yang rang gi las ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du gzhan gyis dogs pa ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa slong ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'bras bu phyin ci log pa yang rang gi las ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i ched du gzhan gyis dogs pa ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa slong ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that even a distorted effect is not its own action, he raises the question, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: rgyu gang las 'bras bu skyed pa'i khyad par 'bras bu 'byin pa'i mthu ste rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang las 'bras bu skyed pa'i khyad par 'bras bu 'byin pa'i mthu ste rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: If a cause is distinguished by the power to generate an effect, then it is a cause.

original: sngar gyi rgyu'i mthu las yin te /
analyzed: sngar gyi rgyu'i mthu las yin te /
translated: It is from the power of the previous cause.

original: sngar gyi de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las te /
analyzed: sngar gyi de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las te /
translated: From the previous cause that generates it,

original: mthu las so //üîΩgang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa 'bras bu skyes pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par phan tshun yongs su gyur pa'i lhag par gyur pa ni gags  dang ma tshang ba mi srid na /
analyzed: mthu las so // gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par gyis skyed pa 'bras bu skyes pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par phan tshun yongs su gyur pa'i lhag par gyur pa ni gags  dang ma tshang ba mi srid na /
translated: from its power.üîΩIf the special qualities of the effect that is generated by the special qualities of the co-operating causes are mutually transformed, then the special qualities of the effect will be generated by the special qualities of the co-operating causes.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed par byed do //
translated: If the special qualities of the effect are generated in that way, then the effect will be generated by the special qualities of the co-operating causes.

original: de lta bas na phyin ci ma log pa'i 'bras bu skyed par yang rang gi rgyu'i nus pas skyed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyin ci ma log pa'i 'bras bu skyed par yang rang gi rgyu'i nus pas skyed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the generation of an undistorted effect is generated by the power of its own cause.

original: des na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu las go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu las go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the effect of high status and the effect of definite goodness arise in accordance with the order of the causes that establish them.

original: de phyin ci log pa la'ang phyin ci log pa yin no zhes pa brgya la yang phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyin ci log pa la'ang phyin ci log pa yin no zhes pa brgya la yang phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the effect is not in the cause, then the effect would not be in error even if the cause were in error.

original: 'di yang nges par rang bzhin du smra ba rgyu dang bcas par mi 'dod na yang khas blang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang nges par rang bzhin du smra ba rgyu dang bcas par mi 'dod na yang khas blang bar bya ba ste /
translated: Even though the proponents of intrinsic nature do not assert that things have causes, they must accept this.

original: gzhan du na gtan tshigs med par dngos po rnams kyi rgyu med par dam 'cha' ba ji ltar grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gtan tshigs med par dngos po rnams kyi rgyu med par dam 'cha' ba ji ltar grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, how could they establish the thesis that things have no causes without a reason?

original: dam bcas pa tsam gyis de su zhig gis kyang 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam gyis de su zhig gis kyang 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No one can accept that thesis just on the basis of an assertion.

original: gtan tshigs kyi byed pas de sgrub par byed pa rang nyid kyis slar yang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir mo gsham yang yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi byed pas de sgrub par byed pa rang nyid kyis slar yang rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir mo gsham yang yin la /
translated: Since they prove that thesis by the power of a reason, they would again have to accept that things have causes.

original: bdag gi ma yang yin no zhes smra ba bzhin du dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig gis gnod par @262a * //
analyzed: bdag gi ma yang yin no zhes smra ba bzhin du dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig gis gnod par @262a * //
translated: It is like saying, ‚ÄúMy mother is also a woman.‚Äù

original: 'gyur te / de'i phyir ngos gnyis kyis thag pa'i zhags pa bzhin du dogs par sdug pa 'di chud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / de'i phyir ngos gnyis kyis thag pa'i zhags pa bzhin du dogs par sdug pa 'di chud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, like a rope with two ends, this theory of yours is to be rejected.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyu ni med ces brjod pa gtan tshigs dang ldan par //
analyzed: rgyu ni med ces brjod pa gtan tshigs dang ldan par //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no cause‚Äù ‚Äî is this assertion

original: dam bcas rang nyid kyis ni bsal ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: dam bcas rang nyid kyis ni bsal ba ma yin nam //
translated: not undermined by your own words?

original: 'on te gtan tshigs brjod la le lor gyur na ni //
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs brjod la le lor gyur na ni //
translated: If you are lazy about stating a reason,

original: dam bca' 'ba' zhig gis ni 'di la ci zhig 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dam bca' 'ba' zhig gis ni 'di la ci zhig 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: what is the point of this mere assertion?

original: de lta bas na 'di lta ba ngan pas sprul pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di lta ba ngan pas sprul pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, this theory is a fabrication by those with bad views,

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is undermined by valid knowledge.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin du smra ba bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin du smra ba bsal nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the proponents of intrinsic nature,

original: rnam pa gnyis pa bsgrub pa'i ched nyid du dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du de slong bar byed pas dbang phyug ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa bsgrub pa'i ched nyid du dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du de slong bar byed pas dbang phyug ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove the second, he says, ‚ÄúThe one who creates the world,‚Äù and so on, in order to teach that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the world.

original: dbang phyug rgyur smras bas kyang rang bzhin du byed pa'i 'dod pa sun phyung ba thos nas khur phyed phyogs par bsams nas /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur smras bas kyang rang bzhin du byed pa'i 'dod pa sun phyung ba thos nas khur phyed phyogs par bsams nas /
translated: Having heard the refutation of the assertion that ƒ™≈õvara is the creator, the opponent thinks that he has taken on half the burden.

original: khyad par brjod pa'i ched du khyed rnams kyis grogs nyid byas pa yin te zhes smras te /
analyzed: khyad par brjod pa'i ched du khyed rnams kyis grogs nyid byas pa yin te zhes smras te /
translated: In order to express his special opinion, he says, ‚ÄúYou have helped me.‚Äù

original: rgyu med par 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The world does not arise in various ways without a cause.

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa med par thal ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa med par thal ba'i phyir la /
translated: This is because it follows that the place and so on would be indeterminate.

original: sems pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis chu dang 'dam la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis chu dang 'dam la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that these things, such as water and mud, which are devoid of consciousness, have the ability to create various things.

original: zhes pa 'di brjod pa ni rigs pa yin /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di brjod pa ni rigs pa yin /
translated: This is the correct statement.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam pa sna tshogs pa sprul pa la mkhas pa 'gro ba'i ded dpon gcig pu /üîΩ'gro ba mtha' dag gi dang por gyur pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pas dngos po thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa de nyid mkhyen pa dbang phyug gi tshe
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das rnam pa sna tshogs pa sprul pa la mkhas pa 'gro ba'i ded dpon gcig pu / 'gro ba mtha' dag gi dang por gyur pa rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du nyams pa med pa'i nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pas dngos po thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la sogs pa de nyid mkhyen pa dbang phyug gi tshe
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is skilled in emanating various forms, the sole captain of transmigrating beings, the first of all transmigrating beings, and by possessing a permanent nature, he is endowed with the power of ability that is never impaired in any way.üîΩTherefore, the one who knows reality, the cause and effect of all things, the one who is the nature of ƒ™≈õvara, is not the object of the experience of those who see only a limited range.

original: ba'i bdag nyid tshu rol mthong ba mtha' dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i rgyu des na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di mtha' dag rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba zhes sems dang bcas pa las gzhan du smra bar nus zhes rigs pa can la sogs pas
analyzed: ba'i bdag nyid tshu rol mthong ba mtha' dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i rgyu des na g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba 'di mtha' dag rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba zhes sems dang bcas pa las gzhan du smra bar nus zhes rigs pa can la sogs pas
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for the NaiyƒÅyikas and so on to say that this entire moving and unmoving world is a world with a cause other than mind.

original: khyim du 'gro bas dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: khyim du 'gro bas dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: They say that because the world goes to the house of ƒ™≈õvara, ƒ™≈õvara is the cause of the world.

original: dbang phyug ces pa ni bde byed du grags pa yin la de nyid 'gro bas te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa ni bde byed du grags pa yin la de nyid 'gro bas te /
translated: ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù is known as ≈öiva. He is the world.

original: sna tshogs rgyu yin la 'byin pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyu yin la 'byin pa dang gnas pa dang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is diverse, and it is the cause of creation, persistence, and destruction.

original: @262b de lta bas na sna tshogs ma lus pa 'di nyid skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: @262b de lta bas na sna tshogs ma lus pa 'di nyid skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, all diversity is created by this alone.

original: gzhan du na sems med pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir ri dang chu klung dang sa gzhi dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa skye ba la brten pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems med pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir ri dang chu klung dang sa gzhi dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa skye ba la brten pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, since the cause would be devoid of mind, how could mountains, rivers, earth, oceans, and so on, which are based on creation, come into being?

original: sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa las slar yang 'di rnams skyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa las slar yang 'di rnams skyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: Since they are empowered by that which possesses mind, they are able to create again.

original: de'i byed pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are established by the activity of that alone.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: skyed ldan gzhan ma thams cad kyi //
analyzed: skyed ldan gzhan ma thams cad kyi //
translated: All other things that possess creation

original: dbang phyug rgyu ru rjod par byed //
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu ru rjod par byed //
translated: Are said to be caused by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: ri la sogs pa sems med pas //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa sems med pas //
translated: Since mountains and so on are devoid of mind,

original: rang nyid kyis ni brtson nus min //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni brtson nus min //
translated: They are not able to create by themselves.

original: dbang phyug rdza mkhan bzhin du sna tshogs sprul pa byed par ma gyur na //
analyzed: dbang phyug rdza mkhan bzhin du sna tshogs sprul pa byed par ma gyur na //
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara did not create the diversity like a potter,

original: ri rab 'di ni 'grub cing sa gzhi 'di min rgya mtsho ma yin nyid //
analyzed: ri rab 'di ni 'grub cing sa gzhi 'di min rgya mtsho ma yin nyid //
translated: This Meru is not established, nor is this earth, nor is this ocean.

original: nyi zla gza' skar ldan 'dir dgod pa mig yul 'di dag tu mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nyi zla gza' skar ldan 'dir dgod pa mig yul 'di dag tu mi 'gyur //
translated: This arrangement of the sun, moon, planets, and stars would not be visible.

original: yod pa'i phyir na dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa yin zhes 'ga' zhig smra //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir na dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa yin zhes 'ga' zhig smra // zhes brjod do //
translated: Someone says: ‚ÄúGod is the cause of the world because he exists.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na 'gro ba nyid sems pa med pa nyid dang / sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu dbang phyug yin no zhes bdag nyid brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba nyid sems pa med pa nyid dang / sna tshogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu dbang phyug yin no zhes bdag nyid brjod do zhe na /
translated: Thus, the world itself is mindless, and God is the cause of things of various natures.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply: This is what he says.

original: 'dis rang gi khyim du brtags pa'i gzhal yas dgod pa dang / tshig gis dgod pa spros pa'i tshogs kyis 'di ltar brjod pa la yang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa'i blo gros rtul po rnams la dga' bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis rang gi khyim du brtags pa'i gzhal yas dgod pa dang / tshig gis dgod pa spros pa'i tshogs kyis 'di ltar brjod pa la yang rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la mngon par zhen pa'i blo gros rtul po rnams la dga' bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The arrangement of the celestial mansion in his own house, the arrangement of the words, and the expression of this by the host of elaborations delights those of dull intelligence who are attached to their own tenets.

original: tshad ma dang bral ba la mkhas pa rnams la dga' ba skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang bral ba la mkhas pa rnams la dga' ba skye ba ma yin no //
translated: But it does not delight the wise who are free from error.

original: 'di ltar yang 'di gal te snying rje dang ldan pa yin na yang ci'i phyir srog chags rnams la dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su gdung bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'di gal te snying rje dang ldan pa yin na yang ci'i phyir srog chags rnams la dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su gdung bar byed /
translated: Thus, even if he is compassionate, why does he torment living beings in the hells, etc.?

original: de ltar gyur na yang snying rje dang ldan pa nyid dang pas rtogs par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang snying rje dang ldan pa nyid dang pas rtogs par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, he is compassionate because he is the one who should be known.

original: rang gis byas pa'i dam pa ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pas de la gtod pa dang / sel ba la gang zhig 'jug par 'gyur bas ji ltar snying rje med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i dam pa ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pas de la gtod pa dang / sel ba la gang zhig 'jug par 'gyur bas ji ltar snying rje med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can he be without compassion, since he is the one who is engaged in the destruction of the experience of the results of the evil actions committed by himself?

original: gang gis mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu myong ba 'di'i las snying rje dang ldan pas mi byed par 'gyur ba ji ltar mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gis mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu myong ba 'di'i las snying rje dang ldan pas mi byed par 'gyur ba ji ltar mi byed de /
translated: How is it that the compassionate one does not do what should not be done, since he experiences the results of the evil actions of others?

original: de la yang de'i bya ba ldan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de la yang de'i bya ba ldan pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because he is endowed with the activity of that,

original: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he is the cause of all those who are born.

original: gzhan yang de la bya ba byed pa @263a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang de la bya ba byed pa @263a * //
translated: Moreover, he is the one who performs the activity

original: ma yin na las de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: ma yin na las de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa yin nam ma yin /
translated: If not, then does he or does he not enjoy the results of that action?

original: gal te phyogs dang po yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po yin na /
translated: If the first case is true,

original: de skad du /üîΩrang gi bde ba sdug bsngal la //üîΩmi shes skye bo rang dbang min //
analyzed: de skad du / rang gi bde ba sdug bsngal la // mi shes skye bo rang dbang min //
translated: then how could it be said:üîΩ‚ÄúThe ignorant person is not independent

original: mtho ris dang ni g-yang sa ru //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni g-yang sa ru //
translated: with regard to his own happiness and suffering.

original: dbang phyug gis bskul 'gro bar 'gyur ;üîΩ/ zhes brjod pa der ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bskul 'gro bar 'gyur ; / zhes brjod pa der ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: He is impelled by God to goüîΩto heaven or to an abyss.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu thams cad la yang de'i byed pa khas blangs pa la 'di nyid kyis ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad la yang de'i byed pa khas blangs pa la 'di nyid kyis ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that God is the agent of all results, then it follows, absurdly, that this is not definite.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe 'di snying rje dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe 'di snying rje dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: If the second case is true, then if he is compassionate,

original: gal te 'bad pas grogs nyid du de la rtog par byed na /
analyzed: gal te 'bad pas grogs nyid du de la rtog par byed na /
translated: why does he not, with effort, imagine himself to be a friend of those beings?

original: de la btang snyoms ci'i phyir sgom par mi byed /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms ci'i phyir sgom par mi byed /
translated: Why does he not cultivate equanimity toward them?

original: 'on te byas pa'i las chud zos par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa des de'i 'bras bu myong bar bya zhes de longs spyod pa'i ched du byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byas pa'i las chud zos par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa des de'i 'bras bu myong bar bya zhes de longs spyod pa'i ched du byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Or, because the karma that is done would perish, it is certain that he experiences the result of that karma, and he does so in order to enjoy it.

original: yang 'di la bya ba mi byed na nges par des ji ltar nyams su myong bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'di la bya ba mi byed na nges par des ji ltar nyams su myong bar bya ste /
translated: But if he does not perform the action, how can he experience the result of that karma?

original: tshogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is separated from the collection of causes.

original: yang 'di ltar chud zos na yang nyes pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar chud zos na yang nyes pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it perishes, what is the problem?

original: 'bad pa nyid kyis snying rje can des 'grub par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa nyid kyis snying rje can des 'grub par rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable that the compassionate one accomplishes it through effort alone.

original: 'di ltar yang de 'dod pas 'jug pa nyid kyis de ma smin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang de 'dod pas 'jug pa nyid kyis de ma smin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he engages in it through desire, and it is not ripe.

original: des na dbang phyug gis bstan pa nyid du de la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug gis bstan pa nyid du de la 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be taught by the Almighty.

original: 'on te sems can rnams kyi las des bskul ba de yang snying rje dang ldan pas gnas par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sems can rnams kyi las des bskul ba de yang snying rje dang ldan pas gnas par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if he is urged by the karma of sentient beings, he is not able to remain compassionate.

original: kye ma dbang phyug rang nyid kyis 'di ltar gzhan du ched gsal bar 'gyur na 'ga' zhig las kyis yang dag par drangs pa'i bdag nyid dbang du gyur pa thob par ma gyur pa'i 'di ltar dbang phyug las kyang las nyid nus pa chen po dang ldan paüîΩnyid du gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kye ma dbang phyug rang nyid kyis 'di ltar gzhan du ched gsal bar 'gyur na 'ga' zhig las kyis yang dag par drangs pa'i bdag nyid dbang du gyur pa thob par ma gyur pa'i 'di ltar dbang phyug las kyang las nyid nus pa chen po dang ldan pa nyid du gsal bar byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: O Lord, if you were to make this clear to others, then it would be clear that karma, not you, is the powerful one who controls those whose nature is drawn by karma.

original: gang zhig stobs kyis yang dag par 'dren pa na dbang phyug chen po yang gnas par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang zhig stobs kyis yang dag par 'dren pa na dbang phyug chen po yang gnas par mi nus te /
translated: If you are the powerful one, then why is it that you are not able to control those who are drawn by karma?üîΩTherefore, you should rely on karma.üîΩThus, this is not a fault.

original: des na lhur las nyid rten par gyis shig / de lta bas na 'di ni nyams pa med pa nyid de /üîΩskyed pa po yang gang rnams la //
analyzed: des na lhur las nyid rten par gyis shig / de lta bas na 'di ni nyams pa med pa nyid de / skyed pa po yang gang rnams la //
translated: And also:üîΩWe pay homage to the truth that even the creator

original: nus med pas bden la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: nus med pas bden la phyag 'tshal //
translated: is powerless.

original: zhes pas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be said.

original: 'on te snying rje can ma yin na de'i tshe 'di 'dod chags dang bral ba min nam /
analyzed: 'on te snying rje can ma yin na de'i tshe 'di 'dod chags dang bral ba min nam /
translated: But if you are not compassionate, then are you not free from attachment?

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin /
translated: You are attached.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po yin na de'i tshe gal te yang snying rje dang @263b bral ba'i phyir 'gro ba la bde ba ster bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po yin na de'i tshe gal te yang snying rje dang @263b bral ba'i phyir 'gro ba la bde ba ster bar mi byed cing /
translated: If it is the first conception, then at that time, since he is devoid of compassion, he does not bestow happiness on the world.

original: sdug bsngal ba ci'i phyir skyed par byed ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ci'i phyir skyed par byed ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Why does he create suffering?

original: sdug bsngal yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig la gtod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig la gtod par byed pa yin la /
translated: Suffering is created for some due to the power of attachment and so on,

original: de yang 'di la med la /
analyzed: de yang 'di la med la /
translated: but that is not the case for him.

original: ji ltar na rgyu med pa nyid du 'gro ba sdug bsngal bar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu med pa nyid du 'gro ba sdug bsngal bar byed /
translated: How could he create suffering for the world without a cause?

original: rol pa'i don du sdug bsngal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rol pa'i don du sdug bsngal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say he creates suffering for the sake of play,

original: rol pa'i don du 'dod chags dang bral ba 'jug pas 'di nges par 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rol pa'i don du 'dod chags dang bral ba 'jug pas 'di nges par 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: then since one free of attachment engages for the sake of play, he is definitely free of attachment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thul ba rnams kyang rol pa'i don du 'jug pa ma mthong na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thul ba rnams kyang rol pa'i don du 'jug pa ma mthong na /
translated: Since those who possess attachment and so on and who have subdued the faculties are not seen to engage for the sake of play,

original: chags pa dang bral ba 'di ci'i phyir yang 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba 'di ci'i phyir yang 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: why would this one free of attachment engage?

original: sha zag tum po la sogs pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis gzhan sdug bsngal bas rol pa yang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sha zag tum po la sogs pa ma yin pa gzhan gyis gzhan sdug bsngal bas rol pa yang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible that one who is not a flesh-eating demon, etc. is delighted by the suffering of others.

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe 'di skye bo gzhan dang thun mong ba yod na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs yin na de'i tshe 'di skye bo gzhan dang thun mong ba yod na /
translated: But if it is the case that he is not free from passion, then if he exists in common with other people,

original: ji ltar dbang phyug ma yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug ma yin par mi rigs te /
translated: how is it not reasonable that he is not God?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa'i dbang du gyur pas 'jug pa'i 'gro ba dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa'i dbang du gyur pas 'jug pa'i 'gro ba dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the world, which is engaged in the bondage of passion, etc., is not God, since it is under the sway of the fetters of passion, etc.

original: gzhan du na de'i tshe de lta bu dang mtshungs pa gzhan de yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de'i tshe de lta bu dang mtshungs pa gzhan de yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that another who is similar to him would exist at that time.

original: 'khor ba'i btson rar bcings pa dang rang dbang can ma yin pa la de las gzhan bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa sprul pa la mkhas par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i btson rar bcings pa dang rang dbang can ma yin pa la de las gzhan bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa sprul pa la mkhas par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that he is skilled in the creation of the various forms of those who are imprisoned in the prison of samsara and are not independent, as if he were different from them.

original: gang zhig rnam pa 'di lta bu yang ji srid du dbang phyug tu khas len pa yod pa de ltar de nyid kyis khyed bslu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa 'di lta bu yang ji srid du dbang phyug tu khas len pa yod pa de ltar de nyid kyis khyed bslu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But as long as you accept God, you will be deceived by him in this way.

original: de lta bu'i byed pa por gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byed pa por gyur na 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: If he is an agent in this way, he is also a transformer.üîΩBut even so, is he essentially unchanging,

original: de ltar na yang 'di'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'am /üîΩrang bzhin gnas pa ma yin pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'di'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'am / rang bzhin gnas pa ma yin pa yin /
translated: or is he essentially changing?

original: gal te rang bzhin du gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir 'gro ba don med par sdug bsngal bar byed /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin du gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir 'gro ba don med par sdug bsngal bar byed /
translated: If he is essentially unchanging, why does he cause the world to suffer meaninglessly?üîΩWe never see someone who is essentially unchanging causing suffering for people without being harmed.üîΩBut if he is essentially changing, he is not the one who creates the world.üîΩBut if he is essentially changing, he is not the one who creates the world.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa ni gnod par byed pa med par skye bo sdug bsngal bar byed pa ma mthong ngo //üîΩ'on te log pa'i lam du 'gro ba nyid du gnod pa byas kyang gdung bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa ni gnod par byed pa med par skye bo sdug bsngal bar byed pa ma mthong ngo // 'on te log pa'i lam du 'gro ba nyid du gnod pa byas kyang gdung bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
