original: log pa'i lam du 'gro ba yang 'di nyid kyis byed pa yin la /
analyzed: log pa'i lam du 'gro ba yang 'di nyid kyis byed pa yin la /
translated: But if he is essentially changing, he is not the one who creates the world.üîΩBut if he is essentially changing, he is not the one who creates the world.

original: de ltar gyur par yang byas nas yang gdung bar @264a * //
analyzed: de ltar gyur par yang byas nas yang gdung bar @264a * //
translated: But if he is essentially changing, he is not the

original: byed pa de ni 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bsten pa bas kyang shin tu yang smad pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa de ni 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bsten pa bas kyang shin tu yang smad pa yin no //
translated: That action is even more reprehensible than serving the Lord of the World.

original: de rnams kyi rang nyid kyis nyes pa byas pa nyid kyis nyes pa po la chad pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang nyid kyis nyes pa byas pa nyid kyis nyes pa po la chad pa'i las byed do //
translated: They punish the criminal for his own wrongdoing.

original: slar yang 'di ni rang nyid kyis byed du bcug pas na khyad par che'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'di ni rang nyid kyis byed du bcug pas na khyad par che'o //
translated: Moreover, it is worse because he himself instigated it.

original: 'on te rang bzhin du mi gnas pa yin na de'i tshe mtho ris dang thar pa don du gnyer ba'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de brten pa la 'jug pa legs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin du mi gnas pa yin na de'i tshe mtho ris dang thar pa don du gnyer ba'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de brten pa la 'jug pa legs pa yin te /
translated: But if he is not a natural criminal, then it is good for those who have understanding and seek heaven and liberation to serve him.

original: smyon pa bsten pa ni smyon pa las gzhan gyis byed pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smyon pa bsten pa ni smyon pa las gzhan gyis byed pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right for anyone other than a madman to serve a madman.

original: 'di ltar yang mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams rab tu 'jug par byed de /
translated: Thus, those who have understanding engage in serving him because they desire the fruits of heaven and so on.

original: de yang yongs su ma nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yongs su ma nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: But since he is not of a definite nature, he does not arise from that.

original: de bsten pa'i phyin ci log kyang srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de bsten pa'i phyin ci log kyang srid pa yin no //
translated: It is possible that he is insane.

original: de ster ba la 'jug pas dad pa brtan pa'i dbang gis smyon pa la brten pas bdag nyid kyang smyon pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ster ba la 'jug pas dad pa brtan pa'i dbang gis smyon pa la brten pas bdag nyid kyang smyon pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: He is insane because he is engaged in giving, because he is engaged in the practice of faith, because he is engaged in the practice of the insane.

original: gzhan du na de bsten pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na de bsten pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could he be engaged in the practice of giving?

original: de la smyon pa gzhan gyis nyes pa ci zhig byas te /
analyzed: de la smyon pa gzhan gyis nyes pa ci zhig byas te /
translated: What fault has another insane person committed

original: gang gis na des sten par mi byed /
analyzed: gang gis na des sten par mi byed /
translated: that he does not practice giving to him?

original: de rnams ni nus pa khyad par can dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ni nus pa khyad par can dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are devoid of special ability.

original: skabs su bab pa la yang khyad par du gyur pa'i nus pa mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la yang khyad par du gyur pa'i nus pa mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But in the present case, a special ability is not seen.

original: 'gro ba thams cad khyad par du nus pa'i smyon pa zhes pa ni smyon pa las gzhan gyis smra bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad khyad par du nus pa'i smyon pa zhes pa ni smyon pa las gzhan gyis smra bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not proper to say that all beings are insane with a special ability, except for the insane.

original: de la 'di shin tu rnam par dpyad pa na 'ga' zhig tu gnas pa'i rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di shin tu rnam par dpyad pa na 'ga' zhig tu gnas pa'i rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: In this matter, when it is thoroughly investigated, there is no finding of anything at all.

original: de bas na blo gros ngan pa rnam par g-yo ba la gus pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na blo gros ngan pa rnam par g-yo ba la gus pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of revering the deceit of bad ideas?

original: de lta bas na 'di legs par dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di legs par dpyad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is a good analysis.

original: gang brjod pa /
analyzed: gang brjod pa /
translated: It was said:

original: bde dang sdug bsngal la ni 'byin byed med //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal la ni 'byin byed med //
translated: There is no creator of happiness and suffering.

original: gzhan gyis phyung zhes pa 'di blo ngan yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis phyung zhes pa 'di blo ngan yin //
translated: This idea that it is created by another is a bad idea.

original: 'jig rten rang gi las kyi zhags pas mdud //
analyzed: 'jig rten rang gi las kyi zhags pas mdud //
translated: The world is tied by the noose of its own karma.

original: byed par 'gyur zhes nga rgyal don med yin //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur zhes nga rgyal don med yin //
translated: To say that it is created is meaningless pride.

original: zhes so // de lta bas na rgyu gzhan mthong ba las gzhan pa'i rang dbang can sems pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'di nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // de lta bas na rgyu gzhan mthong ba las gzhan pa'i rang dbang can sems pa dang ldan pa'i byed pa po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no // 'di nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, apart from seeing other causes, there is no independent creator that possesses intention.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas re zhig dbang phyug gang @264b yin smros zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas re zhig dbang phyug gang @264b yin smros zhes gsungs te /
translated: To extensively teach this point, the Proponent of the Conclusion says, ‚ÄúFirst, tell me what this ƒ™≈õvara is.‚Äù

original: dbang phyug rgyur smra ba la 'dri ba yin la /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur smra ba la 'dri ba yin la /
translated: He is asking the Proponent of the Reason, who asserts that ƒ™≈õvara is the cause.

original: smros zhes pa ni brjod cig pa'o //
analyzed: smros zhes pa ni brjod cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTell me‚Äù means ‚Äúspeak.‚Äù

original: gang yin zhes pa ni khyed 'dod pa'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: gang yin zhes pa ni khyed 'dod pa'i dbang phyug go //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù refers to the ƒ™≈õvara that you assert.

original: re zhig gi smras 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gi smras 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: The opponent says: This is what is being said.

original: sa la sogs pa gang rnams dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las kyi 'bras bu mthong ba de la khyed rnams kyis dbang phyug tu brjod pa de gang yin la /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa gang rnams dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las kyi 'bras bu mthong ba de la khyed rnams kyis dbang phyug tu brjod pa de gang yin la /
translated: The earth and so on, which are seen to be the effect of the action of following and reversing, are said by you to be ƒ™≈õvara. What is that?

original: ma dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ru brtags par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ru brtags par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to impute a cause that is not observed to have the activity of following and reversing.

original: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is too much.

original: de lta bas na de nyid 'dod pas mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i khyad par nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid 'dod pas mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i khyad par nyid khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who desires reality should accept just the distinction of following and reversing that is seen.

original: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa dang sa bon la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The effect that is seen to follow from the earth, seed, and so on is not different from them.üîΩHow can it be posited as a requirement for their effect?

original: de ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu la mkho ba rnam par gzhag / de skad du /
analyzed: de ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu la mkho ba rnam par gzhag / de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang dag yod na gang nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: gang dag yod na gang nyid 'gyur //
translated: When these exist, that comes to be.

original: de dag las gzhan rtog pa na //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan rtog pa na //
translated: When there is conception of that which is other than these,

original: de rgyu nyid du thams cad na //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du thams cad na //
translated: all are posited as the cause of that.

original: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur // zhes brjod do //
translated: The causes would be without end.

original: 'on te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid dbang phyug yin no zhes gzhan gyis bsam pa len pas 'byung ba rnams she na zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'on te sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid dbang phyug yin no zhes gzhan gyis bsam pa len pas 'byung ba rnams she na zhes smos te /
translated: If you think that the elements, earth and so on, are God, then the elements would be God.

original: gal te 'byung ba rnams te sa la sogs pa rnams dbang phyug tu brjod na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba rnams te sa la sogs pa rnams dbang phyug tu brjod na /
translated: If you say that the elements, earth and so on, are God,

original: de'i tshe khas len pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe khas len pa nyid yin te /
translated: then you accept that God exists.

original: de lta mod ces pa ni 'di nyid yod du chug cig /'di la kho bo log par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod ces pa ni 'di nyid yod du chug cig /'di la kho bo log par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you say, Let it be so, we do not understand this,

original: sa la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa la 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa la 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is seen to be concomitant with earth and so on.

original: gcig tu ming tsam la yang ci zhig ngal te /
analyzed: gcig tu ming tsam la yang ci zhig ngal te /
translated: What is the fatigue in the case of mere names?

original: ming 'ga' zhig don gyis dbye ba stong pa'i ming tsam la'o //
analyzed: ming 'ga' zhig don gyis dbye ba stong pa'i ming tsam la'o //
translated: In the case of some names that are empty of the distinction of objects.

original: yang zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word only is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: ming tsam nyid la 'dir rtsom pa chen pos de sgrub pa'i ched du ci'i phyir ngal bar byed /
analyzed: ming tsam nyid la 'dir rtsom pa chen pos de sgrub pa'i ched du ci'i phyir ngal bar byed /
translated: Why do you tire yourself with great effort in this case, for the sake of establishing mere names?

original: nga'i sa la sogs par brjod la /
analyzed: nga'i sa la sogs par brjod la /
translated: You say ‚Äúearth‚Äù and so on,

original: khyod kyis yang de nyid la 'byung ba chen po'i dbang phyug ces pa la don la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis yang de nyid la 'byung ba chen po'i dbang phyug ces pa la don la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but in fact there is not the slightest difference in meaning between ‚Äúearth‚Äù and ‚Äúthe lord of the great elements.‚Äù

original: log par rtogs pa'i don gyis stong pa 'di la 'bras bu cung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'i don gyis stong pa 'di la 'bras bu cung zad kyang dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In this emptiness of the meaning of false imagination, not the slightest result is observed.

original: 'on te don gyi khyad par yod na /
analyzed: 'on te don gyi khyad par yod na /
translated: But if there is a difference in meaning,

original: de'i tshe 'di dbang phyug nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes @265a * //üîΩbstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dbang phyug nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes @265a * // bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time it is not reasonable that it is ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'on kyang zhes pa'i sgras lhag blo gros chen po can sa la sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / 'on kyang zhes pa'i sgras lhag blo gros chen po can sa la sogs pa rnams la /
translated: In order to teach this, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚ÄúBut,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyed rnams kyis dbang phyug nyid du brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis dbang phyug nyid du brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù [means] that it is not reasonable for you to imagine earth and so on to be ƒ™≈õvara.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have the characteristics of that [ƒ™≈õvara].

original: ji ltar byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: du ma ste sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i dngos po yin zhing /
analyzed: du ma ste sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i dngos po yin zhing /
translated: [Earth and so on] are manifold, having a variety of natures, and impermanent, being things that perish.

original: g-yo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ste /
translated: It is not moving.

original: shes pa nyid kyis bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: shes pa nyid kyis bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
translated: It is free from action by consciousness itself.

original: lha min te bsten par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: lha min te bsten par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: It is not a god, not the nature of something to be relied upon.

original: bsgom bya nyid de 'da' bar bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: bsgom bya nyid de 'da' bar bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: It is not to be meditated upon, not something to be transcended.

original: gus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not respectful.

original: mi gtsang ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba yang yin te /
translated: It is impure.

original: btsog pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa rnams la yang sa la sogs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsog pa'i phyir sa la sogs pa rnams la yang sa la sogs par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is filthy, it is possible that earth and so forth are earth and so forth.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i chu dang me dang rlung gang yin pa de rnams la de skad ces brjod de //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i chu dang me dang rlung gang yin pa de rnams la de skad ces brjod de //
translated: Earth and so forth are called earth and so forth, whatever water, fire, and wind there is in earth and so forth.

original: de dbang phyug de lta bu'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dbang phyug de lta bu'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is not the nature of that God.

original: rnam pa drug po 'di phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te sa la sogs pa dbang phyug ma yin na'o na nam mkha' dbang phyug yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po 'di phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro // gal te sa la sogs pa dbang phyug ma yin na'o na nam mkha' dbang phyug yin no zhe na /
translated: Because these six aspects are mistaken.üîΩIf earth and so forth are not God, then space is God, you say.

original: dbang phyug mkha' min zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang phyug mkha' min zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Space is not God, and so on.

original: nam mkha' yang dbang phyug tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang dbang phyug tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor is space the almighty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: g-yo med phyir te rang bzhin dang bral ba yin pas g-yo ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: g-yo med phyir te rang bzhin dang bral ba yin pas g-yo ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is motionless, because it is devoid of nature, it is motionless.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pas kyang bya byed med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pas kyang bya byed med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not an agent of action even by the desire of others.

original: 'on bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is the self!

original: bdag min te /
analyzed: bdag min te /
translated: It is not the self.

original: sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it has been refuted earlier.

original: sngar nyid du rgyas par bdag bkag pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar nyid du rgyas par bdag bkag pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa yin te /
translated: Because the self has been refuted extensively earlier, it is devoid of nature.

original: 'di ri bong gi ra dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ri bong gi ra dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: This is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'on te de ltar na yang brtag par bya ba ma yin na che ba'i bdag nyid las 'di tshu rol mthong bas 'di 'di ltar yin no zhes de'i phyir rang bzhin rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na yang brtag par bya ba ma yin na che ba'i bdag nyid las 'di tshu rol mthong bas 'di 'di ltar yin no zhes de'i phyir rang bzhin rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But even if it is not to be examined, because of its greatness, it is not possible to analyze its nature, since this is seen only by those with limited vision, who say, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: bsam min pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam min pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not to be thought of,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'di bsam pa las 'das pa'i bdag nyid chen po yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di bsam pa las 'das pa'i bdag nyid chen po yin na /
translated: If this is a great nature that is beyond thought,

original: de'i tshe bsam pa yin pa yang bsam pa'i lam las shin tu 'das pa'i dbang phyug byed pa po ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsam pa yin pa yang bsam pa'i lam las shin tu 'das pa'i dbang phyug byed pa po ste /
translated: At that time, the existent is the inconceivable, the powerful, the agent.

original: dus gcig tu skyed par byed pa yang bsam min pa ste /
analyzed: dus gcig tu skyed par byed pa yang bsam min pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable is also the producer of the effect at one time.

original: dpyad par bya ba ma yin pa brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba ma yin pa brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of expressing the inconceivable?üîΩWhat is the use of expressing the inconceivable?

original: brjod pa ci @265b dgos 'di byed pa po nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa ci @265b dgos 'di byed pa po nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to express the inconceivable because the agent is also inconceivable.

original: de ltar yin mod 'di shin tu mtshon par dka' ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bsam par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yin mod 'di shin tu mtshon par dka' ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bsam par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: Although that is so, it is not possible to conceive the inconceivable because it is a nature that is very difficult to illustrate.

original: 'bras bu de ni skye ba po thams cad kyi thun mong du rtogs pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes smra ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni skye ba po thams cad kyi thun mong du rtogs pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes smra ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The effect is inconceivable because it is realized in common by all beings.

original: des skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des skyed ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In consideration of that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe inconceivable is produced by that,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Although the effect is inconceivable,

original: de ltar na yang gang gis na //
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang gis na //
translated: in that case, by what is it produced?

original: des skyed 'dod pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: des skyed 'dod pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What is it that he wishes to create?

original: zhes te / dbang phyug bsam gyis mi khyab che ba'i bdag nyid 'bras bu ci zhig skyed cing sprul pa 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes te / dbang phyug bsam gyis mi khyab che ba'i bdag nyid 'bras bu ci zhig skyed cing sprul pa 'dod do //
translated: What result does the inconceivable, great ƒ™≈õvara create and emanate?

original: mngon par 'dod pa yang yin /üîΩgzhan gyi dogs pa dgod pa'i tshul gyis bdag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa yang yin / gzhan gyi dogs pa dgod pa'i tshul gyis bdag yin no zhe na /
translated: He is the one who is desired.üîΩIf it is said that he is the self, in the manner of setting forth the doubts of others,

original: bdag des skyed pa yin no zhes bdag 'dod na de 'gegs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag des skyed pa yin no zhes bdag 'dod na de 'gegs par byed pa yin te /
translated: if it is asserted that the self is the creator, that is refuted,

original: 'di rtag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di rtag pa ma yin nam /
translated: because is he permanent?

original: kye 'di rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kye 'di rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Oh, he is not permanent!

original: khyed rtag par 'dod pa yin na des ji ltar mi byed 'gyur /
analyzed: khyed rtag par 'dod pa yin na des ji ltar mi byed 'gyur /
translated: If you assert that he is permanent, how could he not create?

original: gzhan du na de rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, his permanence would be undermined.

original: yod cing rgyu med pa ni rtag pa yin no zhes pa'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yod cing rgyu med pa ni rtag pa yin no zhes pa'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since it would follow that he would lack the characteristics of permanence, he would exist without a cause.

original: gzhan la yang de'i skyed pa'i bya ba ma dmigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la yang de'i skyed pa'i bya ba ma dmigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the activity of creating is not observed in anything else,üîΩhere NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, Earth and so on are not observed as the creator,

original: 'dir sa sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir sa sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang yid rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang yid rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include water, fire, wind, space, time, direction, and mind.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtag pa yin te /
translated: Their nature is permanent.

original: de yang des byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang des byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And that is not produced by them,

original: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams rtag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that the atoms of earth and so on are permanent.

original: rags pa'i gzugs la yang de'i bya ba 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa'i gzugs la yang de'i bya ba 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the activity of that is blocked in gross form.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang brtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because space and so on are imagined.

original: yon tan la sogs pa yang dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa yang dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because qualities and so on are to be analyzed.

original: dbang phyug ces pa ni dbang phyug kyang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dis bdag nyid byed pha ma yin no //üîΩshes pa shes bya la skyes dang // zhes pa la /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces pa ni dbang phyug kyang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dis bdag nyid byed pha ma yin no // shes pa shes bya la skyes dang // zhes pa la /
translated: And because ƒ™≈õvara is permanent.

original: shes pa'ang shes bya las skyes pa //
analyzed: shes pa'ang shes bya las skyes pa //
translated: And because consciousness arises from the object of consciousness.üîΩConsciousness also arises from the object of consciousness.

original: 'ang zhes pa ni 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du shes bya la dmigs nas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir de yang des byed pa ma @266a * //
analyzed: 'ang zhes pa ni 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du shes bya la dmigs nas rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir de yang des byed pa ma @266a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that since it operates observing the object of knowledge for as long as cyclic existence lasts, it is not produced by that.

original: yin no // bde sdug las la yin zhes pa ni las ni dge ba dang mi dge bas te /
analyzed: yin no // bde sdug las la yin zhes pa ni las ni dge ba dang mi dge bas te /
translated: Karma is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: ji ltar srid par bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar srid par bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: As is possible, it is also pleasure and pain.üîΩIt arises from the ripening of the desired and the undesired.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba de la yang de'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba de la yang de'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not produced by that.

original: de ltar yin pas na ;
analyzed: de ltar yin pas na ;
translated: Since that is the case,

original: de yis gang zhig bskyed pa smos //
analyzed: de yis gang zhig bskyed pa smos //
translated: say what is produced by that!

original: zhes te / da ni dbang phyug des ci zhig sprul cing spros pa yin pa smros shig /
analyzed: zhes te / da ni dbang phyug des ci zhig sprul cing spros pa yin pa smros shig /
translated: Now say what is emanated and emanated by that God!

original: de ltar na de'i nus pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yang dmigs pa ma yin na de ji ltar 'gro ba'i skyed pa por brjod /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i nus pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yang dmigs pa ma yin na de ji ltar 'gro ba'i skyed pa por brjod /
translated: Since that power is not observed anywhere, how can it be said to be the producer of the world?

original: da ni thams cad thun mong ba'i skyon rgyu la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni thams cad thun mong ba'i skyon rgyu la zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now the common error of all is stated:

original: 'di ltar yang 'gro ba'i rgyur rtag pa'am mi rtag pa 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'gro ba'i rgyur rtag pa'am mi rtag pa 'gyur ba yin /
translated: In this way, the cause of the world would be permanent or impermanent.

original: rtag pa nyid du de smra ba rnams kyis 'di yongs su brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du de smra ba rnams kyis 'di yongs su brtags pa yin te /
translated: But the proponents of permanence have imagined this cause to be permanent.

original: de la gal te rtag pa yin na rgyu ste byed pa po la thog ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te rtag pa yin na rgyu ste byed pa po la thog ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is permanent, then the cause, that is, the agent, has no beginning.

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu la thog mag la yod de ;
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu la thog mag la yod de ;
translated: At that time, the effect has no beginning.

original: de la 'bras bu'i dang po ga las yod /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i dang po ga las yod /
translated: How can the first effect exist?

original: de'i 'bras bu'i bskyed par bya ba rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir thog ma ga las 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i bskyed par bya ba rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir thog ma ga las 'gyur te /
translated: How can the first effect arise from a cause whose nature is always present?

original: ma yin no zhes pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes pa'i don yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúno‚Äù is that it cannot.

original: rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las 'bras bu yang ste de'i bskyed par bya ba rgyun ma chad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu nye bar gnas pa'i grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las 'bras bu yang ste de'i bskyed par bya ba rgyun ma chad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The effect also arises from a cause whose nature is always present, that is, its effect arises uninterruptedly.

original: de'i phyir de'i nus pa thogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i nus pa thogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the effect always arises without obstruction of the cause‚Äôs power.

original: de gang gis na rtag tu mi byed de /
analyzed: de gang gis na rtag tu mi byed de /
translated: How could it not always act?

original: 'bras bu thams cad skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad skyed par mi byed /
translated: It does not produce all effects.

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bu brgyal chad par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bu brgyal chad par gal 'gyur /
translated: Thus, some say that the effect is not produced from the cause.

original: yang na gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Or else, it should be explained differently:

original: gal te dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug 'gro ba'i byed pa po ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If ƒ™≈õvara is not the agent of the world,

original: ji ltar zhig pa'i rjes la dang por 'di chags pa'i char 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhig pa'i rjes la dang por 'di chags pa'i char 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could he be the cause of the world after its destruction?

original: 'di la rgyu la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: thog ma med pa nas byung pa'i 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas byung pa'i 'khor ba yin la /
translated: Cyclic existence has been occurring since beginningless time.

original: rgyu de las las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thog ma ste /
analyzed: rgyu de las las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thog ma ste /
translated: The cause of that is the beginning of the characteristics of karma, affliction, and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' gal te yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' gal te yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the prior limit does not exist,

original: 'bras bu ste sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten chags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thog ma dang po'i rtsom pa gang las yod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ste sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten chags pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thog ma dang po'i rtsom pa gang las yod de /
translated: how could the beginning of the effect‚Äîthe world of sentient beings and the world of the environment‚Äîthe characteristics of creation and so on‚Äîexist?

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not exist.

original: @266b thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba yang sems can rnams las kyi dbang gis gnas shing chags pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid rnams 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @266b thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba yang sems can rnams las kyi dbang gis gnas shing chags pa dang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid rnams 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samsara has no beginning because sentient beings are born and die in dependence on karma.

original: de brjod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de brjod pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: bde sdug las las yin zhes pa 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bde sdug las las yin zhes pa 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Pleasure and pain are from karma.

original: yang na 'dir yang dbang phyug nyid las bsams nas rgyu zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'dir yang dbang phyug nyid las bsams nas rgyu zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Or, in this context, the word cause refers to God,

original: rgyu dbang phyug la thog ma yod pa ma yin na 'jig pa'i dus na yang de'i nus pa ma nyams pa nyid kyis che ba'i bdag nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir 'bras bu des byas pa'i chags dang 'jig pa'i thog ma'i mtshan nyid kyi dang por ga las 'gyur
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug la thog ma yod pa ma yin na 'jig pa'i dus na yang de'i nus pa ma nyams pa nyid kyis che ba'i bdag nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir 'bras bu des byas pa'i chags dang 'jig pa'i thog ma'i mtshan nyid kyi dang por ga las 'gyur
translated: because if God, the cause, has no beginning, then even at the time of destruction, since his power is not impaired, he is accepted as having a great nature. Therefore, how could there be a beginning characterized by the creation and destruction of the world?

original: / rtag pa nyid yin pas de'i rgyu rtag tu nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rtag pa nyid yin pas de'i rgyu rtag tu nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir chags pa la sogs pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he is permanent, his cause is always powerful, and therefore creation and so on would also be permanent.

original: des na rtag pa nus pa dang ldan pa la der 'chags pa la sogs pa'i thog mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag pa nus pa dang ldan pa la der 'chags pa la sogs pa'i thog mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the permanent, which possesses the ability to create, would not be the beginning of creation and so on.

original: des na ji ltar 'chags pa la sogs pa la de'i bya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'chags pa la sogs pa la de'i bya bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be the agent of creation and so on?

original: gzhan yang 'di byed pa por 'gyur na de'i tshe rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir rtag tu mi byed ces te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di byed pa por 'gyur na de'i tshe rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir rtag tu mi byed ces te /
translated: Moreover, if it were the agent, then because it is permanent, why does it not always create?

original: 'chags pa la sogs pa ni zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'chags pa la sogs pa ni zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcreation and so on‚Äù is a remainder.

original: 'di ltar yang gal te 'chags par byed na de'i tshe de'i rgyu byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rtag tu de nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gal te 'chags par byed na de'i tshe de'i rgyu byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rtag tu de nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, if it creates, then because it has the nature of being the cause of creation, it would always create.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: So too, endurance and destruction should be stated.

original: dus gcig tu 'am 'chags pa la sogs pa'i bya ba de yir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu 'am 'chags pa la sogs pa'i bya ba de yir 'gyur ro //
translated: The activity of creation and so on would be simultaneous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu la rgyun chad pa med pa de'i 'bras bu yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu la rgyun chad pa med pa de'i 'bras bu yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the effect would not be interrupted because the cause is not interrupted.

original: gzhan snga ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan snga ma yin no //
translated: The former is different.

original: 'on te de ltar na yang 'di rtag tu nus pa'i rang bzhin gal te yin pa lta na yang brgya la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang bral bas mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na yang 'di rtag tu nus pa'i rang bzhin gal te yin pa lta na yang brgya la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang bral bas mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But if, even so, it is of the nature of permanent potency, then, even if it is devoid of the cooperating conditions, it does not act.

original: de ni gzhan la ltos pa min //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la ltos pa min //
translated: It does not depend on another.

original: zhes te / nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu'i dbang phyug de'o //
analyzed: zhes te / nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu'i dbang phyug de'o //
translated: That is, the cause, God, is of the nature of potency.

original: ni zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gzhan lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
analyzed: gzhan lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos te /
translated: It does not depend on another, i.e., the cooperating conditions,

original: rtag pa nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod na de'i ltos pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod na de'i ltos pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it existed as a permanent, potent nature, it would be illogical for it to depend on another.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis khyad par du bogs byar med pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis khyad par du bogs byar med pa yin te /
translated: It is not enhanced by the distinction of permanence,

original: gzhan la ltos pa zhes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa zhes pa'am /
translated: because if it were to depend on another,

original: khyad par gzhan 'byung ba ni de la tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan de las skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan 'byung ba ni de la tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gzhan de las skyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or if another distinction arose, it would follow that it would be produced from another, a different nature.

original: khyad @267a * //
analyzed: khyad @267a * //
translated: From the distinction,

original: par las tha dad pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyes pas de rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par las tha dad pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyes pas de rgyu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect would be produced, and it would not be the cause.

original: 'di de'i khyad par yin no zhes pa 'brel bar sems pa na ni thug pa med pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di de'i khyad par yin no zhes pa 'brel bar sems pa na ni thug pa med pa nyid dang 'brel pa ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that the relation is ‚Äúthis is its particular,‚Äù then the relation is not established because of infinite regress.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: gal te bya ba cung zad cig / yod na gzhan la ltos 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bya ba cung zad cig / yod na gzhan la ltos 'gyur na //
translated: If there is some activity, it would depend on another.

original: dngos gang cung zad mi byed la //
analyzed: dngos gang cung zad mi byed la //
translated: But how could a thing that does not do anything

original: ci phyir 'ga' zhig gis ltos 'gyur //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: ci phyir 'ga' zhig gis ltos 'gyur // zhes brjod do //
translated: depend on something else?

original: lhan cig byed pa yod pa yin pas de lta na yang de rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yod pa yin pas de lta na yang de rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Even if the co-operating causes exist, they would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: re zhig gang rnams rtag pa yin na rdul phra rab la sogs pa de rnams yod pa'i dngos po ma tshang ba mi srid do //
analyzed: re zhig gang rnams rtag pa yin na rdul phra rab la sogs pa de rnams yod pa'i dngos po ma tshang ba mi srid do //
translated: First, if they are permanent, then the atoms, etc., would not be possible as incomplete entities.

original: de la rag las pa'i nye ba rnams nye ba dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rag las pa'i nye ba rnams nye ba dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: The near ones, which depend on them, would not be separated from the near ones.

original: mi rtag pa rnams kyang de la rag las pas skye bo'i nye ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams kyang de la rag las pas skye bo'i nye ba rnams yin te /
translated: The impermanent ones are also near ones, because they depend on them.

original: gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral bas mi byed do zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang bral bas mi byed do zhes brjod pa /
translated: By what are they not produced, so that it is said that they are not produced because of the absence of the co-operating causes?

original: ci'i phyir na ma tshang ba zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na ma tshang ba zhes bya ba yin /
translated: Why are they called ‚Äúincomplete‚Äù?
